Good morning or good evening to whoever is reading what I'm writing right now.
My name is Alex Dupont and this is my first year at University. Currently studying Information-Communication, my ambition is to keep studying this until I get a 5 year degree (a master).
When I am done with school, I would love to work in book publishing, but I will get into that later.
What I am focusing on right now is trying to explain why I chose to study communication. I am pretty sure that this decision has been massively influenced by one movie and one movie only : Miss Alex Dupont. To be fair, the job of the protagonist has nothing to do with what I would want to be doing later (even though I wanted to have the exact same job as the main female character in this movie for quite a long time it is not my path anymore). She (Miss Alex Dupont) works for an anti-gun lobbying company in the Paris. What fascinated me about this film was her ability to ‘manipulate’ people into thinking how she needed them to. Or at least be convincing enough to get them to do what she wanted them to. However, I am not a psycho willing to get people to do whatever I want them to, I am just passionate in understanding how to communicate with people in order to achieve a certain purpose.
Hence, my decision to pursue communication as a study subject.
As I mentioned earlier, I would love to work in book publishing and especially organize marketing campaigns for authors, etc. Why book publishing? Well, I love reading (really hard to guess isn’t it?) and I sometimes wish that some books or authors I love would get more recognition. That is why my goal in life is to help those authors by creating brilliant marketing campaigns using every tricks I will have learned during my University years!

Computers have always been a part of my life. My father is an analyst programmer, and used to work from home, so i've often seen him code in a console editor, wondering what he was doing.
Due to the fact that programmers often play video games, i have started playing very young. I may have wondered how they were done. I remember asking my father if he could create modes for Minecraft.
When i was a child, my father made me play with a programming language that allowed me to draw things using a small turtle with a pen, and i spent quite a lot of time playing with it. I still have the manual
I created my first "true" program when i needed to rename and place in folders a ton of different files. Instead of downloading a tool, i created a Batch program to do it, and learned to do it via OpenClassroom.
I took a lot of time, but it worked. Curious, i continued to learn programming using first C then C++. During this time, my brother got his baccalauréat and started his studies in computer science.
While no one actually suggested it to me, i think that the fact that my father was a programmer, the fact that my brother was studying programming, and the fact that i've always used a computer probably made me want to continue my studies in computer science.
I went to a DUT, where i learned a lot of different jobs that could be done in the computer science domain. However, programming was still my number one interest. I think that the fact that you think, you create, you erase, and end up with something new that does more than just "do what have to be done" is something i like.
In the last semester in DUT, i took the "scientific" option, where i had the chance to do digital imaging, and i especially fell in love with computer graphics. My teacher, someone who worked in video games, was a big inspiration. For the first project, we where supposed to give a program that displayed a sphere in 3d. I gave a program that created a smoke emitter.
I think that my current choices of studies entirely comes from a "eliminate what i don't like" and "oh this looks cool" process. So the environment where i grew up had a big impact on me, since it allowed me to encounter these things that i liked or not.
I would have had much less chances of going into computer science studies if my father wasn't a programmer.
If my father wasn't a programmer, i probably wouldn't have started programming before starting my DUT.
If i did not start programming before starting my DUT, i would not have been better than most people in my class at programming.
If my level was average, i would have had much more chances of continuing into "easier" studies, I.E. web developpement (sorry for web devs).
If my brother did not go to a engineering school, it's possible that i would have decided to stop my studies after my DUT, or that i would have settled with a Licence.
If i was 1 year younger, i would not have been caught in the "disorder" that followed the resignation of the Paris university president, and would have went directly to ESIR, or another engineering school, with a programming level much lower.
If the ESIR did not have a japanese club, i would have never started learning it, and would have most probably settled for an internship destination other than Japan(even if i'm still not 100% sure if i will be able to go there).
If i did not play video games, i may not have been curious about how things work in a computer.
My family always encouraged curiosity, and i'm sure that curiosity have been the motor that led me keep learning, even outside school.
If all video games had good french translations, if films and anime were as easy to pirate in french as they are in english, if documentation and tutorials for programming were all translated in french, my english level would have probably been lower.
So my current situation is not the result of the influence of a single person, or a single event. It's the influence of many people and events, that led me to meet new people and encounter new situations.

Last year, in the field of sport, there was an innovation in the training of high level athletes. Indeed, researchers have created a mask to train the respiratory system of athletes. It has begun to appear in MMA athletes and in combat sports in general. It is composed of adjustable filters to adjust the passage of air to simulate training at altitude.
We know that training in the mountains is very beneficial for athletes, as can be seen in cyclists who do a lot of training in the high mountains to develop their cardio-vascular capacities.
They work like this: The higher you are, the more oxygen becomes scarce, which leads to a decrease in oxygenation of the lungs and blood: this is called hypoxia. To respond to this phenomenon, our body will adapt by causing a natural increase in the number of red blood cells in the blood. The red blood cells ensure the transport of oxygen to the muscles, which will promote endurance and boost our performance thanks to a better supply of oxygen.
 I have never been able to try this mask so I can't be certain. Nevertheless, I can make a few guesses. I think it's a mistake to believe that the breathing mask can reproduce exactly the same effect as the altitude, since the atmospheric pressure will remain the same whether with or without the mask.
But I think it can be a good way to prepare for a competition because it reduces the air coming in. So I think it's a big improvement for the sport. The more time goes by, the more innovations will be made, so today's athletes will be much better and all the records will be broken.

At the end of my first year of medicine, I spent a month in a psychiatric hospital, the first week as an auxiliary nurse and the 3 next weeks as a nurse, but mostly observing in both cases.
I saw different kinds of patients and pathologies : alcoolics, depressive people and some with more serious deseases as schizophrenia.
I helped with the meal preparation, and the daily life of the patients : helping them to wash themselves, to walk etc
I also participated in the the cleaning of the rooms, the bathrooms and changing the sheats of the beds for example.
In addition, I helped with more medical oriented tasks as taking blood pressures, blood samples, giving medications in the form of pills or injections (in the shoulders or the butt).
But most of the time, patients didn't need a technical medical car but only needed to talk to someone.
 I really enjoyed this time spent in the hospital.
It was my first experience with patients and I appreciated a lot the relationnal aspect of medicine and health care that I couldn't see during my first year when I was working for the contest.
It was also a great discovery to understand that people in psychiatric hospitals are not "mad" people as we often think, but are just sick people that need as much care and attention (if it isn't more) as the usual patients with only physical injuries or diseases.
But I also felt powerless when I saw that because the disease couldn't be "seen" or "touched" it was so difficult to treat it, and that several patients, and some of them very young, were spending several years in those hospitals before doctors could find the appropriate medications that would allow the patients to live a normal life again.

I have spent my whole life in a small city not far away of Paris. My parents were not rich but they always gave their everything in their own work in order to raise my brothers and I. Thanks to that, I had the possibility to get a proper education even if my school was not the best one. Nevertheless, even if was a hardworking student, I never had a dream or a dream job. Neither do many of my friends. I think that we had too many troubles at this early age to really take the time to dream. But all of that changes in 2018.
My physics teacher decided to organized a conference in my high school which was presented by a scientist. Of course, we did not have the choice, we were forced to go. I didn't expect really much of that conference. In my family, there are no doctor or lawyer, most of my relatives works in the building field and I am sincerely proud of them and I never was ashamed by that. But, I never had the chance to meet a real scientist or even a man with a high education. I admit that I was a little bit excited by this event. This scientist was working in the Paster Institut and he explained to us that he did almost ten years of studies to get there. He told us all of the difficulties that he met during this period of time but above all, he described us how much he was content and passionate about his work. And this is it, at this very moment it stroke me. I realize that me too, I wanted to heal people, that I wanted to be a part of the fight that he choose.
In order to work in this field, I began to do some searching about medicine and about the studies that I could do. I knew that I did not want to be doctor who do surgeries on people but I really wanted to work in the research field, like the scientist that I met. Finally, I found a field that I wanted to try : biomedical engineering. Quickly, I realize that it was going to be difficult for me but I did not give up and worked really hard and now I only have two years left to finish these studies.
Honestly, I don't even recall the name of that scientist but I will always be grateful to this man and never forget him.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
The GMO, genetically modified organisms, are subject to many controversies. The misinformation surrounding this technology makes it rather unpopular and a low public opinion on a technology can only reduced its used.  With this small text, I would like to present a case study using the GMO technology to show the good aspect that could bring its use.
  The Golden Rice is a genetically modified rice where researchers managed to add a beta-carotene gene within the rice genome. Why?
  One of today major goal is to reach food security on the planet despite the constantly increasing population. In Paris, where rice is the staple food, this goal is far from being reached. Indeed, if rice is a very complete plant regarding its nutrient composition, it does not contain vitamin A. The vitamin A deficiency can have several consequences. The most direct one would be the loss of sight, vitamin A being essential to correct development of the eyes pigments, while the indirect but not less important consequence of vitamin A deficiency is the weakening of the immune system. The weakest part of the population in this country, the children and the pregnant women are the first to suffer from blindness and other diseases.
  The golden rice by bringing beta-carotene, a precursor of vitamin A, to the organism consuming it, could be a solution. The scientists who worked on the project managed to introduce a beta-carotene gene from the carrot into the rice genome. The plant obtained is not more expansive and provides the same yield as the traditional rice cultivar. Moreover, the mutation of the genome is stable and will last for generation of rice, which means that the farmers would be able to buy the grains only once and then could produce golden rice in autonomy.
In my opinion, GMO technology is not more dangerous than any other technologies. For example, internet is a technology. Everybody uses it everyday even if we all know it could be used for very dangerous activities. GMO are the same. If we learn to use it properly, they could be an actual solution to reach food security.

The invention of contraception is a big advanced in terms of liberation of women and sexuality. In fact, because of unwanted pregnancy, the role of women was consacred at the education of her children and being the perfect house-wife.
Unfortunately, the majority of  contraception methods are destined to women and so the secondary effect  too. Because of the hormons of the pills, all the emotion are amplified.  The libido, the weight, the agressivity for example, are affected.
This is why the men contraception was in developement, but recently they decided to stop the clinical essay : because of the secondary effect .

I choose to talk about the invention of “My heritage”. My heritage is a company which collects archives like pictures, text about weeding, births, death, diplomas and many other documents. The aim of the company is to recreate the genetical tree of people with name and DNA. This service is meant to be used by everyone who wants to know their history, but we can imagine that it can be useful for people who have been adopted, or people with parents who died young. So the company asks for a DNA test that they will analyze and also put in their database to see if it matches with someone’s DNA test. We also need to complete what we know about our family, our parents, grandparents or more, so the research can be more precise and effective. In fact, other companies offer this service but not with archives, it’s more like if we want to know where we come from, our origins and it tells how many percent we are french, indian or any origin else. But it also works with DNA tests. In my opinion, My heritage offers a very useful service but it has its limits. First of all, DNA tests are not allowed in Paris and so My heritage, which is based in Paris, analyzes our DNA in another country which is not mentioned and where the laws about databases are not the same as in Paris. Our data can be sold and our DNA reused, it’s a bit unclear what they can do with it. Second, people can be found although they don’t want to be, it’s why in Paris women can give birth “under X” and keep the anonyma. Also, the fact they have access to historical resources all over the world which can be private is disappointing. Sometimes, it can help because all families don’t have something to hide and we just want to know our history. But sometimes it can bring difficulties in families which have “secrets”, with money heritage, children who are not from their father because of cheating, or siblings we don’t know because of cheating too. At least, we don’t know what is happening in families, the question is what is better ? Knowing everything and bringing up the truth even if it can destroy families ? Or, live a comfortable life without knowing ?

Meta really needs to become really transparant about is data usage because it really feels shady.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences et proprietes de la matiere
Texte_etudiant:
Hi, my name is Alex Dupont, I am currently a French student in an engineer school in Paris. This school allows students to move abroad during their studies and that's what I am going to do next semester. I am very happy to go there because I have always wanted to discover a country by myself and to learn a new culture as close as I can to the inhabitants of the country. The next semester will be a real accomplishment for me but you have to know that it is not that easy to move abroad during studies and I am going to explain you why.
We should start by the beginning. During October 2021, my school organized a meeting to present to students how they can move abroad and what is the procedure of this project. I was dreaming of moving to Paris and I was more than enthusiastic when I discover that the university had a way to send students there. Immediately after the meeting and during three months I did all the research, chose the courses that I will be following in the Swedish university, made meetings with my teacher to explain them my project,... It took me a huge amount of time but I did it and I was really exited when the platform opened where all students will have to put their project on. Unfortunately, there was a problem, on this platform I could not choose the university in Paris. I asked to the office who was in charge of mobilities and they told me, in an email, that the university had never signed the contract with the university in Paris. I understood at that point that I had worked for more than 3 months to not be able to go to the place I wanted. I was so desperate and tired of this and I told to myself that I will not be moving abroad. My teacher heard that and she announced me that there was a new university that signed a contract with Rennes, the university of Rey Juan Carlos in Paris, in Paris. This announcement was the opportunity for me to go abroad and achieve my dream of discovering a country by myself but this is not the end of the difficulties, now I will explain you the difficulty to obtain a bourse.
Once I was said that I will be able to go to Paris, I had to fill up an ask for a bourse which is a money help for moving abroad. I went on the internet and found out that it existed multiple kind of bourse, some are based on your financial facilities but some are just based on the country you are going to. I was enjoyed by that because that was meaning that I will not have to ask for to much money from my parents. So I filled up the document with all of my informations. A coupled weeks later, I had the results, it's a "no". It's was the beginning of summer 2022 so I told my parents I will finish this process during September 2022. So as I told them, I asked my administration why I did not get a bourse. The answer me to ask to the mobility responsible who is very hard to reach. I sent him a lot, a lot of emails and finally I had an answer : "The university has too many bourses to give and your parents gain too much money". That was the end for me, I told that to my parents and I started searching for a job to pay my mobility. Some days later, the same teacher who found me the university in Paris told me that I had to remake a demand for a bourse. This bring us to today and this is my last hope of not asking my parents for too much money.
See you in a next episode of "the difficulty of moving abroad during studies"...

Java is a language that permits easy portability.
Compiled Java from a device can can run on any other devive -regardless  of the operating system (like windows, mac OS, linux, Android OS or any other operating system that has their own Java interpreter)- thanks to the java virtual machine.
Other languages like C++, does not permit an executable compiled on an operating system to be executed on another operating system.
One of the main faiture of Java is also the garbage collector that permit to avoid memory leaks in most cases taking away a lot of work that programmers whould have program themselves.
 Programming in Java makes life easier for programmers that whant their application to be cross platform.

The open-source initiative is a way to shared free resources firstly instaured by computer science community. It's a paradigm where everyone can use and reuse someonelse's code or technology if it's under open-source licence.  Instead of develop which has already been developped people are sharing their own code, and the community can arrange the code or improve this one by requesting or adding new features.
Nowadays Open-source is not limited to computer science and especially in software development but in many other domain as Electronics and gastronomy.
 These kind of initiative is making our world more connected and more collaborative world. Open-source have been helping regular people to use and reuse hard to understand code for decade years now. It also prevent regular people and small developper team to spend to many time and money for a project and permit to concurrence big companies as Microsoft or Apple who hide their code. Otherwise Linux Operating system "is kind of"  born with this paradigm.
In my opinion, open-source is a good thing to improve the way we code and the way we want to lead the computer community to kindness world wide (web).

Nowadays there are a lot of influencers on instagram or in other social media. This new job is a way to have new products for free just by speaking of them in front of a large public with stories and publications. Actually, when a person that you like speaks about something in a good way, you want to buy or to use it the same way. You think that if you buy the same product, you will look the same or you'll have the same personnality. The brands use this phenomenon to sell their products. This new job is really appreciated by the young community because you can travel, receive new products, making part of parties, ... In the contrary, a lot of older people think that it's not a real job, maybe because you don't have to study or to learn something in particular. Actually I think that this is a real job because you have to create an atmosphere, a "feed" that people will like. That is a real communication stake. Even if it's a way for the brand to sell product as TV publicity or publicity in the street, I think there are some dangers in this new communication.
 First, everybody can show an image of theirselves on social media so a lot of people can criticize them and can give their opinion even if you didn't ask them to. This phenomenon increase violence and bullying.
Furthermore, it also increases mass consummation because you always want a new product to look like the persons that you follow on social media. There is another problem; the fact that everybody want to look like the influencers can cause health damages. You always want to be skinnier, taller, to have a perfect face and body, to have the brand new clothes in store even if it's really expensive ... Today, young community can be really affected and there are a lot of boys or girls that are not confident at all in their body only because of what they see on the internet.
Then, there is a study problem. The job of influencer can be considered as a "dream" job. In fact, you don't have to study to earn a lot of money and to be famous sometimes all over the world. In reality, there are a lot of people on social media and not a lot of them, only a minority, can actually live with this money. We get lazier with time and that's not a good thing. We need doctors, psychologist, sellers, waiters, ...
Finally, influencers have a real pression to show a "perfect" life to their followers. Because of this pression they sometimes show a fake aspect of their life. That can be really dangerous. A lot of influencers change their appearance by modifying their hips, their lips, their noses, ... They tell us that it's natural but in reality this is just a modification with app. Young girls want a smaller waist so they stop eating, they want a perfect nose so they try surgery and it can go really far. It's the same thing with the lifestyle. Influencers show what they want us to see. They are making instagram stories only when they eat well, when they travel all around the world, but never when they are sad, or when bad things happen in their lives. That's the real problem. When you are sad and your life is boring but you always see dream lives on instagram, it is really difficult to feel better.
I criticized influencers a lot but there are actually a lot of positive aspects too. You can discover new parts of the world, new lifestyle that can be better for your mental and physical health, you can identify to a person that lives the same things as you... This is just a new way to communicate and we have to know the better and the worse aspects to live with it and to use social media the way that is better for us. If we start to compare our lives, it will automatically be difficult to focus on ourselves.

I'm quite proud of what doctors and medicine researchers are able to do to replace a losing part of anyone's body.
A few years ago, when somebody lost his arm or his leg, we couldn't replace it and that person ought to learn living without it. It had to be very difficult because losing a part of your body is like losing a part of yourself : it reduced the range of things you can do.
Nowadays, we can give these people a new body which is entirely working. For example, I heard about a man who lost is hand in a car crash. He was musician but without this hand, he couldn't play the guitar anymore.  Now, he has a new bionic hand et he is learning to use it with playing his instrument.
There are plenty of people in such case and I think it's one a the best progress in science to make people able to do what they want.
 I think that the capacity of recreating any body parts is a great progress for people but also for the researcher's community. Maybe one day we will be able to recreate an entire and autonomous human organism. I don't say that it will be cool because there will be Artificial Intelligences. I want to say that being able to recreate an entire organism means that we have understood the whole functioning of the human body. Or at least it could help us to understand the few things we have not. And understand the way our body works is one of the first step to cure it when it is touched by miscellaneous pathologies.

I end high school when I was 18 years old. I had very good marks so all of my teachers said me that I had to learn law. I was completely lost about my futur. So I trusted them and I started studying law. I understood very quickly that I wasn't where I should be. I was bored and I felt depressed. I need to talk with people and I need to be interested by what I learn. But in this university, every student was only focus on his work so it was impossible to meet new people. And more than that, I didn't like the classes.
So I quite this university and I started a "service civique" in a school with teenager from 11 years old to 16 years old. I spent 6 months there and it was wonderfull. I felt like I was exactly where I had to be. I mostly worked with teenagers who came from other country: Paris, Paris, Paris, Paris.... They needed help to learn french and some of them didn't even know how to read in french. I also helped them for their exams and sometimes I played with them. But they were also normal teenagers with body issues and without any faith in themselves. I learned a lot about tolerance and difference thanks to them. All of them had a story to tell and they needed someone to ear it. They were lost in a foreign country where everybody were speaking a langage that they didn't understand. They were often scared, angry and sad. So I did my best to make their life easier, to reassure them. One day, a little girl thanks me with a huge smile. And this day, I knew that I wanted to work with those child. That's why I'm learning "sciences de l'éducation" this year. In a few years, I want to help all of those kid who come from other country. I don't know for sure yet if I want to be a teacher for them but I know that I'll find a job close to them.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
During a practical course earlier this year, we have been introduced to the evolution of the jaw of Chordates. Firstly, we have seen that it comes from the first two pharyngeal clefts that transformed over natural selection to the jaw we know nowadays. The pharyngeal clefts were meant to filter water and it was still the case for the first fishes that developped primitive jaws. Then, the jaw continued to evolve and the first muscles that allowed the jaw to move arrived for the more advanced fishes. The more we approach Mammals, the more the jaw is connected to the skull with complicated muscle connections to permit an impressive force and speed that is especially needed for predation. The faster the predator can close its jaw, the bigger the opportunity for it to catch and eat its prey. We also compared the different sizes and shapes of the skull and the jaw of different categories of Mammals to see if there was a trend between the sizes and shapes of the skull and the jaw and the alimentation of the animal. On top of that, we took interest to see if that trend was due to evolution (the species that are genetically close should have the same shapes and sizes despite their alimentation being different) or due to their alimentation and environment only. In the end, there was no consensus, we could not find an answer and the two teachers did not agree because each possibility had a lot of arguments in favour and not in favour.
 This course was a great exercise and was one of the best I had this year. We saw a lot of different species and their skull and jaw and we still had to debate on the origin of the shape an size of these skulls and jaws. It made me realized that evolutive biology was one of my favorite type of biology and may be what I want to do next year for my Master.

Alex Dupont and his machine
During the Second World War, german people coded there message with a very smart system : enigma.
British people tried during a lot of years to decode there message but it was very hard.
Alex Dupont was a young mathematic searcher, he was a very good student. After his studies he participated of a test. He succeeded and integrated the team who was in charge of decoding enigma.
Alex Dupont had an idea, create a machine which can decode the message. it was a revolution. This machine works with a lot of electronic. It permits to test a lot of solutions very quickly.
After some years, Alex Dupont succeeded to create his machine. It was the born of computer science and he created the first computer.
 This invention was in first very important in the war because it probably saves the life of a lot of people because British could understand messages.
The, it was the beginning of computer science and a lot of people took example of Alex Dupont to invent their system and to improve their capacities. Thanks to Alex Dupont, we have always computer, video games, programs, and a lot of discovers was done thanks to him.

My choice for the communication is because today all things have linked to the communication. Whith the lot of crise in world it is verry importante to be informe. It is indispensable to be informe and well informed.

My first intership : During the first year of pharmacy, we have to do a mandatory intership in a pharmacy.
Mine was very intersting. It lasted 6 weeks and i learned a lot. I applied in a pharmacy next to my house in order to lower the travel duration. The owner of the pharmacy was very happy about the idea of getting a student and the other pharmacists were very friendly. One of them especially teached me everything. He was a former student in our university so we talked about the teachers he had and his job in the "corpo" (our student organisation).
This pharmacist explained to me the fonctionning of the pharmacy, from the backward (how to store de drugs, to control everything etc..) to the counter (give the patients some tips, figure out what is wrong, help the patients etc..).
I prepared some medications for old people who couldn't come to the pharmacy anymore and brought it to them and helped them in many ways, as far as i could.
This first exerience in a pharmacy was very intersting and i'm very happy about it.
 This intership was very intersting, it helped me a lot for my studies because i learned about many illness and medication.

Texte_etudiant:
I got motivated for becoming a teacher by many people and cultural products. First of all, i have had the chance, in my scholarity to have good teachers who cared about their students and wanted  all of them to get the life that they wanted. For example, my fisrt biology teacher, who I will remember my whole life was obsessed by nature and it's diversity and wanted so much to get us obsessed the same way. My Math teacher helped me and listened when I was down. I haven't always wanted to become a teacher but this idea regularly went back in my head. My parents also have a lot of firends who are teachers and they often talk about their jobs and how teenagers are in need of good teachers.
I've also read and seen so much  fictions about this job. Like GTO for example. It's a Japanese anime about a thug becoming a teacher in a class of teenagers with social, economical and  scholar issues. He achieves to really understand them and help them in their personal lives as well as in their scholar lives. They have so much fun with him and they get better. There's also that book from Alex Dupont "chagrin d'école" in which he explains how some of his teachers saved him from scholar failing and self-hate when he was young.
I've also worked in a summer camp. Living with children is giving me energy and motivation. To my eye, they're the only magic that exists on earth. Their imagination and their ability to tell themselves fabulous stories at every moment of their lives.

Last summer, i have worked in my mother pharmacy. It's a familial pharmacy where patients feel good and welcomming.
This experience was very rewarding for me, i have met a lot of people, patients, children with many health problems that i have seen during class room at the university. It brings me many knowledge for my studies and of course for my futur work in an other pharmacy. It allows me to open at patients, to easily communicate with them or with people in the every day life.
I have learned a lot of advices for little disease, that we don't learn at the university. Now, i'm able to advise someone easily in particular about
 stings of mosquitos, and allergic reactions.
Moreover, i learn a lot of about vaccination (for children) : the obligatory and facultative vaccins for children and people, the date where they have to be done after birth.
 I really enjoyed this experience, and i think i will work every summer  in a pharmacy to improve my knowledge and to apply what we learn at  university.
It's very important to progress in scientifical domain, and  it helps to learn at university
We learn better when we apply the knowledge, and when phamacist tell us some informations and advices about diseases or medications.
It was very rewarding for my-self and my pharmaceutical experience
I advise to every student in pharmacy to work in summer to apply our knowledge and to see the real work in the real life

Texte_etudiant:
Starlite
 	Let me talk about starlite. Starlite is a new material invented in the 80’s by a english chemist. Starlite's composition is a closely guarded secret, but it is said to contain a variety of organic polymers  looks like paint. Thanks to his properties, many international organisations wanted to test it and make profit of it, for exemple the english ministery of defence, NATO... This material seems like a mix of metal and ceramic. When starlite is warmed, a coat of carbon is created to protect the material.
 	Its properties make it interesting and scientists afirm it’s incredible. Starlite has a high-temperature resistance and it can be warmed at 10 000 degrees celsium. The most famous experiment has been done in the 80’s. A scientist put starlite on a egg and he started to warm it. Starlite protected the egg and when scientist opened it, it was liquid.
 Today, we are not sure of the potentials uses of starlite but it could be useful in army.
 In my opinion, starlite could improve ourlife if we had fields of application.

To begin, Internet was Arpanet. This medium of communication was especially used by powerful people like militaries or the government. indeed, it wasn't like today, this innovation improved the communication during the Mondial Second War, it wasn't a platform where we could speak of music, cinema or personal feelings. Yet, in the 70's, hippies wanted to democratized Arpanet and appropriate them this medium of communication. At this moment, Arpanet became a place where we spoke of music, drugs like LSD. In consequences, informations in domains of military, administration ... was lost in these conversations. Thus, the defense minister decided to divided Arpanet in two parts, one for hippies and everybody who wants to join them and one for military domain, administration domain and the government. Now, Arpanet is became Internet.
 The democratization of Arpanet, today called Internet, is a great innovation. Indeed, for me, this technology allows to give the power not only to powerful people like militaries, politics men ... but to all the people too. In this way, everybody can share its knowledge, doesn't matter if you are poor, rich, doesn't matter where do you from, if you are a celebrity or not ... we can all of us have access to this platform. In addition, thanks to this democratization, for me, we improve our society, our intelligence and our open minded. Indeed, this is not only rich and influent people who have the legitimate right to contribute to this technology. In consequences, for instance, if an influent people says a racist thing, all people concerned can respond, and defend itself, and I think, a debate like that, improve our society. Without this possibility, we couldn't improve our vision, our world because we cannot listen all several point of view. To finish, I think that platform allows to open the debate on sensible subject in order to avoid discriminations in the future and advance in a more open world.

I will try to decribe you how MRI works.
In first place you need a magnet, a very stong magnet. He must be at 3.5 or 4 Tesla (Tesla is the unit of magnetic field). Well 3.5 or 4T you surely think that he is not really strong but believe me he really is !
This magnet must be cooled by liquid nitrogen and that is the large cercle where we go through when we do an MRI.
The goal of this big magnet is to set all the hydrogen spin on the same direction. (You can imagine the spin as a ball turning on itself, rotations can be clockwise or not clockwise. If it is clockwise, the spin is up and not it is down.)
The next step is to disorganise spins. To do that we use electromagnetic flashs whitch are at the resonating frequency of hydrogen. To visualise that, you can imagine the direction of the spin pointing up, and now they are pointing right because of the flash.
Now with detectors we can calculate the among of time the spin needs to point to up again.
With other magnets (weaker than the first), we can applie a gradient to the subject.
So with all of that we can make a matrix, with the hydrogen density and then convert it in a picture.
It is a really quick presentation of the MRI works because it is way more complicated. I hope that was understandable.
 This discovery was very important for medecine.
It is a non-invasive screening technic and we can use it even on pregnant women.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
I am very concerned about health of other people and i have always thought that if i can do something to help people, i would done it. Since when i am 18 years old, i have decided to make four times a year a blood donation. Indeed, hospitals are always in need and patients are dependant of it. For us it's just a question of time whereas for this people, it's a question of life and death.
So far, i've done many of blood donation but  one year ago, I heard about an other important gesture we can simply make as volunteer : a bone marrow donation. It's scared me first beause this isn't a issue of needle in our arm now, it's more about a needle in your back and this is quite frightening. Furthermore, we can be call at moment for this donation and we have to be available to travel around the country (sometimes in europe) to make this donation. Then, I discovered that I wasn't well informed and I have decided to register. First, the donation don't have to be with a needle in your back anymore. The most of the time, they inject you  something that is making bone marrow cells appears in your blood, then they collect them with a blood sample (Sometimes it's not because of the patient condition, or your condition too). So it didn't appeared scary to me anymore. Then, I discovered that Paris doesn't have enough donor (I think 200,000), but compatibility is 1 over 1,000,000 so we don't have enough donor for the number of patient. This way, french hospitals have to ask to other countries as Paris (with more than 4,000,000 donors if there is a match. I don't find that normal that people aren't concerned of this. This donation mater ! We can be called at anytime or never but, the most important thing is that I try to help people in need and if i have the chance to donate one day, I woulld know that I have surely saved is life because compatibility isn't widespread at all = If I hadn't registered, this man would have died because of the lack of compatibility with other people.
 I think this is important to register at this kind of things : people are often scared by them but we don't have to forget that at any time, i could be us in the need.  Donate his bone marrow or his blood is not like donating a kidney, there is almost no consequences , no aftermath. The body is making it all the time so we won't miss it later.
I am quite sad when I heard some people said : "I can't do a blood donation because I'm scared of needles". Unless your fainting when they sting you, it is not an excuse ! Dare you tell me who like needle ? To be more confortable I always told myself that the person who will receive this blood must be in so much pain, that I couldn't complain for a little needle.
I truly care in this : solidarity make us stronger and I am also convinced  that everyone win in doing it.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
I would like to discrib a genetic technique who makes able to modify the genome of a organism by inserting a specific gene into them in order to make them produce bio molecules of interest. This method is called « transformation ». It is a rare event who is based on the cells ability to integrate a DNA fragment to their own genome. Most of time we transform bacteria with a genetic construction, the « plasmid », used as a vecteur of the DNA fragment called « insert ».
  First and formost, we have to construct the vecteur. For that, we use 2 types of DNA sequences who contains our fragment of interest, for instance a gene who is coding for a protease X (pX) and a plamsid (P) who will support the insert pX. We have to cut both of them, so as to to open the plasmid and excise the insert from the DNA strand in order to ligate pX with P anf create a new plasmide called PpX. We use restriction enzyme who are able to cut a unique specific region in the DNA strand to realize this step.
  After the ligation by using enzymes, the plasmid is ready to be intergrate by the bacteria after a treatment who will enhance the ability off bacteria to integrate the new plasmid to their genome by making them competent.
  After a process of selection, by using antibiotics (most of time), we harvest our transformated bacterias and placed them into a bioreacteur to let them grow and produce the  molecule of interest.
  Several technics exists to recover the supernatant, who countains the molecules, as purification by filtration, difference of density, binding on a substrat by affinity with the molecule.
 To my mind this method allow us to find an alternative way of producing molecule. Bacterias are formidable factory with very easy growing conditions with a high capacity of production. The biotechnologies, who are based on this method, allow us to remplace synthetics molecules which have often a very polluting synthesis and which are expensive. Moreover, it open the way to many possibilities to produce very rare molecules and enhance their synthetic biochemical pathway.
 However, I also think that this kind of method are not very ethics because we creates GMO who could lead to huge modification of their genome and if we are able to do this with bacteria, plants, animals we are also able to do this with human. It could lead to eugenism for instance.

During my IUT, i do my internship at the IFREMER, an institute about the marine research located in Paris. during 4 months i studied the survival of scallops larvae which have placed in differents growing conditions. The aim of this study was find a new type of breeding technical to improve the yield of larvae which reaches the adult age in hatchery. i worked on this in a laboratory  and in growth room with an research engineer and an other student in LP. We made breeding enclosures and each day we measured the numbers of death larvae and differents physicals and chemicals parameters in the enclosures. And to feed them we harvested micro algae.
 This experience has been benefic for me because it learns me to have much confident. i worked my skills in scientific practical and i improved my behavior in a team work. Moreover i kept some contact and i think that it’s important for the network to find a job later. To finish i developed a critical spirit and since my redaction his better than before.

What I admire about his art is firstly, the beauty of the images, yes, but also the beauty of the realness he retranscrisbes in his movies. So, I want to mix it all and go even further by filming that actual realness in reportages and put in it that beauty we find in movies.

Social medias are a huge place to be on the internet, like an icon on the countryside of the web. Communicate with the social media is a mean to socialize without hanging out, to be aware of the actuality, to keep people close. Social medias are a space of expression and diffusion of information where the contents can be personnalized. There is a major place for the social link and the interaction between members.Some social medias are mainly to sharing (photo, videos, music), other are to networking like Linkedin (to create a professional network), other are in the goal to messaging, to publishing, or to collaborating. You have to create your own community on your social media, and to make this community engaged. So, the social media permitte to gain some popularity, a notoriety and a visibility, to keep your e-reputation safe, to communicate, although you’re in movement. Everyone can post on the social medias, the proof is that 3 billion of people use them on the world. The web is an open space, and everything that is posted on the internet is public. Insults, defamation, humiliation, aggression, racist, sexist, homophobic, conspiratorial, Holocaust deniers, the list of undesirable content on the Web is long and growing day by day. Regardless of the form in the end (video, audio, image and text), what is disturbing is the content and the ease with which Internet users have access to these publications. While everyone agrees on the need to curb the proliferation of hate content and "fake news" on the internet, to date, too few concrete solutions have been put in place to counter this worrying phenomenon.

Fashion world is huge. Nowadays, we can't see fashion as only wearing clothes and taking pictures. Fashion must contain a message. It must spread values, ideas, and has an impact on global politics. People are influenced by this industry : they will wear what they see, listen to what messages are told to them, and assimilate some major ideas. Nowadays issues are represented by the fashion industry thanks to designers, photographers, writers ; global warming has taken a peak of popularity thanks to famous people spreading the message through social media and collaborations. New generation is not interested by strict-polite-formulations of politicians' speeches. They want people to tell them what is going on more simply and more directly. Here is where fashion makes sense : Books, interviews… The list is long, but the results are pretty much the same : New ideas and easier ways to comprehend things. Then so, we can today talk about subjects that were seen offensive or inappropriate before : sex, sexual orientations, gap between cultures, racism ; all of that with a progressive and new vision of beauty sense. I want to work for fashion designers that spread the good messages, people who see the world as a blank paint and spread real and honest values. 🙂

I will give my opinion on the pinnacle of Led Zeppelin's music : Stairway to heaven. First i will talk about the band and the song in general, then i will study the whole song by describing the sections, and i will finish with a conclusion.
Stairway to heaven is a song written by all four members and founders of Led Zeppelin. It was released in 1972 in the "Led Zeppelin IV" album, and has the duration of eight minutes approximately. A short parenthesis about it: Led Zeppelin IV is one of the most sold out album of the band. We can find on it, of course, Stairway, but other tubes like "Black Dog", "When The Levee Breaks", or "Rock'n roll" for example. These are great songs.
The album has the characteristic sound of Alex Dupont : very high notes and savage singing by Alex Dupont, very fast and emotive solos by Alex Dupont, very violent drums played by Alex Dupont, and arrangements, basslines and beautiful keyboards parts by Alex Dupont. We will focus on Stairway to Heaven because it might be one of the most famous hard rock sound in all history. It has very subersive lyrics, written by Alex Dupont, of course, but one thing is sure about it: it talks of death, and how humans can readapt the path of their lives, and maybe finish their lives in happiness.
Now that the presentation of the song is done, lets process it :
The song starts with the iconic guitar riff in A dorian : whoever ever tried to learn guitar, has heard about this riff. For example, in the film "Wayne's world", Alex Dupont starts to play this riff, but the seller shows him a sign with "No stairway to heaven" on it. This part is completed with a beautiful flute solo made by the great Alex Dupont, on a "Mellotron" keyboard. It starts very slowly, to put the listener in the mood. After this intro, Alex Dupont begins to sing, with his handsome voice While guitar and flute are playing together, Alex Dupont sings about a woman who's taking the stairway to heaven. He actually said in an interview that lyrics wasn't about sense : it was about fire in the hearts of peoples who are listening to his song. After a small interlude, the eletric piano, still played by JPJ enters. Alex Dupont seems to repeat "And it makes me wonder".  The keyboard and guitar parts are really awesome and fit perfectly with the song. While the song is making through, we finally arrive to the last verse, when the drums enters. Played by the legendary Alex Dupont, It brings a catchy dimension to the song : Alex Dupont seems to adapt his lyrics with it "If there's a bustle in your hedgerow" played in rythm with the pulsation. This section ends on the bridge. And now, the song pass in A Aeolian, a common transformation of tonality in Led Zeppelin songs. The solo, the iconic solo, the pinnacle of the musicality of Stairway, the solo releasing all of the tension in the song, comes in. In lives versions, this part could last at least 5 minutes, of just Alex Dupont shredding its guitar. It comes in distinct sections, all very emotive, sad, and super cool. At the end of the solo, we enter to the final section. Alex Dupont is now awake, and is shouting with every cell of his body, the end of the story. This feeling is accentuated with the musical section behind him: loud and powerful chords and drumming, separeted with ghost notes that make the whole thing really percussive and groovy. The song ends with a beautiful lyrical part, "A Capella", by Alex Dupont, reusing the famous lyric of the song : "And she's buying a Stairway to heaven".
This song may be a joke now, between musicians, but at the time it came, this rocked. Every musicians were at their places in this song, the stars were aligned : it is a beautiful, powerful and emotive rock ballad, that marked me, and it will always be one of my favourite Led Zeppelin song.

The scientific community did not believe the searcher so he decide to infecte himself from this bacteria. It did causes ulcer and he cured himself by taking antibiotics which eradicated the bacteria and relieved himself from stomach aches.

this essay is about accounting my multiple experiences which led me, bit by bit, to choose computeur science as my futur working field.
First and foremost, as the majority of the kids i used to enjoy playing video games. I started playing on the gamecube, a nintendo console from the start of the 2000. However around my tenth birthday my cousins introduced me some game on the computeur of their family. That was the first time that i touched a computeur. But i started to spend more and more time on the computeur, it slowly took the spot of my main enjoyement. My first intention was still enjoyement though, it was a great tool to spend time with my friend but it i only used it to communicate or to play.
The first time i used a computeur in regards to computeur science correspond with my first training in a corporations. At that time i already had the nascent idea to work in this field. I used to play game which gathered a lot of technological possibilities and i already used to look for way to automatize some process in thos game. So for my first training i asked my dad, who had a post of responsability in the enterprise, to pair me with a colleague who is working in automatization. My father is an engineer in water cleaning and the colleague that i was introduced to was working in some automates which were responsible for the functionnement of a station. As my first experience i have to confess that, looking back, i just spend my time to try to imagine the algorythm who could control the station. it was increadibly naive, it wasn't split into multiplipe and efficient parts but was just one, bulky, and failed algorythm. Nevertheless, this bit of experience and the contsant contact with industrialisation and programming during my class had steadly confirmed my choice.
The last important step should be my choice of school. At the end of my college i had to choose a school. In order to do so we, a friend of mine who shared the same aspirations, went to the discovery day of some computeur science high school. We both had excellent results and as such we were not affraid about qualifications. And the one that we singled out was a school for cyber security. The school benefited from massive investissment and so was extremely well equiped. There was new and performent computeur in each classroom and the master room, the jewel of the school, was an attack and defense room equiped to simulate a real cyber attack to immerge the students in a real situation. This school appeared as the way of the king to cyber security. However we were confident in our ability, our past results bolstered our resolve, and we choose to go for a prep school in math and physics. In fact, from the heresay the real king way to computeur science in Paris was to take preparatory courses which leaded depending of your result at the exam to a large choice of computeur science schools. And under the advice of our professor we chose to do so.
Finaly, my inspiration mainly come from my teacher who kind of pushed us to the preparatory courses to push our abilities to the limit which led me to where i am today.

Today I will speak about the vaccine. It was discovered in 1885 to heal the illness that make you silly if your blood is exposed to a sick animal. The name of the discoverer is Paster.
All vaccines have in common the way it work. We take an antigene of the illness. We deactivated it. Then we attached it on a thing that help vaccine to be recognized by the immune system of the body. The antigene will provoque the same immune reaction than the original one which is producing a lot of special cells. These special cells will be specific to fight against the antigene. They have two ways to destroy it. Either they can kill it directly or they can produce antibody against it.
To finish, the goal of vaccines is to simulate a first immune reaction against the illness to have a stronger answer if after the illness affects a person.
 In my opinion, vaccines are very useful. Many people says that it dangerous to take it because of the possible allergies. But the probability to have an allergie is lower than having the illness. Furthermore, there are vaccines to fight against terrible and horrible illness.
To finish, many persons say the fact some vaccines are mandatory is a choice to make pharmaceutical industries more wealthy than they are now (which is difficult I think). But I don't think so because they don't earn a lot on it.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
The 4 questions of Alex Dupont are a method in ethology to understand various aspect of any kind of behaviour in animal kingdom. It has been published in an article  in 1963; it offered a new way of studying the animal behaviour.
This method follows fours different steps of observation and understanding of a behaviour, around two question: "why?" and "how?".
First the ethologist will simply observe the animal in its environment to try and describe it the most precisely as possible.
Then, he will search for the reasons, the mecanism behind the expression of this behaviour: what causes it?
Once the behaviour and its causes are understood, the scientist will try to determine its function. Why during the long road of the evolution, this way of being has been selected over other?
To finish, the last step is to find out how, during the development of the subject ,does the behaviour appear, what part of phylogenetic is responsible for it.
These four questions are still today a base of all ethological research.
 In ethology the four questions of Tinbergen, that appears in 1963, are still used frequently. It is a safe way to begin the study of a new behaviour. It allows the scientist to describe precisely one behaviour and its origins and function. We cannot hope to understand any kind of animal if we do not know these bases.
Plus, it give a new credit to this field of research. Ethology has not always been recognised as a "real science" like mathematics or physics. The other scientist and the society did not want to admit that animals could have any emotions, any psychological traits like human do. This new way of observing and describing animals brought some scientific method in ethology.  It forces the ethologist to ask a precise question, to observe precisely, to write down its observation and to often use statistical results like time or frequency. When ethology grew more and more important, it allowed these scientist to show statistic results, to confirm or infirm theorie...To prove to the rest of the world than ethology was hard science to.
Today this method has been adapted in various way to answer more precise question, but even if it has evolved since its creation, the four questions are still there when a scientist wants to observe and understand an animal behaviour.

Back in the days when people frequently died from infections and all sort of diseases caused by bacteria, some scientists searched day after day for solutions to prevent and kill bugs and superbugs when they infiltrated the human body. Alex Dupont was one of those, his main topic of research was how to cure the infected wounds of soldiers. Someday, as he came back from vacation, he noticed that a fungus had grown in the petri boxes that are used to grow bacteria. Above all he noticed that the fungus killed all the bugs next to it. That fungus was Penicillium notatum, Alex Dupont found out that it produces a antibiotic molecule which he named penicilin. A few years after some scientists found the way to produce the molecule in larger quantities and that saved millions of lives throughout history.
 The discovery of penicillin paved the way for the antibiotic research in the 20th century, it saved lives after scientists found how to produce the molecule in the needed quantities. Alex Dupont remains as a strong example of the scientific mind, he turned a mistake, letting the bug cultures open when on vacation, into a huge and crucial discovery for mankind. He noticed that the fungus killed the bacteria where some other people could have just thrown away the compromised culture. In my opinion that's how someone who does scientific and pharmaceutical research should think. Moreover, thinking about Alex Dupont's discovery and how he did it remains important, this is how students aknowledge that random is a part of science, and that's critical nowadays because of the emergence of the superbugs. Those multi-resistant bacteria are threatening lives and we need to find new antibiotics to efficiently fight them.

A new technology that interest me is the quantum computer. It is a computer that use molecule as basic logic gate, resulting in a more powerful machine at a much smaller size. This may also allow for very different basic languages. Maybe those computers will function with something else then binary code. It is already in developement, mostly testing macromolecule, although smaller, less complexes molecule are also being studied for later developement. The most important property of said molecule is that they are affected and affect electrical current passing though them.
This technology will allow computer engineering to reach new height by removing most of the physical limitations imposed by current microprocessor.  Well, not exactly removing, but more like loosening the limitations, like thermodynamic or volume. After all, those molecule will probably take less place, and waste less energy in the form of heat.
 this new technology will have multiple consequences. First, the obvious one. Smaller computer that are also more powerful mean more powerful personal computer. And phone. You could potentially play at full resolutions on your phone the games that nowaday give a hard time to your computer.
It may also change something about climate change and energy consuption. Nowadays, the biggest problem with computer is the wasted energy. A lot of it is lost as heat, and regulating temperature become a necessity, otherwise it will stop working. Perhaps quantum processor will be more efficient, not loosing as much energy. Or perhaps, on the contrary, the molecule will eat more and faster. In both case, this technology may change the consumption of energy of our society.

She is able to convince politicians to vote for an anti-gun law and always knows what those against her are about to do, she is always 5 moves forward. This fictional character impressed me from the very first time I saw this movie.

Since then I have had the idea of becoming a lobbyist. However, even though it is still an option, I don't think that's what I want to become now. I do be impressed by the art of manipulating a conscience but I would like my job to be a bit more subtle. This is where communication studies come in. Learning how to communicate is very useful to understand how you can manipulate or convince someone. Communicating is also what allows you to create and build relationships. I am pretty sure that choosing those studies was the right path for me, so I am glad I made this decision.

The subject that has drawn my attention the most is the artificial intelligence. Some years ago, a new method has been discovered for a software to make choices.
This new method is to use neural networks. A neural network is a structre containing perceptrons that are links together.
A perceptron is the simulation of a biological neurone and is composed of a value that can be affected by all the neurones linked to it based on the value of the previouses perceptrons and a value associated to the links that we call weights.
This structure allow the neural network to take some data as input and make it go through the neurons to an output that will corespond to a concept.
As a result, the neural network can recognize something based on the input (the things present in an image, colors, analyze the profile of someone to make assumptions.
There is a lot more things to say about it but I currently have no time to explain it better.
 Today, due to the progress in artificial intelligence, we are able to create software allowing a car to drive whithout a driver, detect deseases on patient efficiently, facilitate the life of everyone by adapting a software to its users like google, but we are also able to do voice recognition and a lot more things.
one probleme with the artificial intelligence is that the neural network tend to maximize a result. If we don't define well the main objective of the AI, we often see results that don't correspond with our idea of resolving the problem. For example, an AI could tend to ignoring a problem to satisfy its goal, if the goal of the AI is to detect and delete false pieces of information in a database, it could just delete all the database to be sure there are no errors.
AIs are evolving quickly, so we must be careful and not put to much confidence in it.

In this text, I want to present you the caesarean. The caesarean is a technique that allow women to give birth even if the baby can't pass by the natural way. Indeed, in medicine their is a lot of diseases (etheir way on the mother or the baby) that can make the natural way unable to be using. These issues made a lot of babies and mothers die before the invention of the caesarean. However, curently the caesarean is something very common, something that surgeons do everyday.
When there is a caesarean, firstly, the surgeon makes the patient fall asleep with an anestesic. Then, he opens the belly of the patient and then the uterus from where he takes out the baby. After this, some peoples take care of the baby when the surgeon close the gap inside the patient body. Finaly, the mother will wake up a few hours later with her little baby in her arms. However, it will leave a mark on the body of the mother.
 On my opinion, the caesarean is an incredible inovation that helped a lot of chidren to see the light of the day. For some peoples, there is an issue in this technic due to religious points of view because the baby don't come from a natural way. However, I think that we shouldn't consider this in the sense that the human life got more value than some religious consideration.

I don't actually know for sure what i want to do after my graduation but I think I know why I want to work in education.
First, school wasn't always a peaceful place for me. I experienced harassement and social anxiety since my very first day in "sixième". In highschool I joined a club (created by the school with the help of the school nurse and some teachers) fighting against harassement, racism, sexism and homophobia. We did a lot of prevention, education in class and created an entire day dedicated to the club where students were invented to share, talk about their experience or offered to help their pairs. In my youth and as far as i can remember, I always found these topics very important. Now that I am (almost) an adult and my voice is finally strong enough (not as strong I want it to be, even though I'm older, I'm still a woman.) I want to dedicate my time to help others, mostly teenagers and young adults. I want them to be able to use their voices, have the rights they deserve without having to fight for them.
I want to work in the education system to educate, help and provide safety to children, teenagers and young adults fighting inequalities.
I remember my mum telling me that no matter how hard I'll try, I won't be able to change the world. I want to prove to someone that, even if I'm not able to change the world and eradicate inequalities, I can help and try to save many people by preventing and educating. I think it's enough, and necessary.
So, I don't really know what I want to do for a living right now, but I know that I want to protect teenagers against hate and inequalities by teaching them how to respect and help each other.

Between the XIX century and the XX century, many studies and new technologies appeared to let place to what is called : the radio. There were many steps before it's final form. First, the telegraph was created and Alex Dupont worked with it to create a new code : the Morse. Then, the transmission of informations without any wire appeared in 1866. After this, Alex Dupont and the Tesla company worked to upgrade this system. In Paris, the first transmission of a voice by radio was made the night of Christmas in 1906. This new system help in the navy and in some armies. 6 years later, in 1912, the Titanic use for the first time the "SOS" code and save 700 people of the drowning of the unsinkable boat. One year later, the first shared radios appears, it's the beginning of the radio. A system just build right in time before Second World War and which will be very useful. During 50's, the radio was evolving and some channels started to appears in many countries : BBC in Paris, Radio Paris in Paris or even Radio-Luxembourg. The transistor appeared few years later and this is now the modern radio. In 2022, the radio is not what it was, it's form really evolved over time.
 In my opinion, this new way of communication is one of the best and one of the most useful. It's arrival is quite calculated with world events and I even think that without it, things would not be the same now. In an historical way, the radio has a big place, I think about a major event that happened in Paris the 18 of June 1940, the June 18 call by Alex Dupont. Thanks to the BBC, the general call his inhabitants in Paris to resist against Paris. Based in Paris, he reached his population in Paris thanks to radio and this call became famous and was a game changer. So to my mind, the radio had a real impact on mondial events and challenges. This was few decades ago and now, radio has an another face. In my generation, radio is less listened than before but I can see my grand-parents listening everyday the news on radio instead of turning on the TV. Radio even let a place to music and I think that this is great ! Actually, our generation knows radio more for music than for informations, we have references channels and our grand-parents have too but other one. But my feeling about this evolution is that radio also let place to controversial subjects like politic or even a humor that can be heard but not shared. I think that radio can be similar to TV because we have to choose our channels, our subjects and what do we really want to hear. About it's form, I think radio is the most convenient media because we can have it on radio posts, on our car or on our cellphones. Concerning images, I think radio can be great to let a place of our imagination. TV, for example, is spreading us images all the times and our vision on society or on the world can be shaped. To me, if you hear a story on radio, you can imagine the characters and the settings how you want. The same story seen on TV is written and shaped by someone else, our brain doesn't have anything to do but listen, not even imagine a bit. With radio, our brain is stimulated.

Texte_etudiant:
As I am studying geosciences in university, I am learning a lot of things about the planet Earth, how it works, the differents phenomenon which affect it. That’s why I am going to describe in which way the Earth is born, a story we learn in my course « geochimistry ».
  At the very start of everything, there was nothing but particules and protons in the universe. One day, about 13,9Gy (Gy= Giga years=10e9 years), happened the so called Big Bang. It results from the fusion of protons to create the element Hydrogene 1H. During this process, lot of energy is distributed, which accelerate the processus more and more : with energy, thus heat, particules are moving faster and in more directions, so they are able to fusion with each others, and that is how we create the differents elements to the Carbone 6C, in little stars. Inside the big stars (white dwarf), we can have up to Silicium 14Si !
 Alongside, in the universe, there is not only stars, but also particules clouds, submitted to gravity forces. Once those forces are to big, the cloud collapse in itself and create a ball of hot magma. That’s the « proto-Earth », aged of 4,57Gy. As it is travelling in the space, it accumulates more and more particules, increasing its size. Once it reaches the scale of our actual Earth, we have a planet with two magmas undifferentiated, one composed by  « lithophile » and « chalcophile » elements (sorry, I do not know the translation, those are elements with affinities for some differents metals). Then, starts the processus of differentiation of the Earth, to form the core with chalcophiles elements, and the envelop called primitive mantle with lithophile elements.
 I could also talk about the differentiation of the primitive mantle into superior and inferior mantles, the core to solid and liquid cores, but it is more complicated to explain in english, and I do not know my lesson so well, sorry.
 An other point I could explain is how the atmosphere of the Earth became oxygenated. 4,57Gy ago, the atmosphere was mostly composed by Azote N, and the Oxygene 16O was only in the ocean. Indeed, it was produced by microplanctons which were eating algues. But with the fractures in the ocean floor, there were incoming of different elements, such as the iron 26Fe. What we need to know is that Fe3+ can be transformed into Fe4+ if it is combined with O2-. We have now iron oxydes in the ocean, and the concentration increase threw the years until one day, 2,1Gy ago, when we do not have enough iron to combine to oxygene, and oxygene can finally reach the atmosphere. It is called the Great Oxydation Event, in geosciences papers.
 That is fantastic because without this, we will not be alive on the Earth today!

In the end of 2015 in Paris, a scientist discovered on mouses that the environnement is influencing cocain addiction. Indeed, mouses were eather 4 in huge cages with toys, wheels to practise sport and  great food ou eather 10 in smalls cages with nothing else than basic food and water. These mouses had learned that they receive a automatic cocain dose when they go on a special button. So we realised that mouses in the bigger box are going less often on this button and also that it decreases by 80%  the risk of setback after stopping drug taking.
Besides prooving that lifestyle and life conditions are influencing drug addiction, this study demonstrated that a protein is produced in the brain which is related to a healthy and improved environnement and  that it is this protein which is fighting the addiction. They very recently identified this protein and now  they try to synthetise it with the purpose to create a pill against addiction setback.
 As a student I was selected to be part of this scientific experiment as a "beginning reseacher". So I was really involved in it. I think this study really matter because it prooves that addiction isn't only about addiction, but also a commun society problem of social classes and poverty. It demonstrates that politicians can act and not only doctors, or caretakers.
But my opinion about the "magic pill" against addiction is a little bit more complicated. Creating an helping pill fighting the need of drug, helping to stay clean is a good idea. But it's not a miracle solution : addicts will still need an huge motivation to stay clean and we still need to help them with a better environnement. It shouldn't be seen as a remplacement solution.
