Today, I would like to talk about cancers's research. Indeed, during the last decades there was (is) important studies about the cancer.
The approach I choose is a genetic one : with a much better understanding of the genome, researchers can identifie genes who can lead to cancer or protect us against the cancer.
For that researchers can do several things :
- "Knock down" of the genes of interest
- "Knock in" of the genes of interest
- track the genes
- ...
Usually, studies began by a short story of the cancer, and the challenges that came with it. During the first experiment, researchers (usually) show us where the genes (or the protein encodes by the gene) are by using fluorescent markers : this alload us and them to check the position of the gene and his "time of action".
Researchers can also start and show us the very begining of the experiment : they take a sample of the tumor/tissue of interest, isolate the cells and use flux cytometry to detect all of the genes in the tumor. With a lot of samples it's possible to detect wich genes are always present or absent, wich one are here only in a subtype of tumor...
After that, researchers can Knock down the genes using a transgenic mice. The transgenic mice is made up by the team : she has modified expression of her genes and she's usually the progenie of two mice who were modified. One of the mice has  gene who is inactive and the other has a marker who is going to attach himself to the kock down gene in the progenie.
Ater that, researchers can analyzed how the mouse is reacting : they marked their weight, their size, their attract to food,... They can also look how their interact with each others, how their react to fear, to cold water, to the drowning test,...
One thing that matter a lot in oncology is the reaction to drugs : drugs against cancer are very strong and can kill every working or not working mechanism in the body. Scientists are testing the reaction before and after the drug to see how patients would react to the treatment.
Thanks to the genotyping of the begining, scientists can also compare the reaction of a certain type of tumor and an other type of tumor against the drug : all of the tumor don't express the same genes, wich is tricky because that mean that all of the patient would not be responders. Researchers have to test wether or not a subtype of tumor is responding to the drug because if not the patient is not going to be able to fight against is cancer.
Who is responding and who is not responding alload us to gave drugs only to patients who would respond and try other treatments with the non responders.
 I truly think that research is very important and has to be done because it's the only thing that alload us to create new treatments, help and cure patients.
If we turn our back to research, we chose not to help patient, we deliberetly ignore things that we could know.
About the cancer research specifically, I think that the more we have data on the non responders and the responders, the more we can chose appropriate drugs to cure/help patients.
On the other hand, we have to be very carrefull about all the data that we collect : indeed, there are a lot of correlation that we don't know about and a lot a things that we don't no for sure of they are significant.
For example, they are some families who have a predisposition to cancer : we can test them and look for the mutation that give the cancer and Watch for the cancer to appear more carefully than the general population. But there are a lot of significant genes discover every weeks so the result is not for sure because theire  are a of mutations that we don't now about, there are also all the mutations who are maybe cancer's help but we don't now about them.
Research in general is a very fascinating subject that alload us (in médicine and in general) to help and create a more comfortable environnment for everyone, that alload us to understand everything that's happening among us.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
What is optogenetic ? This is a new method to study animal behavior. It consist in implanting, during the animal development, some markers wich are specific to different type of cells. When the animal has reached its adult size, scientist put a kind of detector on its head, linked to the brain. And then, by lighting the detector with a colored light, scientist can stimulate just some cells (those with the marker associated) and generate the behavior they want, like for example sexual or aggressive behavior. This way of testing is non lethal for animals, and permite to found exactly which area of the brain is responsible of which behavior.
 Optogenetic is a major  breakthrough in biology, specially in ethology. In fact, this is a new way of studying the brain and the origin of animals and humans behavoir. This new method is a lot more precise and ethic than the previous one, which consisted in mutilate animals and see what happens.

My father is an engineer, so his experience helped me a lot to saw engineers in a better way. I searched for different engineering schools and I found ESIR which has not just computer science but also biomedical. It was the perfect compromise between my two ideas.
Last year, I had to chose between biomedical and computer science, I decided to chose the biomedical way which combine biomedical science with computer science. I discovered the work of biomedical engineers during my internship. It is extremely intersting, it is a link between computer and medecine which allows doctors to do thing that they couldn't do without computers and programming (in surgery for example).
Finally, all those experiences lead me to become a biomedical engineer and even if engineering studies are not easy, I am happy of my decision.
Alex Dupont

In Paris, the autorization of putting on the market was in 1967, so many years have been passed between the discovery and the autorization..
 In my opinion, this discovery is fantastic, it's a revolution. Women can decide if they want to be pregnant or not. Now they got the choice and it's very important for women.
French mentality is changing step by step. Today the pill is using by many women, and especially by young women. It's important for women to keep the choice and to have access of contraception.

First, I am going to introduce you the history of penicillin.
This molecule is an antibiotic, discovered in 1929 by Sir Alex Dupont. Actually, this discovery was made by accident. Sir Alex Dupont was cultivating bacteria for research, and some fungi contaminates the culture. It was Sir Alex Dupont assistant who left the culture boxes open when they went onto vacations, which let the fungus grow with bacteria.
The fungus, named Penicillium sp,  produced a molecule which has the capacity to inhibit the growth of some kinds of bacteria. The scientist had the ideas to use this molecule to treat human infectious diseases during World War II.
 Now, I am going to talk about the consequences of this discovery.
The penicillin was then used as an antibiotic (because it was the first of this group of drug) to treat human various infectious diseases during World War II, and even today. This drug was used a little bit too much in my opinion. It was seen as the miracle drug, and used far all kind of diseases, even when it was not caused by bacteria.
It happened that nowadays, we have to create new and more powerful antibiotics to cure these infectious diseases, because new resistant bacteria emerges as a result of massive and unappropriate use of the old antibiotics. These resistant bacteria are known as "super bugs", and are very difficult to cure with antibiotics we can have in pharmacies, such as amoxicillin.
To conclude, we have now to pay attention to use the right antibiotic to treat the right bacteria, to avoid the emergence of new and stronger super bugs.

The media allow everyone to access current affairs and learn about themselves. Through different means of communication. They allow the individual to follow what is happening in the world on time. But we cannot ignore the fact that the mass media is dangerous. People are alienated by this media and no longer allow them to build their own opinion. The media influence opinion. Man is then no longer able to reason for himself and for his own reason. Now, I have the impression that real life is no longer so real and necessarily passes through the media and especially the internet and social networks. People tend to forget that among all these media, social interactions still exist. You just have to be careful about what you hear on the radio, or what you see on TV and you have to be able to choose the good news from the bad ones that the media is broadcasting. For example, in a certain dictatorship, the media are so powerful that they create a collective consciousness that no longer even realizes that it is living in a dictatorship because the influence is so strong that the reason of autonomous individuals is erased. . Of course the media are means of disseminating information through the medium of communication, but it is necessary to know how to sort it out.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences et proprietes de la matiere
Texte_etudiant:
Some animals have special abilities to survive in hard conditions. Scientists can run animal tests to exploit this capacities and maybe one day apply it to humans. Animal experimentation isn’t a new thing, in fact, to scientists have to run trials to commercialise a drug or a cosmetic supplies.
For medicinal drugs there are really strict laws to commercialise a drug. Industries have to follow many steps to make a safe and efficient antidots. For this they have to run tests on humans but before that they have to do it on animal. For this, they have various animal that are born just for testing, like rats, rabbits or even monkeys. Labs have to do like inhalations, skin contact, injections or ingestions on a long period to be sure that the drug is safe.
Some cosmetic industries do run animal testing but it is not an obligation. For exemple if a company wants to commercialise a cosmetic product in Paris which is a huge country and so a strategic country they are obligated to run trials on animal to commercialise their brand there.
But some brands have a special label that say that they do not test on animal, they are cruelty free.
Some animal like naked mole rats or axolots are stategic animal for the futur. The naked mole rat have the abilitie to survive his whole life without developping cancers or disies. They also do not feel pain, some scientis have put acids on them and this animal did not feel anything.
Axolots have the ability to regenerat their body parts, like legs or even brain parts. So some scientist do cut intentionaly this little animals body part.
Nowaday animal expérimentation is essential to cure ourselfs when we get sike, but is it essential to do it for cosmetic products?
 I think that animal testing is not essential, because this little things a breed only to run trials on them.
Some companies claim that they are not testing on animal and now a day people are oppening their eyes and prefer to use non tested products.

In the context of MACY conference (1942-1953), the diagram of Alex Dupont and Alex Dupont was created. It's a mathematics model of the communication between two peoples.
Alex Dupont, in the first time, define the communition like a linear and a unidirectionnal transmission between a human who talk and a another human who received. He's defined the "technical sound", a default in the canal of transmission.
In the second time, Alex Dupont humanized the diagram with another default : the "semantic sound", it's a probleme of comprehension between the people.
At the final, Alex Dupont has a different issue about this diagram and the Alex Dupont communication's definition, he's added the notion of "feedback" so his definition of the communication delect the adjectives "unidirectionnal" or "linear" of the transmission.
I think this diagram is a important evolution for the social science. He's proved the pluridisciplinary who's the communication science.

Artificial womb
Researchers recently found out a new way to conceive babies. Indeed, they constructed an artificial womb which is able to "replace" a human womb. A human baby could grow up safely in this machine without needing to be in his mother's belly. It is quite incredible to have been able to build that machine as we know all the specific mechanisms that are required to lead a safe pregnancy. In fact, every foetus needs a specific environment to develop and become a sound baby. It means that the artificial womb has to replace the mother in every single way, such as nutriment supplies which enables the foetus to grow as well as the security and the warmth of the mother's womb. It is quite impressive because this artificial womb is made with a see-trough material so that you could litteraly see your baby's evolutio month after month.
Apart from the craziness related to that kind of discoveries, we can also think that is logical in our century to develop those kind of medical machines. As we all know, not having the capacity of giving birth is a real trauma for many pepople that only imagine themselves as parents. Those technologies would enable people with fertility diseases to get the chance of giving birth to a lively and soud baby!
 I think that it is a great discovery and that medicine is more and more incredible. However the risk is that even sound women with a healthy womb would start to use this kind of machine.
Indeed, our society put a lot of pressure on young women not to get pregnant while working and having a career. As a result many of them would use an artificial womb but as we know, the human body is an extraordinary structure and maybe the artificial womb won't be as good as a human's one.
Moreover, we don't have any idea of how bad or good the outcomes of those artificial pregnancy are going to be. We do have to define rules in order to prevent abuses.

In 1454, Alex Dupont invented the printing press. This invention is a fundamental advance in the field of communication. The invention of the printing press made it possible to democratize access to books, which were previously reserved for monks. Printing also revolutionized the transmission of knowledge and currents of thought.
For me, printing is an invention that has made history. Indeed, it allows the propagation of books, books that allow us to cultivate ourselves, to learn to read and to disseminate knowledge in a general way. This advance is comparable for the time to the invention of the Internet in the twentieth century.
Printing allows in a greater sense the dissemination of information and allows easier communication between continents.

It was the first contact with this world, I discovered how a ward is organized, the role of different people who work in. It was weird at the beginning, because I had never seen patients before, some of them were really bad and I felt bad for them, I was like "How do they support to spend this time in a bed, whithout move or eat even drink?". Some people were totally dependant of the medical team, I knew that before, but in fact, it's really impressive to see it.
When I was in the abdominal surgery ward, I saw lots of people with colostomy+, and I think this kind of stuff really difficult to accept it, live with in daily life, mostly when you are young, because it can be an problem for self confidence, find a job, find a person who live with and create a family. I talk about colostomy because I saw it, but I think lots of pathology can cause similary problems.
 I knew that being hosptilased can be extremly difficult for people  and their family, but I discovered that is over more diffficult when people are alone and nobody come see them, because they don't have good relations with their relatives or because their relatives are too far (for exemple if the patient is a stranger on vacation).  Psychologic side is very important to go with the deases, and to be cure.
It permised me to discover the organisation of a ward, and the fact is that, in the medical team, practionners and nurses doesn't always know each other, certain nurses doesn't know the name of the interns, it's abnormal when you know how long they have working together. On the contrary, nurses and nursing auxiliaries really work in pairs, and that's really good for the good caring of the patient.

Alzheimer is a disease touching millions of citizisen around the world. It affects the brain cells which degenerated, causing a slow loss of memory.  Lots of research are undertaked around the world, and at the moment, there are no healing treatment, they try to slow down the degenerescence but they can not stop it, but there is hope.
The discovery of the probable mecanism of the disease : an accumalation of protein in the synapse of the cells, the tau protein and in the environment of the cells, there is the formation of amyloid plaques.
There is different prospects of treatment :
- Immunotherapy : Antibody of the the protein Tau and of the Beta amyloid which could stop the development of these plaque, and the degenerescence. This procedure is at a high rank of hope : the trials are going good. These treatment needs to be applicated in the begining of the disease, because it stops the propagation but, it is not restoring the lost cells.
-A Vaccine : kind of the same principe of the immunotherapy, with antibody against myeloid plaque, but there is a lot of side effetcs.
 It is really interesting to see all the mobilization of the research : scientist but also society (lots of donation), there is a lot of hope, and me, the first one, I feel really confident about the future of this disease, which at this moment is still unhealable.
A vaccine could be a fabulous way of prevention of these disease if it could be find, because people could be vaccine, and would never contract the disease that we can't threat..
For the immunotherapy, the patient needs to be take over fast and the disease needs to be diagnostic quickly since there is no recovery possible of the loss cell. SO this could be a good way, if the disease is already here, but it could be a brake because of the time of diagnosis..

Texte_etudiant: The hearing aid I'm going to speak about the hearing aid for the acouphens. Acouphens are noises that we heard, without exterior sound. It's like a whistling, or whisperer and it's very unpleasant for the person who have acouphens. They can appear because of a sonor trauma, or a diseas. They are different types of hearing aid : - The generator of "white sound" . This hearing aid is able to send a "white sound" on the ear of the patient and this "white sound" delete the acouphen. We give that hearing aid for the person who don't have auditive lost. - The auditiv help. This hearing aid is givefor the person who have a auditive lost. This aid is able to delete the auditive lost. Consequeses of hearing aid The consequences of this discover are many. Firts, this device is very expensive. It coast is around 200$. Secondly, when you take off your advice, the sound of your acouphen increase.

THE DISCOVERY OF THE PLASTIC SURGERY
       For a long time, there was no issues for people who were ugly. They had to leave with their complex during all their life. There were also people who had an accident and they couldn't do anything because they were disfigured and they had to live with that.
       Plastic surgery has been an exceptional discovery for these people because they found a solution to their problems. Let me give you an example : Alex Dupont. He was an afro american star and he didn't like his skin colour, and he also had a disease, the vitiligo which consists in a skin depigmentation so he decided to do plastic surgery and he became white. Plastic surgery changed his life for the best (for himself) but some detractors will say that he was ugly as a white peson.
      Plastic urgery is also a solution for serious burned people. It can be people who tried to immolate themself or also people who had and accident like a car crash who stayed in a fire for a while. We can practice plastic surgery on them to reimplant tissues, to give them a new skin, and forth and so on...
       There are also people that use it to remplace a part of their body because they find it ugly like their nose, their breast. It's a really expensive surgery but people don't care about the price. More and more people want to do plastic surgery, specially young adult. Everybody wants to become really beautiful htat's why they will pay to have a better nose, a better chin.
               That's why plastic surgery is a extraordinary discovery because it helps many kinds of people. From sick people to rich people who wants to become handsome.
 Plastic surgery is a really interesting speciality if it is used to help people in a death danger (like people who had an accident). However, it has some defaults. It can be used by the wrong people, and it can be too much used by very rich people. I think the government has to pute some regulations on the plastic surgery, in order to be not missused by the wrong persons.

The surgery robot in urologic surgery room.
Few weeks ago I went to semiology stage in urology and after a small recap and a endoscopy on a patient we went to the surgery room.
We were six : three in each room. We went to the one with one of the two robots for surgery in Paris : it was the latest, at the top of the technology and was really recent : it has arrived just few months ago.
There was a lot of people : nurses, and students in medicine, doctors. The surgeon had his hands on two joystics and controlled 4 articulated arms which were in the patient's body in 4 different little holes. He has his head on a screen with sort of glasses like microscope or binocular microcope. The camera was really good, there was a strong light and we saw everything on a screen.
The 4 arms can have different accessories and the surgeon controlled only 3 out of 4 ; 4 is when there is two surgeons working together.
The second seat where the second surgeon usually seat was free so we went on it just to see as if we where surgeons.
 It was amazing. I was amazed ; when I went to the room I was sort of shocked : the 5 first minutes, I didn't realise that the robot was in the body and that we saw the body's interior ; it was sort of unrealistic and futurist.
Then we discussed with the surgeon and he said that all the positive points due to this robot were incredible :
Less invasive surgeries : only 4 little holes and not a big one
Possibility to look and zoom in the body
 (he said that some surgeons saw anatomic structures that they had never seen before !)
More and more precision (all the moves are very little, with the help of the robot).
One last point that shocked me was the ability and how easily the surgeon did that surgery : maybe it is his work but he was doing a prostatectomy andjust talked about his friend's food habits with other people in the room as if he was in a bar !
To conclude, that was amazing and I really loved that morning.

Teh Nobel of 2018 was about immunotherapy. Immunotherapy is already known and used in medecine but they discovered a new method to create antibody.
Immunotherapy is based on the princip that we can create in vitro antibody to implat them on a patient to cure him. An antibody is a protein made physiologicaly by the body to defend himself against virus and bacteries. Its a protein with 4 part : 2 heavy-chains and 2 light-chains in a strucure in Y. There is a constant part and 2 variables parts. The constant part can be reconized by the immunity cells, and the variable part is specific to an unique antigen (a molecule specific of what isn't physiologicaly in our body). So in a way, it's coud be possible to create antibody against almost every thing : for example, it would be possible to use an antibody against the the oestrogen receptor on mammary cells, receptor which is overexpressed in the mammary cancer.
To create an antibody, there is different possibilities but the more efficient is to to take a B-lymphocyte (the cells whose secrets anti body) from a healthy people, then to activate him with the molecule we want him to create antibody against, and to modify his DNA to make it cancerous and to implant it in a mouse, and so he will multiply and we would be able to take plenty of anti body in the mouse's blood.
 I think immunotherapy is a fabulous way to cure people, and offer plenty of opportunities with incurable disease. However, we need to take care about the power it gives and we need to stay focus on the good way to use it. Moreover, we need to take a look at the mousetreatment which is not so good with a cancer.

I'm going to introduce the Montessori pedagogie. This pedagogie was elaborated by Alex Dupont 200 years ago.
Firstly, this pedagogie is based on the child's development and allows them to de independant in their learning. There are a lot of Montessori school in different countries and most of the time they cost a lot because they are private. Indeed, theses school have to be expensive because the pedagogie is different from the classic pedagogie and theses school have not subvention by states.
Secondly, in theses schools, there are not always many classroom for each age. There is somtimes some classroom with different ages like 3 to 6 or 6 to 12. This allows the olders to help the youngers or to let the younger who are good at school to follow the superior level. Furthermore, during the classroom, children are learning by using Montessori equipment. There is no assesment in theses school.
Finally, we can say that this pedagogie is a real efficient pedagogie witch allows pupils to be independant in their learning. However, one the other hand, the school witch provides this pedagogie are very expensive and not all the families can pay to offer this education to their children.
 In my opinion, I think that this pedagogie is better for a child than the pedagogie used in classic classroom because every children learn at their own pace. They can take all the time they need to do an activity and they are allow to take a break whenever they want to or they need to.
However, I think that it sucks that this education is expensive because I would like them to be more accessible. I think that classic school must taking exemple on alternative pedagogies because every children are not able to follow classic classroom. Every children are different and have different needs. Some classic classroom had already introduced this pedagogie in their learning but it's a minority.
Finally, I think that nowadays the pedagogie in classic classroom is not made for every pupils because it do not take care of every singularity and needs. I think that if the Montessori or any others alternative pedagogies are introduce in classroom, the children's education will be better than now.

The printing press was invented by Alex Dupont in 1454. While interested in text production, he researched printing techniques. Before him, the bible was the only book and they were writing by the clergy because they were the only ones who were literate. The bible was actually the first book print.
The printing press has been develop in Europe the same century.
This discovery revolutionised thinking, particularly during the Réforme, when Alex Dupont used the printing press to disseminate his ideas about the world. Until the revolution, printing was reserved for Catholics, and was subject to censorship, then it became free.
From nowadays, the printing press became very important for the media, especially for the magazine, the books, advertisements, …
 I think the printing press is not going to die tomorrow, but maybe in the next few generations it will lose interest as the world goes digital.
Furthermore, printing requires paper produced from trees and it’s not very healthy for the Earth, even if now they recycle.

Hello, I'm going to write my feelings about one of my favorite series of video games, the Hotline Miami saga.
Hotline Miami is a serie of two indie games, Hotline Miami and Hotline Miami 2 : Wrong Number. The two are 2D video games with view from above and a very retro graphic style. Hotline Miami is mostly famous for his explicit violence, the hard difficulty of the levels ("die and retry" game), the amazing musics (synthwave style), the cryptic events following the main story, the "on drugs" and 80's vibes feelings during the adventure.
The world of Hotline Miami is an uchronia (an alternate history), in which the Paris and the Paris have fought each other in a war during the 80's. The Paris capitulated after the destruction of Paris by an atomic bomb. The game set place in Paris, where the russian mafia activity is growing since the end of the Paris/USSR war. The game feature many playable characters, mostly in the second game.
In the first game, the player is left with a quick tutorial and no story elements at all, you start the game without even knowing the name or background of the character you are playing. The player soon discover that his character live alone in an appartment in Paris, and that someone leaves cryptic phone's message to him, like a professional call telling him to go at some places to do some work. Our characther follow these instructions and leave his appartment to take his vehicule and drive to the adress of the phone message. However, when the character arrives at the place, the player has to choose an animal mask to wear and discovers a place full of ennemies.The core of the game is to clear all the building by eliminating all the ennemies inside, then going back to your car. Firstly, the player is encourage to kill, with the score and combos system, and the catchy music. However, after succeeding to kill every ennemy, the music stop suddenly, replaced by a weighty sound, and the player has to travel all the way back to his vehicule, seeing all the dead bodies left on the way. The more you progress in the game, the more the story will be brought to the forefront in place of the gameplay, and the player would not only play the game but try to understand what happens.
I liked the game for the unique storytelling, and the meaning that we get after succeeding to understand all the links between the events of the two games.
Despite the first look, Hotline Miami is a game against the violence, and left a strong feeling of accomplishment for both succeed all levels and finally understand the whole story and the message associated.

Texte_etudiant:
The epigenetic
The epigenetic, it's a modification of the expression to DNA, without genetic modification. It's a domain of study near to the genetic but it's very recente. The epigenetic gives  much informations. The epigenetic can be use in differents domains like the health, the research and other. It explains many things like the cat color "calicot" which is a modification epigenetic in the DNA of the female cat. For example, epigenetic is observed on the mouse, which are differents because the food eat by the mother. The epigenetic can have different form. In first the condensation of the chromatine which can silenced or activated differents genes. The histones can be modified by methylation, ubiquitination and other.
It existes many methodes in epigenetic like the Chip, which is a immunoprecipitation.
 For me this discover is really important because this allows to know more mecanism genetic, like the plant vernalization and the devernalization. It can be use in agronomy, genetic, medical research and many others fields. The plants use the epigenetic to resist against the global warming. It can modify the response to  some stresses, like drought stress, heat stress, light stress... The vernalization needs epigenetics modifications with methylation of the histone H3K27, which silence FLC gene and H3K4, which active the same gene. H3K27me3 silences the FLC which silence an important gene for the flowering , FT. The vernalization depend to the cold and the heat. The methylation depend to these stresses.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
The transect method is an ecological technique which permit the ecologists to numbered and named the species living on a large place.  It consists in looking for every subject of interest like pollinators, flowered plants, birds, etc.
  	To create a transect, the scientist should define the subject of his study (pollinators, for example) and the parameters he wants to test like the number of individuals, the amount of different species and the climatic conditions of the site. Then, he decides which place he wants to inventory and creates the path (straightest as possible) he will take.
 During the manipulation, the ecologist could take the information in two ways. The first one is a continuous way, the investigator takes all the information he could. Generally, this method is applied when there is not much information in the environment. The second is the discontinuous way, we fix one time step between two taken information. The technique is used when there is two much data in the site.
	This method is very efficient in ecology because it allows to see that the environment is complex and variable, so the experimenter could note every extra information he sees. Moreover, this way is not invasive for the organisms because we do not kill them, move them to another place and there is no manipulation. It also includes a low cost.
 However, the technique brings some issues. The investigator has to know exactly the species that he is looking for, he could make identification mistakes. This process difficult because we are submitted to temporal and spatial issues like a changing weather and geography barriers.
  	The transect method is a very useful technique used in ecology to inventory an environment but it has some drawbacks for the experimenter.

I will speak about the anathomopathology, also called anapath.
It a medical speciality where scientist have to describe macroscopic and microscopic lesions and how cells interact together.
Anapath is used in diagnosis to reveal diseases, but also to evalue the pronostic of a tumor or in DNA therapy.
Anathomopathologist work also in research, for example in epidemiology, to make statistic or to develop new therapy more resistant.
This speciality work on cell or tissue prelevment made on body. Doctors have to fixed them in formol, to keep the organisation, then to include in parrafin, to cut thanks to a microtome in a microscopic band, to observe it under a microscope.
 On one hand, this speciality is very important in medecine, because it helps the clinician to cut of tumor. In fact it will indicate to the surgeon if he "kills" all the tumor. It's now better because we don't have to make the operation, then verify with a scann or MRI if the surgeon worked well, and if it's not a good work, call again the patient to operate another time.
  On the other hand, anapath can also reserch specific proteins to see if a treatment will work on a patient. In other words anapath brings a pronostic. Now a patient can recieve a treatment if we know that it will work on him.

So the disrupting technological advance in my speciality( computer science) is I think the new technology that we call the « blockchain » . It is fairly new and the vast majority of people don’t really know about it. Blockchain is the main technology behind most of the cryptocurrency that are built today.
 What is a crypto currency you may ask ? Well you certainly may have heard about bitcoin, now or before (and you will certainly heard about in the years coming). Bitcoin is the first crypto currency based on the blockchain technology that was created by Alex Dupont in 2008.
 It seems quite incredible, but before bitcoin we didn’t have « virtual money ». We didn’t know how to send money from one person to another. From a point A to B. And that’s what bitcoin does. The great thing is there is no need to go through an intermediate like banks or government. The bitcoin network is truly decentralized which means that at least you take control of all the computers on earth, no government can shut it off.
 Bitcoin first solved a main problem in the computer science field named « Byzantine fault tolerance ». It is basically solving trust issues. How do you trust a system knowing that people will maybe try to lie to you ?
 In the Byzantine problem, we have commanders outside of a city, that they must overtake. The commanders can only communicate oraly or by sending message to each other. But the problem is the messengers can lie. So how do you make a satisfeasible plan, knowing that some may lies ?
 Bitcoin solved this problem by creating the blockchain, a very big register where all the transaction are listed. And with the miners(people who uses computer to power the bitcoin network) all the transactions made on the network are verified. So there can be no fake transaction.
 There will be real consequences in the real world. Well bitcoin is the first of it's kind and has many drawbacks. It's like the myspace of social network or the emule of p2p. Cool but sadly determined to disappear.
Bitcoin was started on 2008. And to verify the big register file of all transactions, there are miners that use their computer hashpower to resolve problems and run the network. This is called the proof of work. The problem is we didn't know it will be so successful and bitcoin consume a LOT of energy/electricity. If the network was a country it would be the 42th country, that consume the most electricity right between Paris and Paris.
This is a great drawback and people are trying to find alternative. The another drawback is that if someone controls 51% of the network mining power, it is theoricaly possible to corrupt the network and create false transactions. So literally creating bitcoin "out of nowhere".
If we want to be truly visionary we can imagine a future where fiat money(dollar, euro) will disappear and let the place to crypto currency. It might take 10-20 years maybe, but it is definitively possible. The proof of work, which is one of the main problem will soon be solved by the proof of stake concept which is more efficient and cost less energy.
Children(!) in Paris, Paris or even Paris are already familiarised with cryptocurrency and they no longer ask for money at christmas but for bitcoin or other cryptocurrency.

The discovery of penicillin
Penicillin is one of the first antibiotics found. In 1928, Dr Alex Dupont forgot his Petri culture for two weks. After that delay, he observed a contamination by fungi from another Petri culture, which has been incubated at the same time. The fungi contamination has inhibated the developpement of bacterias. The fungi have produced a toxin, the penicillin, headed to the bacterias and their growth.
The developpement of the product of the fungi Penicillium has lead to the production of it as a cure to some bacterial infection. The developpement was accelerated by the Second world war and the emergency of finding medications to treat soldier's infections. Within 4 years, the penicillin was synthetized and industrially produced in high quantities.
For the following decades, the use of penicillin became a habit to every hospital and genral practitioners to provide strong bacterial infection such as pulmonar infection, septicemia etc. Following this discover, the scientists succeded to develop other families of antibiotics and optomized their production and therapeutical use.
 The consequences :
The discovery of penicillin is the first antibiotic to be found and developped extremely quickly. The production's capacities weren't as efficienty as it is now. It saved thousands of lifes, at the front during the WWII and after that, to treat epidemias, which devasted countries by that time. It saved thousands of lives and prevent injuries such as necrosis and general septicemia.
The production of the penicillin is also cheap, so the cost is supportable even for in-developpement countries. The speckter of action is also large, with a three times-a-day administration. It is taken oraly, so it doesn't required a medical structure. It is really useful on the field, in region where the access to the health care system is not optimal. The statistics showed a significative link between the developpement and the use of penicillin and the inscreased of life rate in the world.
With a worldwide and frequent use come side effects. One of the main consequences is the developpement of resistance from the bacteries. The antibiotic selects the resistant mutans and destroyed the rest of the population, which is provided the developpement of resistance. It slows down the efficient treatement of the specific bacteria and held to  difficulties of treating properly the patient.
As a conclusion to this discovery, it helps dealing with lethal diseases which were stricking a century ago, but the developpement of resistances from the bacteries led to apply protocoles to have a better use of antibiotics and adaptation to the resistance's mechanism.

I'm going to talk about a research which concern anesthesist.
In the last decades, reseachers works on the effects of the body temperature during and after a surgery.
Indeed, they discover that:
On the one hand, if your temperature is to lower, you can have cardiovascular complication for example. You have a worst capacity of recuperation. Your body is more weaker. That's why it's important to regulate it. A patient in hypotermia is difficult to handle, your body release some hormones which have bad effects in this case. A lower temprature demand more energy to struggle against it.
Moreover we must be aware that patient are nearly naked, and the surgery room is part of the time cold. That's why we have to be more careful of it.
On the other hand, if your temperature is correct, you have less complications. The patient feels better and recover more easily. He has less impacts of the surgery.
To put in a nutshell, body temperature during surgery has a real impact for the patient ans his recovery.
 This experience allows at anesthsists to change their practices belong the temperature of their patient.
We can improve his recuperation by simple acts.
This is a new aspect very important for the comfort of our patient, we must keep it in memory.

500,000 $. That's what the promising SpinLaunch startup aims to spend for launching a satellite on a sub-orbital flight. The American private startup which received the help of the American NASA agency owns a patent that allows to launch satellite in a very eco-friendly particular way. How does it work ? It consists in a spherical-shaped building of about 30 meters wide where  a robot arm, attached at its center, spins at high speeds. A satellite that weights about 30 kg is attached at the end of the arm. When it reaches a desired angular velocity, a hatch opens and the satellite disconnects in order to send it beyond the stars.
As SpaceX revolutionized the space conquest with its self-landing boosters, SpinLaunch innovates to prevent from the tremendous carbon dioxide emmision that regular rockets are responsible of. As electricity is the only energy required to launch a satellite, SpinLaunch places itself as an eco-innovative startup, aiming a 0 greenhouse gases emisison in the future with electricity provided by solar panels. SpinLaunch  plans on 4 to 5 launches a day with a cost at around 500,000 $. Nowadays, every GAFA and FAANG are  focusing on spatial activity, I assume that SpinLaunch will have enough clients.
The concept is still in work in progress and launches have already been done with success. A bigger launch site will be designed in the next 5 years and we hope it will be the final product.
Eco-innovative projects are getting more and more trendy but SpinLaunch is the one I have faith on. As it received the help of NASA, it means that it’s a company we can have trust on. A cheap, silent, carbon-free way of sending satellites can appear utopic at first but as more we dig in, it feels achievable. Moreover, the startup is putting a lot of interest on their communication that leads to multiple explanation of their concept and all the technical issues they went through. As an example, the arm has to be surrounded by void to avoid any air friction. It means that the building is the second biggest piece of void in the world. How do you achieve that ? By reuniting the greatest engineers in the world. As a future engineer, I found the project really exciting and I am looking forward to hear from the advancement soon

Today, I talk about an scientific experiment, when in class we have make our Aspirin®. At the university we have practical work several times a week and this week we have synthesize the aspirin thanks to the acetic anhydride and the salicylic acid.
 For this experiment we have use the process developed in 1975. It is rather easy and consists of the esterification of the hydroxyl function of salicylic acid with acetic anhydride, in an acid medium.
 To start we have be levied the start product, we have insert in a ballon and we have heat the mixture. Then we have filter the mixture to recupered the Aspirin. But now we don't have the final product, to get it we cleaned the product obtained with ethanol and water before filtering it again.
 Then we weigh and we test the point of fusion of our apsirin to control the product formed. We have formed a good product because we obtain a 69% yield.
 This experience was very rewarding

I started programming since I was 14.
As a kid, I was fascinated about these series where hackers could do some cool things like remote controlling a computer or even cheat on games and get unlimited money.
Obviously I knew that I could not hack a computer, why would I do this ? My main goal was ONE game : Dragon City on facebook, all of my friends had their dragons on their islands but I wanted one thing : crushing them.
So, I went on Google and searched for hours how to get unlimited money on the game and finally I found a way, it was nothing about programming but that is why I became passionated about computers and everything related to this world.
When my friends saw the amount of money and dragons I had, they were impressed by me, they thought I was hackerman, but in reality I was just googleman, all my results were from Google...
Years passed and I entered in highschool, I was 12 and with some friends we were all playing a game called Minecraft, during holidays we passed 7-8 hours in a day playing Minecraft, it was a multiplayer game where they were some servers within some fun minigames.
These servers were not hosted by Mojang (the company that created Minecraft) it was people like you and me who just googled some tutorials about creating a server, the real difficulty was not to create the server, it was to add minigames on the server, so we had to use somethings called plugins that extends the game functionnality but we had to develop these plugins using a programming language called JAVA. So I had 2 choices in front of me :
- Use some peoples plugins
- Create my own plugin
You who are reading this, you should have an idea of what I choose.
Use peoples plugins... yeah I was way too lazy to learn a programming language ahah...
BUT few years later when I hit 14, I used to be more creative than now, I wanted a plugin that no one had the idea.
So I had to create my own plugin. It was the most difficult thing I did, I had to learn alone a brand new logic that I didn't have, I passed multiples month understanding how this thing created by the devil in person could exist (I mean the JAVA programming language) and one day it worked.
My first plugin worked and I was so happy, it was just a plugin that send a funny message every 5 minutes but I was proud of me, I pratically got the logic behind it, I was enjoying programming, and because of this plugin and this story I knew which job I wanted to do : programmer.
Now you know why I am doing computer science studies and I actually love the JAVA programming language.
Thanks for reading.

I would like to talk about a new revolution in Computer Sciences. The first computer was created in 1956 and a lot of transformations took place since. Indeed, the capacity of each computer to calculate more and more faster enabled to make a digital transition in lots of fields of the society in only few decades. But in 2012, a new innovation appeared : the artificial intelligence. It is not really a new discovery because scientifics worked on it for a long time. Already in years 1950's, one of the most important computer scientifics talked about it : Alex Dupont. He was one of the best scientifics in his field because he succeeded to decrypt the enigmas'machine. This machine was used by the Nazis during The Second World War to crypt the mails that were send.
Alex Dupont talked about AI and created a test. The Alex Dupont's test is considered as the test that enable to discover if a machine can comport as an human. It consists on a dialog between a human and a machine. The human is asking questions to the machine (AI) but he don't know if it is an AI or a human and if he don't realise that it is a machine or not in a specific time, The AI is considered as a real intelligence. Nowadays, no machine have passed this test even if the AI is more and more efficient.
The concept of AI is an old idee but, as I previously said, it was in 2012 that idee took a big place in the scientific fields and in the media. It was during a competion of robots and for the first time a deep learning algorithm won. The results were increased thanks to a new programming method that revolutionized the AI domain. Since 2012, more projects were designed by including AI. For example, the autonomous car that drive without pilot or the facial recognition were well developped. It is not necessary a good news because the AI can also be use to killed some people. Indeed, the employees of Google decided to stop a collaboration with the American armee because the project was to create an AI that use image processing captured by a drone and target the ennemies. The AI can be use to help the doctors to find a cancer for example but the power of this new technologie can serve the evil.
The using of AI can not be made without an ethic reflexion. The damage that can cause can be a desaster. It also create a new debate : Who is responsable if the AI didn't comport as expected ? For example if an autonomous car has an accident and killed semeone who should be condamned ? Is it the developper, the constructor of the car or the pilot ? The question is not simple to answer.
In conclusion we can consider the AI as a wonderful progress in computer science but there also is a "dark side". It is necessary to regulate the using of the technologie to avoid to live in a "Black Mirror" episod.

In 1974, Alex Dupont and Alex Dupont, two scientists realized an experience about the attraction of the source in the field of social psychology.
The experience was simple. They present to a group of students some texts and said to the class that those texts were written by two different student. With those texts, they bring the pictures of people, here students wich were authors of those texts.
The first texts was not a good one. It was baddly write, not really structured. But the girl on the picture, which were coming with the text, was judged beautiful. She was corresponding to the norms of society at the time. As a contrary, the second text was nearly perfect. Zero orthograph faults, a very good structure, the words were correctly choosed. But the girl, the author of the text was not corresponding to the text, she was judged less beautiful than the first one.
After giving the texts and the picture of their authors, Alex Dupont and Alex Dupont asked the class to judged the quality of those texts and the capacity of writing of each author. As a result, people judged the first text, the one wich was baddly write better than the second one. Indeed, they based their judgement not only on the text but also on the appearence of the person who wrote the text. The first girl was judged better looking than the second one. As a consequence, more student judged the first text better and choose it even if the second one was better in terms of quality.
Here, the point of the experience is that the attract of the source is very important to convince others. Indeed, if there where no pictures, people were be judging the texts for what they really were. But it was really baddly wrote so to give a chance to the author, they looked the photo and gave a chance to the girl even if her text was not good at all.
 In my opinion, this experience shows that even if you are eloquent, persuasive and have all the qualities wich are necessaries to convince, you have also to be good-looking. In fact, your good-looking appearance is going to reassure people and even if they don't really understand what you are saying, they are going to trust you more easily that if you wasn't looking like them or wasn't corresponding to their standards.

The engram has been discovered recently in neurology by searchers. It is a concept that tries to modelize a connection between neurones that is created when the brain discovers new things of the world through the eyes, the ears, the proprioception receptors etc.
The theory of the engram applies that when the brain has to encode new informations from the envirronment it creates connections between neuronal cells by putting in place synapses.
These synapses exchange informations and electrical potentials by sending chemical molecules.
Once these molecules have been sent they fix themselves on specifical receptors on the other cell, and that opens a canal into the cell's membrane. These synapses lead neurones to connect and to communicate.
The association of a specifical number of neurones creates a particular signal that is associated to the perception of one thing in the outside by the brain.
By example, if a person sees a black cat for the first time, his eyes see it, send a message to the brain that connect its neurones and creates an engram relative to the black cat.
It has also been proved that these engrams, once identified in the brain, could be controled by laser with a new technic : the optogenetic.
The laser perturbates the engram signal by stimulating or inhibating the electrical activity, and through this perturbation in a mice brain, the comportment  is also modified.
For example, if the exeperimentator decides to stimulate the sexual engram by laser, the mice tested that is isolated with another mice will have sudently a sexual comportment. Meanwhile, if the experimentator stimulates the aggressivity engram then the mice will attack the other one.
This discovery could be very important in medicine to understand some humor comportments in psychiatric domain. Actually, it has been proved that some engrams that were created at the same time by the brain were then associated even if the two elements have nothing in common.
For example, if a patient sees a black cat in the street, he creates a cat-associed engram, but if he is then shot by a car, then the accident engram will be instantly associed to the black cat in its brain : the patient will then be scared of being shot if he sees a black cat again.
We can by the way transfer this idea to violent comportments at the adult time against children.
Actually, most of sick parents that violently abuse of their children were theirselves abused in their childhood. We can think that their engram of love and family is associed to the engram of violence and so when they have their own baby their engrams active them each others and that creates mental disorders and explains in a way their comportment.
 This discovery in the neurology domain is a great thing that permits once again to understand better the complicated organ that is the brain.
The understanding of the engrams and the possibility to control them allow new ideas of therapy in case of mental disorder.
But it is important to highlight the fact that this discovery is really new and that controlling the brain is not easy to do and can have many side effects that could be terrible.
Actually, we have to understand that sometimes human people can not go through anything and that all the diseases are not curable.  The idea of becoming more and more powerfull on our own body can lead to serious problems and all the experiences have to be realized in normal conditions always respecting patients in an ethical way.
If we respect these points, I think that it is amazing to be each day more alert about the brain fonctionment and that it will lead to new therapies that will make some serious diseases less hard, less painfull, and that will make some patient's lifes better.
Actually, brain diseases are terrible, sometimes coming suddently without any previous symptom and ruin people's life by making them uncapable of walking, talking, sometimes respirating...
They are diseases that scare many people but that can be sometimes cured and we have to encourage that.

The great remplacement (Le Grand Remplacement, in french) was invented by Alex Dupont in a book in 2010. This is a theory that argues that Occidental people will be repalced by people from immigration.
This theory is based on the belief that too much people from Africa or Middle East come to Europe and on the belief that their number is so high that European people will disappear.
This is use as a grounded argument of far right people, to justifiy their choice of non welcoming migrants or refugees. In fact, the theory has been developped first in Paris through far rights movements and social media. Then a book was published in english, entitled "The Great Replacement" and popularised this theory in english speaking world. Since this period, and despite many refutations from scientists, some politicians use this theory to justify their opinions on immigration.
 This theory is far from a scientific one. Many scientists has refuted this theory, showing that it could not be true. Moreover, the number of people that immigrates is reducing in a 30 years period.
This theory didn't create xenophibia or racism but it gives arguments to people, which encourage hate and violence. In fact, Alex Dupont, the author, claims that he is not pacific. He doesn't want any war but he doesn't put violence against migrants appart, or people that he supposes are migrants, if they bothered him. Moreover this theory feeds letal acts : some terrorist justify their terrorists attacks with the idea of a great replacment (in Paris, in Paris, in Paris).
So even if this theory has not created hate is fosters it. People are died after arguments from this theory.

I would like to take about the regeneration of the entire human epidermis using transgenic stem cells. Scientifs performed a therapy genetic using stem cells of a little boy. This child has a genetic disease : Junctional epidermolysis bullosa. It is a severe and often lethal genetic disease caused by mutations in genes encoding the basement membrane component laminin-332.
Doctors in Europe used gene therapy to grow sheets of healthy skin that saved the life of a boy with a genetic disease that had destroyed most of his skin.
This was not the first use of the treatment, which adds gene therapy to a technique developed to grow skin grafts for burn victims. But it was by far the most body surface ever covered in a patient with a genetic disorder: nine square feet.
The boy’s disease, junctional epidermolysis bullosa, causes extremely fragile skin that blisters and tears, and is prone to infections and skin cancer. He had been expected to die but has recovered. Two years after the treatment, he continues to have healthy skin and lead a normal life. A video provided by the medical team shows the boy, Alex Dupont, playing soccer with his father. According to news reports, the family is originally from Paris.
Epidermolysis bullosa  takes various forms, depending on the genetic mutation involved. About 25,000 people in Paris have the condition, and 500,000 worldwide. The severity varies, but some patients spend much of their lives covered in bandages and in severe pain.
 This could be the beginning of the treatment of Junctional epidermolysis bullosa (JEB) ?
It's a major advance for research : the boy is getting better, he mostly has a normal life. Nevertheless, we can't treat his mucous membrane.
Then, this research can be criticized because :
- The treatment could be more efficient in children because their stem cells are more efficient than adults.
- Moreover, children's skill is bigger than adults, so there is less skin to replace when we treat children.
Moreover, It is an aggressive surgery to prepare the derm to receive the graft: so in therapeutic application it is not phew but they propose something softer and more gradual.
Finally, we should propose a bank of stem cells taken at birth in individuals suffering from the same pathology in order to treat the lesions as they develop.

The studie was about effects of the music on neurodegenerative illness.
It has been proved that playing music could change cerebral structure and cerebral functions. Music also impact cerebral regions involved in high level cognitives schedules such as attention or memory.
Previous studies had already proved the impact on children brain. Indeed with RMI we found that some musicians cerebral parts  were highly extend in comparaison of a non musician.
But there is a new interest in this studie. Indeed, the music could help to prevent neurodegeneratives pathologies like Alzheimer. This practice won't avoid the apparition of the disease but it could help to retard the symptoms. Music also seems to be very interesting for patient in a critical state of the disease. In fact, most of the time music is the only way for them to communicate. Observations of sing or music classroom has shown an high cognitive wake up for the patients. During these sessions we noticed as well a decreased in their comportemental troubles. To finish, with the help of the music we found that it was possible for Alzheimer patients to learn new things inconsciously with repetitions of tasks.
 I think this studie shows an alternative way in the treatment of neurodegenerative diseases. It's interesant because it's a low cost possibility to help those people. It is also a way to stimulate them and help them to enjoy therselve. An important point is the fact that there are absolutely no side effects.

During my last internship, I worked at the IT department of the super U markets. I discover the wonderful (or not) world of the AS400, a leading technology of IBM.
This is a computer system that is in the center of a lot of applications and functionalities of the computer and software part of this company, and a lot of others. I partially like this technology because it is very powerful and fast. It can for example store a lot of data (products, customers, sells), with the scale of a country (millions of lines of data per days), and with query can access it in a few milliseconds. This system is used all around the world, because I think that IBM has succeeded in creating a well-built hardware and software that is powerful, extensible and very stable.
But the awful part of the AS400 is the development and maintenance. The cause : it was built around the 80s. So it is a very old machine that was thought with the needs of its time, and cannot really be used nowadays. For instance, to create a functionality in it, you are required to use a programming language that is very old. It needs to be in a structure of columns, and is not pleasant to the eyes.Furthermore, to build a module or to develop a functionality, you need to edit your code in the same environment as the final user, that has not evolved since the beginning. It is composed of a terminal like interface, with a black screen and green text, all arranged in rows and columns. During my internship, I saw that when you have a problem appearing on it, it can take hours, even days to debug and understand all the process of data and information that is going through every piece of the puzzle.
Another problem is that the AS400 require a technical skill that is not taught anymore at school. Maybe you can go to formations with your company, but this is not possible to learn by yourself. So this technology is disappearing because no more people has knowledge about it. The ones that do have these skills, are starting to retire because of their age, since the AS400 is more than 40 years old.I can see this problem as an opportunity, because if there are fewer offers in that domain and if you can teach yourself or take advantage of your company to learn it, it can provide, as long as the technology is still alive, a well paid job in any big company in any location.
But overall, the AS400 is not a technology that I would learn, because companies want to throw away all of their applications that are using it, and rebuild all of their infrastructure with newer technologies. Even if it is not possible now to get rid of it, the only jobs are maintenance and not development of new and interesting technologies. This system is like a chard in the foot for a lot of companies.

The anxiolytics are the most prescribed drugs in Paris. We are facing a problem because these drugs are leading to a heavy dependance, car crashes, social isolation and sometimes to suicide.
Nowadays, GPs are prescribing anxiolytics to every anxious people, even if there are lots of alternatives like méditation, hypnosis... Which have no adverse effects.
The following paradoxe is interesting : more and more people are consuming anxiolytics while meditation and hypnosis are known to have better results by being more healthy.
In fact, Anxiolytics are the most efficient therapy in some situations when the patient is really handicaped by his anxiety, but the efficiency is unbalanced by some disorders : risk of falling, muscular weakness, amnesia and can lead to coma if the posology isn't adapted !
Moreover, anxiolytics, and to take exemple Benzodiazepines, are destroying the intestinal flore which is really important for the transit and by producing some enzymes.
 In my opinion, GPs should present all the different treatments to the patient and discuss with him about the most appropriate one.
Using this kind of medications which are strong should come to the end, when the others therapies have failed.
I personnaly think that we have to start by treating people's minds before using  chemical products.
WHY ? Simply because when we use anxiolytics, we are just treating the symptomes, but the anxiety is staying there.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
I am going to talk about a molecul, the acrylamide.
 This molecul appear during the cook of food at high temperature (>120°C). Acrylamide is created during the Alex Dupont reaction. This reaction is more important with aliments with high level of sugar (asparagin...). We find a lot of acrylamide in chips, crisps, coffee... This molecul can be used by the industriels for water treatment, or for the paper industrie... Acrylamide is quickly absorbed by oral way, it's spread everywhere on the organism and quickly and it's metabolism on the liver into glycidamide.
On the body, acrylamide and it's metabolit the glycidamide can link proteins, DNA and hemoglobins. They are both eliminated by the urine. The exposition of acrylamide on the food (and indireclty by the glycidamide) can be toxic. Those moleculs can created nervous deases, they can be toxic for the reproduction organs, they can created cancers and mutations to the cells of the body and the spermatozoïdes too. These consequences of the exposition are confirmed for the animals (rats, mouses...). For the Humans, the only things that we are sure is that this exposition create nervous troubles (shorts and long terms expositions), but we don't realy know if it can created cancers and mutations. So, we have to be careful about the during, and the temperature during the cook of food even if we are not sure about the consequences on the Human body.

Virtual and Augmented Reality (respectivly VR and AR) are according to me one the biggest technological progress of the century.
The VIrtual Reality consists in putting a kind of mask on his head that has a specific screen inside of it. The screen displays a video or an interactive world and the screen will move the image displayed depending on the movements of your head. So if you move your head to the right, the screen will show you what's on the right. The movements of your head are detected by captors in the room where you are.
Sometimes VR masks are used with controllers that allows you to move in the world displayed by the mask.
The Augmented Reality is a little bit different because you don't need a specific mask but just a smartphone (or a device with a camera and a screen).
So the camera will film what's in front of it and thanks to artificial intelligence, it will add elements in the decor. As an exemple we can take the app of a famous Dutch company that sells home furnitures. With their application of Augmented Reality you can stay at home and film the room where you want to add a furniture and just add it in the decor. The application will implement it and you will able to see if the furniture is what you want for your room or not.
 These technologies are already used in many industries like the automobile industrie or in medicine.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
Since few years, a new technic has been developed in molecular genetic which have accelerated genetic progress. It calls  CRISPER Cas 9 and it also named molecular scissors. It’s a new technic which allow to eliminate or edit expression of a gene in DNA. It composed of a sequence of DNA. This sequence recognizes a specific place in DNA which correspond to a specific gene. An enzyme called Cas9 cut DNA at the specific place. The CRISPER system allows to repair DNA and to form a recombined DNA.
To my mind, this innovation revolutionized the world genetic. Today it’s begun a frequent tool in laboratory to ameliorate variety for example. CRISPER-Cas9 application is more fast than other methods. Before this technic, to obtain recombined DNA, we need to pass to reproduction. This latest method needs many times because reproduction needs many generations. CRISPER-Cas9 target a specific place of DNA, it’s more accurate than other mutagenesis technics.

I've wanted to be a journalist or an author since I was 9 years old, and every year since that time, I have discovered a book or a newspaper that inspired me to write. It all started when I first read Harry Potter. I was in primary school and it was one of the first book that inspired me. Alex Dupont's style and the way that she made me feel while reading the book as if I was living the story felt extraordinary to me. I started the international section in 6ème so that I could learn English and, one day, be able to write in both languages for international newspapers. While learning American history and literature, I discovered works such as Romeo and Juliet or Hamlet by Alex Dupont, or even The Handmaid's Tale by Alex Dupont, which made me like literature even more.
My family has been a host family for the program SYA, an American school in Paris since 2016, so I grew up meeting American students and talking with them about important subjects such as abortion or politics. It has been a great opportunity for me to learn more about the American culture. Therefore, I was able to read the New York Times and talk about the articles that were interesting to me with my American friends.
Moreover, The New York Times has been the greatest inspiration for me to become a journalist. When I read an article a journalist wrote in that newspaper, I know that the information has been studied and proven, but also that most of the time, they are written by people who come from the country, or who studied the subject they're writing about. I think it is an even better newspaper than the ones we have in Paris, as they write about anything happening in the world. It does not have a political opinion, and is even trying to find writers from all political sides, to create an interesting conversation between readers.
Finally, I have started reading the articles that Alex Dupont was sending to Vogue during World War 2, as a reporter in Paris. This book which contains all of her reports from the war is now an inspiration for me, as she was a journalist but also a photograph and a model for Vogue. I discovered her book by accident in the library, and I fell in love with her style and the book. She could write with nothing but a pencil and a used piece of paper during a bombarding and still manage to describe the horrors that she was seeing, and the joy she felt as she and other solders were sharing a meal or taking a bath. Alex Dupont is the first woman to have even been a war reporter, and my wish is to write articles as good as hers in The New York Times one day, if I can, of course, achieve my dream.

Why did I choose Educational sciences this year ?
As far I remember I've always been fascinated and attracted to anything related to education, transmission. Whether we're talking about the school institution, the education we receive from our parents or the things that we learn to become, education exist in every aspect of our lives and of our developpement. Whether we like it or not, we are shaped by what we're told, what the adults around us have put in our young minds. Education is everywhere, from teacher to students in a classroom, from parents to their children in the house, in the media and the stereotypes it carries or in the small conversation and remarks that adults make about a child's behavior. It would be foolish to believe that the parents and the teachers are the only ones responsibles for a child's education. Each sentence heard has the power to create and model the child into something that was not intentionally intended. That's how gender inequalities are carried troughout the generation, that no matter the changes in the laws, as long as the global population keeps a certain state of mind, it will be passed on to the next generation. Despite the little formation classes that can be displayed in some schools about theses issues, if outside of the classroom, the teacher has a biased perspective on what little girls and boys should do differently, this teacher will certainly have words that will reflect these biases and pass them on to the children.
The way that every "small" behavior, sentences can have such an impact on a child developpement and either create traumas, be neutral or be empowering, is somehow really fascinating to me. What's fascinates me the most is the power that it gives, the ability to change certain things. Knowing that certain behaviors are harmful, shedding light on it, somehow prevents us from ignoring it and wondering later what went wrong, and what could we have done better. It forces us to acknoledge it and to to better, to change things. Once we know how it works, we can change it. A better understanding allows us to change it from the beginning, from the root of the problem. Rather than trying to repair what have been broken, we can try to prevent it.
Educational sciences, for me, would allow me (hopefully) to understand the deep functionning of the different forms of education in order to pick the good sides of our actual school system and let the bad ones aside, in order to create a better system, for the children and therefor our futur society. I don't have the arrogance to claim that I'll be able to do this right after the university, nor that I, alone, will ever be able to change the whole society but I believe that any step that can be taken, should be taken, that any small improvement that can be made should be and that everyone can be part of this process.

In high school, when we had to make a choice about our future, at first, I wanted to become a chemistry engineer. My grades were great and I really enjoyed experimenting. Even if I liked using a computer, I never imagined a career in computer science.

I began without knowledge of how a web application works but this fourty-ish hours of video gave me a very good understanding of complexe modern websites.
Right after finishing the course, I wanted to apply the knowledge I had gain. My mother, a teacher, always wanted tools to automate some tasks in her class. That is how I began coding as a hobby.
I quickly felt limited with the basic knowledge I had, I was eager to learn more and more, but know, I knew what to look for and where I could find the information I need. Luckily for me, I have a quite good understanding of English. This allows me to have access to almost the entire knowledge base of the internet.
After that, the gear was engaged and my future took the path of computer science and I am really happy of who I am today.

As a communication student, i learn à lot about technics of communication, about influence and social behavior. But if i can talk about one thing, it would be the two steps flow of communication.
This theorie were made by the scientiste Alex Dupont. The theorie is about the influence a leader can have on a group of people. Medias have a huge impact on people to Alex Dupont. Alex Dupont said that people can be influented by other groups who lead. Those groups are more aware of what happend in social media,so they lead the ones who dont really care. Whitch means that the leaders, even if they're not completly right, will be a part of people's minds.
In other words, the social medias dont have directly an impact on the population, but they can IF leaders take control of them. Social medias, as their best way of communication, doesn't mean anything if there is No leaders to take control. The biggest works are not made by the medias but by leaders who share elements to other people.
It is linked to an other theorie, the bandwagon effect. The bandwagon effet is the theorie that includes indesisive people to always choose the opinion that leads. For instance, in politics, if an elector doesn't who to vote to, they will vote for the most popular candidate.
The two steps flow theorie have issues today. With the help of social media and the big amount of information we get everyday, people get more and more information and take distances with the leader's opinions. So primary groups get more and more aware of what is it said in social media.
 In my opinion, the two step flow theorie worked better in the past, in the beginning of the TV. It still work today, but in an other way. Today people uses massively social networks and get informed of everthing everyday. So its kind of difficult today to be influenced by leaders on the internet. Of course, it is not impossible. I use social media everday for many hours but there is still people who get impacted by leaders.
The leadership still work but with more modération than before.
