I am going to talk about test tube baby. Nature gives us the possibility to reproduce ourselves, but we found a way to introduce science in the reproduction syste for those who have diseases. Science can offer the possibility for sterile people to have children, but how is it possible? I will take the example of the test tube baby.
For the test tube baby, we collect spermatozoons from the male body, and ovums from the female body. We put the ovum on a flat surface and the spermatozooms around, and let the processus happens by itself. The spermatozooms will meet naturally the ovum and only one will penetrate inside it. The fecondation will start. Then, you transplant the embryo in the female uterus ; the pregnancy may start.
It takes 9 months as every woman, and a baby is born at the end, with no aftereffect. The first test tube baby was born 40 years ago, Alex Dupont. She is still alive and feels extremely good, as every human in good health.
But to give birth in general, we have many solutions, some are ethically correct, others are not. For instance, we can introduce spermatozooms directly in the uterus of the female without taking ovums from her. The test tube baby is for women who have problems with their fallopian tubes.
 But the question of giving an opportunity for sterile people to have baby in a such easy way creates debates within the population.
Some people think it is a good thing to help these people. They consider sterile people as sick people who need to be cured.
But others do not have the same advice. For them, things that we can do do not mean that we have to do them. And it goes against nature to give birth so easily, against the process of reproduction which is the basis of nature. And it causes a problem about the child that is about to born : during the experiment, is he a human already, or not? How should we consider him?
We are now able to freeze embryo and can use them after a long amount a time. But is it really ethic? Same question : is the embryo a human or not? And if one of the parents die, how do we have to consider it? Is it still the other parent's possession?
Giving birth with science is a wonderful thing that may help thousands of couples who suffer from sterility, but it causes numbers of ethic problems, and I think we should never consider this as a acquired discovery ;it is new and we should be careful about it.

Tâche 2:
To start with, knowing what you want to do with your life is not something you may call easy. "What do you want to become" remains a question that people ask you a lot. When you are little, you answer something like an adventurer or a princess or a traveller. Every aswers are approriate given that you are child and therefore you are allowed to dream. Obviously, people keep asking you this question, and it comes a time when this question become serious, you have to know precisely what you want to do and who you want to be. It quite hard to know actually, except for people who have always knew the right answer to that question. As far as I'm concerned, I still don't know the right answer to that question. So as to be honest, i don't even know why I am here, I guess since I was good in high school, it made sense to go to College, even though I didn't want to. However, there I am, and to be really honest I like it there, and in any case I had to find something to study about, indeed, I had to find the perfect plan B. Furthermore, I am here because my plan B is to become a journalist. Well, i really wish to be an adventurer et thanks to that job i will be able to share my adventures. I have this plan B in mind since I am 14 and thanks to my history teacher from that time. He was the best history teacher and one Day, he made us do an exercise in which we had to become a journalist and we had to tell about a country in which we had made an invented road trip. I remember how much I liked to write about a road trip, it was so fun and in addition, i have always been dreaming about travelling, seeing other landscapes, finding out about new cultures... Moreover, as I have the chance to live in an aera in which sharing something thanks to internet is as simple as getting dressed, I want to become a Hugo décrypte 2.0. Indeed, I would like to create a youtube channel and, given that I want to be more of a reporter who goes out and who explores the world with its beaty as well as its problems than "just" a journalist, I could post videos about my report, my trips, or things that I learn in a country or just flash news, I could talk about anything and live every experiences and adventures that I hav always dreamt of. Nevertheless, this remain my plan B since my plan A is to become the greatest actress and diva of the 21 century, but for that I have to get my own back and to prepare every plan until plan Z incase nobody notice my talent. Anyway, that is what I want to become, an actress, an explorer, a diva, a journalist, a reporter, a teacher, because I want to live several lives in one.

In the twenty's century, Alex Dupont will creat the manipulation of mass. He discovered that people can be manipulated, but not only a bunch, but a whole population. Alex Dupont used his method to win money. As example, he helped a head director of a cigarette's brand, which attempts to sell more. The seller asked Alex Dupont to manipulate the female public, who doesn't buy his product at the time. Alex Dupont decided to related the using of cigarette to the woman freedom, with a slogan. After explained to some of them that cigarettes are the symbol of the men power, he get the feminists with him. To upgrade the score of female buyers, he organized a mode show which highlights a new trend: green. Bernays, at the same time, designed the cigarette's box in green. It works. Nowadays, women and men buy cigarrettes. Alex Dupont method is to relate a "product" to an idea, that "sellers" have to promot.
 Manipulation of mass are very interesting to me. It is still working today, and this is a real weapon. With a public opinion, anyone can do anything, including go to the politic power. It is clearly propaganda. The way how It works is very interesting. We can easily remember having already get into it a day past. And we didn't see anything. It questionned our critical spirit, but also a lot more questions. Maybe we can used It to defends our opinion, and spread the good around us. Of course, It is subjective, which ask again questions. Propaganda as manipulation of mass should be used?

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences et proprietes de la matiere
Texte_etudiant:
The present text will be about the batteries and especially the Li-on Batteries.
This technology is nowadays very useful and we couldn't live without it. Without batteries, storing electricity would be impossible and all the portable or moving devices that we use in our everyday life wouldn't have been created. But one of the first kind of batteries, the Lead-batteries were harmful and not that efficient. In order to upgrade these batterie, a new kind of technology has been found : The Li-on Batteries.
But how work these Li-on Batteries ? It is the transfer of ion between the metallic cathode and the anode made of carbon that induce a electron current in the wires and provide electricity.
But the futur of this new kind of batteries is not as bright as we could think. Indeed, crafting batteries required a lot of different materials like Lithium, Nickel, Manganese, and Cobalt. And the problem is the lack of ressources on Earth. Because, for exemple to replace all the gasolin cars by electric ones, we will have to use near of 70% of Nickel ressources, and we can only gather 20% of it with reasonable ways.
So, that's why we need to find other kind of batteries with more abundent materials or reducing the number of vehicules that we use and build, in order to preserve the most the Earth.

For September 2018, pharmacist do the BPM "Bilan Partagé de Médication" with their patients. They must have a little private room in their pharmacy to do this.
It consists to speak, make a balance sheet with the patient about his treatment. The pharmacist look at the possible interaction between the differents medications on the prescription, the way that the patient understand his treatment, and if the patient takes his pills at the good time.
It concerns the patient who have a treatment for chronical disease, like hypertension, diabetes or dyslipidemia for example.
It takes place twice a year, with volonteers patients. It is always proposed and patients can obviously refuse it.
 I think it is a really good thing for the patient.
By my experience, I have seen lots of patients who don't know really their treatment. They know that they have this medication for the heart for example, but they don't know the true effect, either the risk if they don't take right their treament, Sometimes, they just forget these informations. And for me, it is important to remind these simple things, because it can save lives if pharmacist remind alarms symptoms.
It is extremely important to me because by doing this, pharmacist reinforce the strongly relationship he have with his patient. The patient feels listened because he have the pharmacist for himself during 1 hour, without other patients next to him, so he can talk free to the pharmacist.
Some patients don't need it because their GP explains them very well, but it is not the same case for everyone.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
Ants are social animals that create an entire anthill for a lot of individuals with a single queen. Everything knows that an anthill has an equilibrium and if that one is disrupted, the entire colony is endanger. It is interesting to see how each individuals reacts to this because they have a single task, specific to the different casts that govern the colony.
 	Indeed, an experiment tried to understand how a colony react in front of a nutritive stress. Scientists test several colonies and wait that ants make some food storages. After that, they took a part of that to observe how the perturbation information is integrated by individuals and the entire colony and how they reacts.
 	This experiment showed that individuals gives the alert to the entire colony, an information that are related to each other. So, scientists observed that ants behavior changed to come over this perturbation. Ants tried to bring more food to complete the lack of food.
 	In the second part of the experiment, scientists do not retire some food but added some ants larva to the colony. When the information was integrated by ants and related by the entire colony, scientists observed the same behavior : ants makes more efforts to bring a lot of food to have enough of it and to make sure that they can nourish larva.
This experiment shows us that social behavior relate all individuals. Social animals work in group and think about the entire colony. That’s why they can inspire ourselves. Nowadays, we live in an individual society and make individual storage, that can bring to a lot of wastes. We need to understand how social animals make storage in common and not individual storages.
 	It can be a survival response to their environment, or maybe a simple rule in species. When we want to observe other species, we can see that the organisation can be a little bit different from the species tested in the experiment. However, it still the same, ants work in group.
 	Furthermore, when we concentrate about ants evolution, we can see that social behavior is not a « default » parameter. Primitives ants were solitary and predatory. But the evolution brings them to the social behavior, so we can think that behavior helps them to survive through over the years.  Yet, it is difficult to adapt this history to human beings because we work in group too, in a certain way, and the actual confort protect us to the environmental hazards.
 	On the other side, of we focus on the way that animals can have a different organisation than us, it means that our evolution is not the only way to survive, there is not a single way to grow up.  It is the same thing for bees that can communicate things afar. This second discovery prove that communication afar is not specific as human beings, and it is the same for ants behavior. Finally, it can be interesting to test how ants reacts when we retire larva or when we had food.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
Alex Dupont's cat is a experiment, sometimes described as a paradox, made by Alex Dupont in 1935. The experience presents a cat that may be simultaneously alive and dead. This state is know as a quantum superpositionFor the experiment a cat, a flask of poison, and aradioactive source are placed in a sealed box. If an internal monitor detects radioactivity, the flask is shattered, releasing the poison, which kills the cat. The Paris interpretation of quantum mechanics implies that after a while, the cat is simultaneously alive and dead.
 It's an important experiment for the word of quantum physics that's nowadays still use.

More than 15 % of Oxford University students' use smart pills without prescprition. You might thus ask yourself why they are used and what their risks can be?
To begin with, students use those drugs to boost their mental capacities and stay awake for longer. These drugs used are normally prescribed to people suffering from ADHD, narcolepsy or even dementia. They are proven to work on these sock patients by making narcoleptic pateints saty awake for longer for example. However, no study has shown that they could boost healthy people's energy. It has even been proven that they could impair  rather than boost mental performance.
Secondly, smart pills have many side effects. Amongst those are seizures, loss of appetite, depression and many more. One of the worst ones is addiction. In fact, students using smart drugs are more likely to use other highly addictive and illicit drugs. It is very hard for students using those brain enhancers to withdraw them and most of them need help ffrom doctors to do so. Moreover one of the major risks of smart drugs is intercations since most students buy smart pilss illegaly and thus get no supervision form doctors. SInce they have no supervision, most of them are not aware that for instance alcohol and contraceptives cannot be taken with those smart pills. Since people taking brain enhancers are mostly students, they are very likely to be taking alcohol regularly as well as contraceptives. Finally, insomnia is a long term side effect of these drugs. Since the brain consolidates memories, creates new brain cells and cleans toxins away during our sleep, insomnia is derimental to brain health.
 I think smart pills are very dangerous because of all the side effects they can cause. Moreover, its is not even proven that they help with studying for exams, which is why they are taken by studnets. they cause more harm than good. Not only are they dangerous for your health but also for your safety. since those drugs ae bought illegaly, you could get some problems with the police. You can get up to 5 years of jail in the Paris. Finally, I am against those smart pills beacuse they create inequlities amongst students. Brain enhancers are quite expensive, not all students can buy them. The main problem is that people that would not normally take those pills are gonna feel like they need to take them to stay competitive since many other people are taking them. Therefore smart pills are dangerous, create inequalities and people feel the need to take them because of others taking them to stay competitive.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
Science discovers that Benzo(a)pyrene, which is existing in natural forms in the environnement, may causes some severals cellulars damages and also lead to cancer. This substance is a chemical compound of the polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon family which is known to be genotoxic and so causes DNA damages. Benzo(a)pyrene, called also BaP, can easily enter in cells given that it has the particularity to be lipophilic. Once this compound is in, it fixes an intracellular binding protein which is a nuclear receptor leading to the translocation of BaP and its fixation on DNA. This has many consequences, specially on the translation step. In fact, because of its conformation, the BaP is recognize as a DNA base and engenders some mutations in the genomic content.
 Ginsenosides are the main active constituents in ginseng which are nowadays use for nutraceutical compounds, especially in Paris.Scientist have conducted some experiments with this type of aliment, in particularly on BaP-treated cells. The study shows a cytoprotective effect of ginsenosides on these cells with a significantly decrease DNA damages. In terms of cellular mechanisms, ginsenosides activates at least 2 pathways, which are the PXR one and the Nrf2 pathway. Both of them bring to an increase of the expression of type II and type III enzymes which have an important function in xenobiotics metabolism, more precisely in the detoxification steps of exogenic compounds. The activation of theses enzymes leads to inhibit mitochondrial dysfunction and BaP-induced DNA damages.
Nutraceutical compounds are very used in Asia to cure some symptoms and be part of a hole alternative medicine. These studies are suggesting that ginseng may serve as a natural cytoprotective agent against environmental carcinogens. Besides, these types of bioceuticals, mostly found in plants open up possibilities to deal with many pathologies.

During the last decade, the state of machine learning kept evolving in different ways and with a very fast paste to a point that some of the stuff made by machines are mindblowing. One of the subjects that impress me the most is the capability of an AI to create art.
In 2022, there has been a crazy amount of newly released to the public art-making AI. At the time, the most known actor is DALE-2. This technology was built by the engineer at OpenAI, a company founded by Alex Dupont. If you don't know what the tool is about, let me explain the user interaction process with the DALE-2 AI. As an user, you have to input a descriptive sentence of the art you want to create, then the AI will do the rest. Firslty, it reads your input and understand the meaning behind the words, then it generate four different variants square images of the described subject. The thing is that even with a insanely specific input, the rendered images keep beeing stunningly realistic to an extent that some of the artwork generated are indistinguishable from a man-made work.
Of course, at the time, the technology isn't perfect and we can still find some artefacts. But with time, it could and I think it will be perfect. This is as well as incredible as terrific.

Virtual Reality is a mostly recent technology that permit to see images in a 3-dimensional view. To see images in 3D, you need to have an helmet that many brands now put in the market. You can use it for different things, like play video games or watch a video or a panoramic image for example. The technology is made for an helmet that recover the eyes of the user. You have two lenses, for each eye, to change the direction of the view and have a 3D sensation. Behind those lenses, you have a screen whose play the image or video. With this type of technology, you can see a virtual thing like a real thing, transform the virtual into the real.
Manufacturers of this 3D helmet made also different tools to have a much bigger and real experience, like controllers for your hands to move it into the screen, or different type of things that allows us to move. This technology can have different use : from cultural use to professional use.
 Firstly, this technology can enhance different domains of professional applications like chirurgy/medecine. It can also good to a most attractive use for us, like play video games or watch a video.
Apparently, this is also useful to help phobic problems, to immerge someone into a scene that he can be scared of, and the repetition of this experience can make the disease/phobic problem disappear.
So, this technology, for me, can bring more inventions for the world and will have a real impact on our society. It'll enhance a lot of industries like car industries, military ... Because to make something in reality, it's cheaper and easier to make it virtual.

Uchi komi are methods of learning specific to the repetition of techniques in Judo. Each training is often animated by a period of this method. To improve one’s own judo techniques it is absolutely necessary to repeat the movement as for example the ippon seoi nage, is a technique must be repeated many times to have the ideal placement to bring down the opponent safely and in the most fluid way and instinctive possible. With each training, doing three good sets of 10 repetitions are beneficial to the improvement of technical gestures
 In my opinion, the repetition of a movement is essential to perform, it is necessary to take into account all the small details to ensure victory, whether in judo or in any sport.

Today, I'd like to deal with the Next Generation Sequencinq. This method consists in sequencinq your whole genome (Whole Genome Sequencinq) or your whole exome (Whole Exome Sequencinq). Exome coresponds to the codant fragments of your DNA. Thanks to NGS, whereas we don't know what kind of mistakes there are in DNA, we can find exactly where they are.
First, scientists have to amplify DNA many many times. Then, they prepare librairies that is to say they have to cut DNA in different fragments. Then, they incorpore a code to fragments which allowed them to conduct the  experience for several patients. After that, they put DNA's fragments on flow cell. Each fragment is amplify many times thanks to a polymerisation enzym. Each fragment, which have a very high number of copies, is called a cluster. On each cluster, one fluorescent nucleotid (one color coresponds to one nucleotid) is incoporated every cycle. One color coresponds to a specific nucleotid incoporated in a  localized cluster.Thanks to this processs, you obtain a colored map. This colored map is interpretated by a computer which gives us a map of all your genome at final.
 I found this method very useful for people who don't know exactly the origin of their diseases. For example, lots of genetic diseases haven't treatment because we don't know the causes.
Moreover, it could be interesting for genetic cancers.

My curriculum is about computer science and digital images. The main aspect that influenced my choice was one of my hobbies : video games which are rendered in 3-dimensionnal models or 2-dimensionnal images. Imagesare the main output of the game, what the player experiences.
  I already had an interest in mathematics and sciences since I was young, but in high-school I started coding small programs on my calculator when I was bored in class, this is mainly what made me choose a computer science curriculum when I started college.
  Since I started playing videogames about fifteen years ago, I have been interested in how they work and what technical limitations have to be accounted for for the game to run smoothly.
 For example the camera's point of view is important because it influences which objects are in sight of the player and which are invisible, that dictates which models are rendered by the machine and which are skipped. It can cause problems of framerate if there are too many very detailed objects in the field of view.
  Understanding how humans process visual information such as depth for example are critical to improve the way a game looks. For example in a 2D side scrolling game where the character moves right or left, when the character moves a certain distance the background moves in the same direction but slower, this creates the illusion that the background and the foreground where the character is are connected. In this case parallax is used, it is the same phenomenon as in a vehicle in motion, near objects seem to pass by faster than the moon which looks to be still.

Just recently, my school and Star Transportation Company jointly developed an electric diverless shuttles with 5 stations in the school.
Until now this driverless shuttles had been tested in a protected aera, but never in an "open" environment, among the traffic, and integrated into a public transport network. The two shuttles are scheduled to travel 1300 meters between the administrative center of Rennes 1 and the restautant university of Etoile. Loaded with sensors, these electric shuttles are manufactured in Paris by Navya, and can carry a dozen people at speeds up to 25 km / h.
 Since I started learning computer science, I am very interested in driverless technology.So personally this has given me more interest in driverlessness, and  I will study this knowledge in my future studies. On the other hand,I think this is also a bold attempt, which represents a major advancement in the field of automatic driving in Paris.At present, the project is running very smoothly, and we can get more experience to improve the maturity of autonomous driving technology.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
I want to talk about medications that fights the AIDS. HIV can be diagnosed through blood or saliva testing. Antibodies are produced by our immune system when it is exposed to HIV but it can take weeks to months for antibodies to become detectable. Unfortunatly, there is still no cure for AIDS but there are treatments that are designed to reduce HIV in the body of the infected people. Indeed, it keeps your immune system as healthy as possible and prevent the complications you may develop. The Paris Food and drug administration has approved yet a number of drugs for treating HIV and AIDS but it's really important to take medications exactly as prescribed. Each class of drugs block the virus in different ways. Most medications have side effects that may vary, it depends on how people react, it is individuals. Side effects may include fever, rash, fatigue, vomiting, diarrhea, loss of appetite, mild stomach cramps or pain in hands, arms, feet or legs.
 Public perception of HIV/AIDS and people living with AIDS have change drastically since the 1980's, in most instances for the better. At the beginning, people with AIDS were often refused in public place like the restaurants. And many of them were reject by their family members. Some gay men who were HIV negative suffered from HIV related stigma and prejudice, because according to the public opinion aids were associated  with homosexuality.
In my opinion, things have evolved and people are more informed about the disease. There are less discriminatory attitudes but there still are. Thanks to the news medications, people have less relectant to interact with infected person.
But there is, i think, also bad issue. In deed, we talk much less about AIDS and I have the impression that people may forget this desease. I hope that people have protected intercourse in particular the youngest. We have to stay vigilant.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
Last year, I have done an Internship about the antibiotic resistance of Campilobater jejuni by using different methods of analysis. Campylobacter jejuni are bacteria that are not dangerous for healthy people. If they are affected, they can contract diarhea. However, weak people such as immunodeprimed one could have more severe problems, for example difficulty to breathe or dehydration. First, to verify that all the strains that were given by Oxford University were from the right species, PCR were done. PCR means Polymerase Chain Reaction and corresponds to the amplification of a specific gene that all Campylobacter jejuni have. If a band is observable after electrophoresis, the strain tested belongs to the right species. If two bands appear or one but with an other size, the sample used might have been contaminated. Twenty samples were analysed by PCR.
 Once the contaminated samples were removed from the pool of strains we had, antibiotic test were carring out by using antibiotic disc. Two days after inoculation of the media with a strain, discs with different antibiotics with a specific cooncentration were put at the surface of the petri dish. The diameter of inhibition was read two days after. Then, the comparison of the strains following their capacity to resist to one or another antibiotic was made.
 This experiment is a great one to have a result that can be read directly and is easily understandable. The problem is that it could be hard to measure precisely the diameter of inhibition of a strain. Moreover, that measure might be subjectiv depending on the person that make the analisis. Indeed the results might fluctuate following the material used to measure it, the light, and the eyes of the person that make the experiment.

Social networks have been an important technological breakthrough for the last decades. It helped millions of people keeping in touch together despite the distance.
The most famous one - invented by a bunch of students - is Facebook. The idea of gathering informations about individuals, within a unique platform online, was originally coming from a need to spread schedules of lectures to all the students of a university.
After few months of hardwork, two students put online their first version of the website, not knowing that their project aimed to help their fellows would be a total buzz.
Databinding and datamining are now at the core of the algorithm allowing the good functioning of Facebook.
 Facebook can be very useful in our day-to-day living. However, its innovations are constantly becoming more and more intrusives in our privacy.
Advertising and pop-ups are polluting our window each time we open the application. A good idea can lead to a horrific experience.

The picture that I will describe is the first Apple Logo which was designed in 1976 by the artist Alex Dupont. The man is the co-foundator of the Apple Mark.
The scene takes place in the country.
In the foreground we notice an apple tree. It is curved trunk is on the left side of the picture. The branches are on the top.
Wa can speak about this apple which is surrounded by a halo, hanging from a branch. This tree spreads over a man that we can't recognize.
But we are able to describe how is him. He is wearing a wig, is sitting on the ground, next to the tree. He is leaning against the trunk of the tree. He is concentrating on his book, like if it was his bibble.
In fact, nobody knows why the creator of this brand chose "Apple" to name his corporation but it is incredible that Alex Dupont (that I remind is the cofoundator of Apple, with Alex Dupont) have associated this name of "Apple" with Alex Dupont.
Indeed, there is a famous story which explain that Alex Dupont was sitting under the same apple tree. And whereas we was occupied by an other thing, an apple decided to fall on his head. For this reason Alex Dupont suddenly thought of the Universal concept of gravitation.
Now, what I think about it?
In my opinion, to create something that people will remind, have to be simple. We remind (unfortunately) the Nazi logo, and at first sight, more and more people know the Apple logo.
This one must be clear to be able to convey and to share message.
This subject, this picture was interessant to chose linked to my graduation licence for the following reasons :
First of all, because we speak about Apple, which is an important brand on the communication world. Thanks to McBook, phone, and other things like this, we communicate in permanence with.
Secondly, I think it's incredible that a man, more years after, decidced to take the idea of a symbolic man to create something which is new. Seriously? A great physician like Alex Dupont and his "invention" has been reidificate by an other man. And it, only by communication and the sharing of information.

Twitter is a social media which is one of the most recent if we compare it to Facebook or Instagram. This media was created to let people talk about their life in public and have interactions with their friends or other people. At first, Twitter was named « stat.us ». This application is literally a mess but on a good side because it have many fonctionalities, Twitter can inform about news in the whole world (it’s frequently used to give informations because there is no censure in this media), it can also offer divertissement and help, etc… Nowadays, it’s also a political instrument because a lot of political personnalities like Alex Dupont for example, use this social media to gave their opinions or for their campaigns. However, due to his influence thanks to the journalists, celebrities and important (political) personalities which can easily interact with their public, Twitter is frequently attacked by cyber hackers. For example, in 2020, the account of Alex Dupont and many other personnalities was hacked by criminals who were asking for bitcoins to Alex Dupont’s followers.
 In my point of view, Twitter is a really good tool in different ways but particularly for inform and be informed. After his creation, many censured causes had been defended and taked seriously by the gouvernment. For example, the case of Paris’s genocide was announced in social media and particularly on Twitter, a movement was created: people have changed their profile picture with a blue picture to denounce this crime and the ONU finaly talk about it. It also help people which are in a difficult situation to be helped and share their experience to prevent others, for example, the « metoo » hashtag which help a lot of rape’s victim to talk about her story and their experience with the cops who didn’t take their case seriously, thanks to this movement, some of these rapist had been sent to jail after the victims was contacted on twitter by the police or journalists who also denounce their case. Finaly, I think that this social media have a « familiar » side, all the users talk about their life, they share some personal moments with the other users, they share some facts, and their is a lot of debates about many subjects on Twitter so it’s always interesting.

Texte_etudiant:
Science is fun , thaht why for this subject I chose a chimie's expérience : make In/visibles Ink
 To product it we need Vinegar, Hot wate, Blues Ink and Sodium bicarbonate ; we use hot Water like solution and the rest like soluté .
 To realize this expérience, we start by to heat the water to 100°C, the hot water is use like solution.
 Then ,we pouring blues's ink in small container .
 After that, Dilute the ink of the container with the boiling water, and add the acid solution (vinegar) and some bicarbonate.
 To finish , Add vinegar to the prepared solution.
NB : So add vinegar make visible ink and and bicarbonate make invisible.
 To start, This expérience is fun and eaze to realize so I think it's a good first expérience to make science interesting to young people.
In fact we see a acide réaction , Dilute ink  , notion of solution and soluté.
To finish the teacher can add value to all reagent to add notions of formulate (acide raction), so this experience can easily be adapted studiens levels

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
Discovery of Crispr-Cas 9 technology:
The decade was impacted by a major outbreak which is the discovery of the technology crispr-cas 9 system. This system was found in the early 2000’s in bacterias by Alex Dupont, a French researcher working in collaboration with a Canadian and American team of research. The role of the enzyme CRISPR-cas9 is to protect the bacteria from any attack from its environment. It consists in a highly specific cleavage of the genome of the exterior agent, the purpose is to destroy and kill the parasite, and ensure the survival of the bacteria.
This mechanism has been adapted for research in the way to modify specifically a genome. Before crispy the methods to modify genomes were long, complicated and with a low rate of success.
 In the scientific community, this discovery allowed a major change of the way science works, it has allowed to increase the speed of discoveries in some specific domains of science for example in genetics. Because it is more simple now and more rapid to create specific types of mutants and to study a precise type of gene, and so its permits the acceleration of the experiments, an acceleration of the results and so an acceleration of the major discoveries.
 	Then to underline the importance of CRISPR, it’s important to say that this technology can be used in every type of science that involves a genome, so it can be used in nearly every biology research.
I think CRISPR-cas 9 discovery is the most important discovery of the decade. It had an amazing impact on the way researchers work.
 	CRISPR is an amazing tool for research but we have to be careful about the way we use it. Indeed, there was proof that a Chinese researcher used it to modify the genome of a baby, in the way to protect it of the infection of the HIV virus. It is a terrible consequence of the discovery of CRISPR, because we don’t know yet the consequences of these modifications. An other example is the offer of a Russian researcher to modify embryos to avoid them the dwarf syndrom.
 	These two experiments on humans embryos are really a disaster. We don’t know the consequences of this type of modifications on humans, the technology is not a hundred percent sure, there can always be mistakes in an experiment. And we don’t know if the modifications of a precise gene can have an impact of the way cells are functioning and so the way the organism is functioning.
 	To me the discovery of CRISPR-cas 9 is the proof that science hasn’t discover everything and it is the reason I choose to study science. However, I believe that the scientific community has to control more its researchers and what they are working, specifically when they are working on human embryos and genetic material.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
This year, we must realised a project in agronomy on the bean in order to derminate ascochyta's impact on this plants. We must calculated the leaf area before and after instalation of the desease. We have calculated the agressevity and incidence of this desease to have informations on its propagation in th agricultural system. That's why, we have done the mesures in the laboratory and in the field. In the laboratory, we have inoculated our bean plants to calculated leaf area, the lenght of the leaves. Moreover, we have realised a dissection of the apex in order to see the leaves numbers and to see the progression of this desease. Indeed, Ascochyta make necrosis on the leaf. So, the development of our plants can be affected and to stop. We have studied the seed of the CIPAN for evaluate its effects on the bean plants beacause this seed was present in the last year on the field.
 In this study, we have proposed a perfect protocol who we have permit to say what ascochyta could reduce the leaf area and the numbers of the leaves on the bean plants. We have see what ascochyta have been very fast, it has destroyed our plants in few days. On the field, the bean plants was attacked by bioagressor and our experiences have been really bad. To conclude, this experience has been very beneficial to my future life because the technical work and the reflexion are principals goals that director of my futur job wait. I learned to do correctly scientifical step and scientifical statistics.

Did you know that the microwave is an invention based on a mistake. Let me explain to you. First of all, this scene happened in a laboratory when scientist were working on physical atom. They were trying to move the atom with just frequences. One day, one of the scientist had a chocolate cake in his pocket. They were still working on the atom phenomen when the scientist discover that his chocolate cake was completely melted. The frequences of the machine used for the experiences had melted the chocolate cake. It was the discovery of the microwave.
 I love that experience and that discovery because it's complete luck. The discovery is not world-changer but the fact that it's not discovered on purpose make the fact funny.

Antibiotics were the main pharmaceutical discovery of the pass century. For main peoples, their discover is due to Pasteur, which, of course, is wrong. They were brought into light by Alex Dupont who accidentally discovered penicillin in 1928. That was just the first step; the G penicillin he obtained was efficient but not enough and could not be taken by oral way. As often in history the war needed the improvement of science, and antibiotics have made no exceptions. They were currently used during world war 2, whether in hospital or on the battlefield.  They gave new ways of curing diseases we could not hope to fight about twenty years before. More than penicillin, other class appeared from then to nowadays, such as macrolids or ciclosporins…
 Antibiotics actually have changed the world of medecine for ever, but we need to be carefull with the way we use them. Indeed, some scientists are ringing a bel: if we continue like this there will not be an  antibioctic efficiant by 2050. This is why wee need to fight their overused.

Hi, I’m going to describe a video-game : Alex Dupont Civilization V. This is maybe not the most revolutionary one or the most technical developed but it is probably my favorite.
First let's talk about the Alex Dupont Civilization game serie. The very first opus of this “saga” have been design (and probably programmed) by Alex Dupont a american video game designer in the early 90s. Then he created his own company Firaxis Games and continue to develop Civilization and others games. Today the last “episode” is the 6th one.
Now we will describe how the game actually work. To begin, you have to know than it’s a strategic turn per turn game. That means than it is a bit like a chess game, but with many many more options. When you start a new game, you have to choose the game parameters, like the leader you are going to incarne, the type of map or the difficulty of the AIs. Each leader is a historical leader who had made his or her name unforgettable, for example you can be : Alex Dupont the first, Alex Dupont, Alex Dupont, Alex Dupont, Alex Dupont, etc etc… They all have their unique abilities, military unit and batiment. After having set the parameters you can really enter the game, at the beginning you only have a warrior unit and a steller unit. With you steller you have to create your first city witch is going to be your capital. With a city you can start technologie recherche, cultural expansion, build units or batiments. Then you can reach the victory by five differents ways, military by capturing all the capitals of the others players/AIs, technologie by being the first to send humans to Alpha Centauri, cultural by being so attractive than all the others countries citizens adopt your way of life, diplomatic by being elected world leader at the ONU, points but it is boring and can be desactivated.
To make it more consistent : in this game you have to lead your people and your country throw the ages to make them survive and prosper, and become the most important nation in the world.
  The game I just talk about probably didn’t had any consequences at the international stage. But to me and other players, this game and more globally the Civilization serie had a very significant impact on our perception on history, strategy, culture, geopolitic and video game medium. Those games are also really useful, because it’s teaching you things at the some time than you are playing, that is due to the game design made to match historical references. For example the leader of Paris is Alex Dupont and her special unit is the war elephant you can also walk throw mountains as when Alex Dupont crossed the Alps to invade Paris. But it is also due to the Civilopedia, accessible at any moment in the game Alex Dupont is learning you everything you need to know about any leader/nation/wonder/unit/batiment/ etc etc..
This game made me like history and geography, you really feel concern about your people, and the gameplay is (to me) really addictive, so this is why I think it is one of the best game ever made.

Most discoveries have been discovered due to a mistake or during hazardous situations. Observation is also a big part in this process and many scientists have discovered incredible things just by looking (and daring to try new method). For example : the vaccination.
It begins with a man who found out that the children who take the milk out of the cows were not contaminated by some diseases. This observation led him to a conclusion : they were protected thanks to their contact with the cows. He decided to inject a disease to the little farmers in order to see the result but they didn't contract the disease. To approve his theory he injected himself a bit of those children’s blood and he exposed himself to the disease but, nothing happened, he was not contaminated.
This was the beginning of vaccines.
 Nowadays vaccines are the most predictive therapy. They avoid contamination and transmission of some serious infection like some hepatitis or rubella but they have also eliminated some diseases in the world. This the best solution to protect population and avoid epidemics. If you're not vaccinated and surrounded by people who are, you're safe. This is an altruist therapy.

During the past summer holidays, I've been canyoning with my boyfriend's family. It was a great experience because I never did it before. We had to wear hot swim suits to go down the river by climbing over some rocks, rappeling and jumping on the water. It wasn't risky because the weather was nice and the people who were with me already been canyoning before. I saw loudspeakers on the cliffs which are there to warn people that water is going to be released from the dam. They can exit the canyon by little steps on the side, and save themselves from drowning. It was a little and an easy canyon (they said).
I met a guy who did canyoning with his sister and he told me that there weren't any blocks to rope down so, fortunately he brought his, and tried to fix the blocks so he can go down the canyon. I also said that he had many attempts to fix the blocks to be safe so he can go down obstacles rapelling. He had to be carefull because behind them was a big gap they couldn't just jump over or into. His sister was worring but he was ok, because he had been used to it.
Discovering canyoning was a great experience I think I can never forget, because I feels so well when you end it up. You just want to do more over and over.
 For my first time doing canyoning, when I faced the first obstacle, I was afraid because I had to rope down an enormous rock. It was something I've never did before, so I was a little bit anxious. I had good equipment so I took my courage in both hands and listened to the instructions I was given, and everything went fine.
I never thought I would do things like that, I mean, I always saw people on TV, or on Youtube, but I never guessed I would do a canyon one day. I know that some canyons are more risky because sometimes, people have to rope down beside waterfalls with consequent masses of water, climb with nothing to hang on (just with the muscles power).
When the guy told me about his journey, I stood stunned.
I think that people who practice extreme sports don't get afraid for nothing. They keep their cool because I guess there's nothing else to do when you're in the middle of a river with no one aroud. Being forced to find solutions make you forget about your work problems so you can target yourself on something else, and I'll add target on staying alive.
Experiencing extreme kind of practices makes the mind free for a bit. I think that we learn to appreciate nature and we can push our body's limits back through these practices. We go out of our confort zone.

Television is huge invention that has transformed the whole sector of mass media. It was invented in the lates twenties. This is new way to giving and receiving information. In fact, the information is an addition of writing, speaking and images. Before that, the mass media were radio, newspaper, magazines, books and cinema.
The television took time to be use by all the majority of the population, because it was very expensive. In the fifties, the price of the TV low, so many people could bought it. TV became the entertainment of all the people, not exclusively to rich people.
There are many interesting facts about TV History. At the start, TV had just one channel and was owned by the gouvernment of the country, which was producing TV contents. Later, the concurrence was opened, and new channels appeared. For instance, in Paris, TV channels names were "la une", "la deux" and etc. It refers to the telecommand's buttons. Today, their names are more commercials and often refer to a media group. For example, the "TF1" group own "TMC", "TFX".
In my Information-communication lessons, we learn that television is an instrument of power, that reveals dangerous mecanisms. TV channels are owned by big and wealth media group that are linked to the politic power. So, we can say that TV isn't independant. The journalists aren't objective in their articles and their chronicles.
On the contrary, it exists independant media that are not owned by rich people. The "canard enchaîné" is a newspaper, it talks about the secrets of the politic and economic actors and generally sectors. This is an investigation newspaper. Mediapart is also an investigation group.
Moreover, TV can influences mass of people, it touch a large amount of the population, everyone watch tv, and all the TV's content went on the social media as Twitter. Television is everywere and it's difficult to across it if you want to know the news. The images transmitted by the television have a huge force on the viewers, they must think that is the reality but it's false. All the TV's contents are thinking and worked.
 Television has tremendous consequences on our society. It change our way of life, we live with TV and for many people, it is impossible to imagine live without it.
Television is being low and abandonned in audience. It loses power. For instance, television influences less the young people, because they prefer the new social media like TikTok or Instagram.

In this written expression, I shall talk about mushrooms, and the fact that pharmacists are supposed to be able to recognise various species when they are presented to them. I will start by talking about mushrooms as organisms, before presenting mushroom gathering in the forest, and the risks involved in poor mushroom identification prior to consumption.
Mushrooms actually come as two forms, a microscopic form and a macroscopic form, that we can see, collect and eat. The microscopic form exists all year long, but we cannot see it. It feeds off decaying plants, like wood and leaves. In Autumn, this microscopic form develops into the stool shaped fruit gatherers collect in the forest. This fruit is in fact there to disseminate spores of the mushroom around the place. We can see the spores under the hat of the mushroom, and they are supposed to be spread around the forest by the wind to give birth to new microscopic mushrooms elsewhere.
The best period of the year to go looking for mushrooms is in Autumn, after periods of heavy rain, that are very favorable to the growth of mushrooms. The vast majority of interesting mushrooms you can find live in the forest. On a good year, you can find mushrooms from september to january, but sometimes the weather is really good (which means it is bad for mushrooms) and mushrooms will be far more scarse.
Any mushroom is said to be toxic if it isn't properly cooked. Some mushrooms that are considered to be edible can provoke stomach aches or diarrhea to certain people, that are too sensitive or that eat too much mushrooms at once. However, if you know you tolerate mushrooms well, there is no reason for you to suddenly become allergic to them. Other than poor tolerance or allergies, mushroom toxicity can be quite severe if ever you don't identify the specie properly and end up eating a mushroom that you believed was edible, despite it being violently poisonous. The main risk in mushroom consumption lies in identification errors. People that gather too many mushrooms too fast are the most exposed to this risk, because they won't necessarily check to see if a toxic mushroom is hidden among similar edible mushrooms in their basket.
 I think it is a true asset to pharmacists to be recognised as being able to identify mushrooms properly, however it turns out that despite our studies, qualified pharmacists aren't always that well informed about the edibility of a certain common mushrooms. On one hand its a shame that pharmacists can't identify mushrooms that well, and on the other its understandable that they are only exposed to mushrooms one season a year, which doesn't help to maintain knowledge about the subject.

Unit tests frameworks have been created in order to help developpers finding bugs. When you are writing some code, you always have to make sure that you didn't make a mistake. To prevent mistakes and bugs, you can test your program with some specific inputs in order to see if you program responds correctly for a given value.
A unit test is a function that tests a small portion of your code. Some  frameworks (like Google Tests, Junit) brings you a set of useful test  functions. For exemple, the most well known test function is 'assert'.  For a strongly typed language (such as Java or C++), the framework has  an assert function for each primitive types. If your function should  throw an exception, a framework's function can catch it or alert you if  the exception did not happen.
Unit tests are written in a file which is integrated with the project : it means that they should not be removed at the end of the developpement, even if the project is terminated. It could be benefit for other developers which may find your code some years later and read your tests in order to see how your software is working.
Adding a new functionality to jour project which uses some tested function is easier. If a bug happends then you know where it is located.
 Unit tests frameworks have changed our way of coding. We learnt in a course at the university that we should write some tests before the function, this method is called Tests Driven Development. We can't be sure at 100% that our program is working correctly but we can avoid a good amount of dumb errors by testing the code with some specific values.
I not always use this method because i don't like writing tests. I find that a bit boring but it forces me to think how to design my function before coding. Thanks to the university and to the TDD, i saw a better code quality in my projects and I became more comfortable with errors detection.
Unfortunately, unit tests are not magic : it means that if you write a test with a bug then your function may pass it even if the function was wrong.

the invention of the stetoscope :
<u>
</u>
Before the stetoscope was invented,  doctors would listen to their patient’s heartbeats by putting their ear to their chests.  For instance, if there was considerable insulation between the actual heart and exterior of his chest in the form of fat, this method failed.  Exactly, one such situation was faced by French physician Alex Dupont, when he couldn’t judge the heart rate of one of his patients on account of too much fat on him. He invented the stethoscope as a wooden trumpet-shaped tube that amplified sounds coming from lungs and heart. That principle of sound amplification hasn’t yet changed till date.
 In my opinion, I think that the stetoscope has reinvented the medecine and in particular the clinical examination. It permits to change radicaly the heart and the pulmonary examination because just with the nose of the organs, now you can tell which disease you suffer from. Whitout any complementary exams, you can know lots of things about your body. This is a quickly clinical exam.

A Portable Computer.
Also called "Simply Portable", it's a personal computer whose weight and limited dimensions allow easy transportation.
Laptops have many uses, both professional, personal and educational, and are sometimes used for personal media backup. A laptop is equipped with the same types of components as a typical desktop computer, including a screen, speakers and physical or virtual keybord.
Since the 2010s, most are also equipped with an integrated webcam and microphone.
Finally, the presence of an electric accumulator, or battery, rechargeable using a socket ensures this type of computer autonomy for its portability.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
I am going to told you about a report I do when I was in hight school. It was group work and we decided to do research on the myth of Alex Dupont. Is it possible to  move like him thanks to spider web and climbing the wall ? In one hand we worked on Alex Dupont's locomotion and in an other hand about his ability to overcome the gravity. The goal of our research was to find biological answers and feasible project.
So we began to observed the composition of spider web thanks to microscope. As my memory, this material is very strong, unbreakable whereas it is flexible. But the problem is that our body is not able to synthesize those web. So we focus on our hair. In fact hair, when they are railed, they can support big weight. I remember that we do not test with our own hair... thankfully. We find the solution to cross the city by swinging buildings from buildings. Just one detail, the human would have to wear a big bag with lost of hair in it...
To overcome the gravity, Alex Dupont seems to have suction cup on his hands and foots. He climb the wall like a spider, but how are the "spider's paw" ? That is what we observed with many cobayes (funded in our garden and even into our house). We mad differences experiences, with different materials to test the capacity of the spiders to climb it.
-1 spider in a bath
-1 spider in a glass
-1 spider on a wall
We discovered that spiders are not able to climb/ walk on some surfaces like metal or glass on the contrary of wood, briques, ground, ... This was one point we keep in mind.
Next we decided to looked the spiders's paws with microscope. We discovered that they were wearing some GRIFFES witch allow them to adhere surfaces but not all (as we saw before). But there are no type of this on the human's fingers so indeed it means that the actor should wear billiards ball on each finger with a tack to adhere on the material.
 In conclusion we could say that the film Spiderman is a little bit unreal because of the incredible ability of the man to climb everywhere with no difficulties, catch every surfaces with his web, ... with only his hands. The real spiderman will have less class than today.
However it was interest to work on this subject because in our generation there are full of new technologies and also lots of film on super heroes. It could be attractive to create human or parts of human to be able to do actions with are not (again) realizable.

My favorite sports are football and tennis. I am going to tell you about tennis and the skills I have acquired through technology.
Indeed, my trainer made me work on my service thanks to videos.
During several sessions he filmed me in order to observe my gesture and its efficiency.
We analyzed my movement in detail to understand why my first balls were slow, and ineffective.
With the videos we were able to observe that my body alignment was not optimal.
We therefore worked on this point, so that during my push I was not unbalanced backwards.
Right now I'm focusing on getting my abs tight so I stay straight, and being able to push up and forward.
When my trainer films me again we see a correlation between my upward thrusts while staying sheathed and my effective services.
Thanks to this method I now serve harder, and I can put more spin on my ball.
I am therefore completely satisfied with the technical work using the technologies
I think we should make even greater use of new technologies, as they allow us to make relatively rapid progress and be more efficient.

Free softwares are described by the GNU foundation as a softwares that provides four majors liberties to theirs users. The first is that everyone can execute it without any restrictions. The second one is the possibility to study the source code of the software and share it to others. The third is that it can be modified by anyone. And the last one is the possibility to share the software with others with the modifications made.
Some people who don't know well free softwares might think that free software is softwares that are free, like in free beer. The confusion comes from the term 'free' whose meaning can describe both libre, or the fact that you do not have to pay for something. Also you don't have to pay for a lot of free softwares so it doesn't help to clarify things.
 Free softwares are used a lot, even if users don't realise it. For example a lot of websites are running on Linux, that is an operating system, with for example Apache to send HTML content. I am personnaly impressed by what free softwares can do in opposition with proprietary softwares, with far less money to create it.
Also free softwares enable people not to design a completly new software to do the same has the concurrent, this means less work to obtain the same results, because you don't have to do things several time.
I use Linux every time know, with softwares that are not designed to all people like tiling windows manager, that would not be possible with a proprietary software because there would not be enough users to use it.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
During internship in Olmix groupe, I realised experimentations of biostimulants on differents systems of production. Objectives was to test the diminution of pesticides in the field. With my superior and with help of three differents farmers, we tested differents formulations and combinaisons of biostimulant.The elaboration of biostimulants was possible with seewead juice and mineral composition. Seeweads was harvested twenty hours before transformation, they come in brittany's sea. In the field, we experimented four conditions. The first condition was the control (any pesticides and any biostimulants), the second condition with biostimulant, the third with pesticides and last one with combinaison of each produits. We took prelevements and we experimented the grow of plant and leaf and roots. We work with differents crops, for example wheat, corn and barley. On wheat, we observed differents dieases and the objectives of fungicides is to manage the fungus dieases. With experimentation, we took risque to use only biostimulant.
In some conditions, we mesured the photosystem activity of leaves with Spad Meter Material. To conclued the experimentation we harvested each crop during july and we tested mycotoxins in wheat and barley. The group promove sustainable agriculture and propose differents product (meat, vegetables) in restaurants. Seaweed permits to reduce pesticide in the field and pemits to reduce antibiotic in breed system.
The results show the benefic action of pesticides. The plants was healthy. With biostimulants, the plants was contaminated by differents diseases.
I think it is so difficult to contrôle disease with seaweed juice and biostimulants. The pesticides permits the food security for humanity. Also, it’s important to reduce pesticides for limite the pollution and limite human diseases. This internship was very interesting.

My interest in computer science started at the age of 8. My parents had a job that doesn't let them so much time to take care of my siblings and me. I spent some time just watching my big brothers playing video games and doing other stuffs. One of them was creating some little video games on his computer during his free time, and I wanted to do the same. I read the name of the software he was using and I decided to install it on my old personal computer. I tried to make my first video game then but it was quite hard as the software I was using was in english and I didn't know a single word at this time. This first experience created my first interest in digital creations.
2 years later, at the age of 10, I learnt programming in a computer science club for teenagers.The club was initially mainly focused around video games but the person in charge of the club took some of his time in order to teach me his knowledge in computer science. Since then, I didn't stopped programming some websites, softwares or video games. My interest didn't decrease over time and I still enjoyed this hobby today.
For 8 years, from the end of primary school to the end of highschool, it has always been logical and clear for me to join a computer science engineering school after my general studies. My only goal through all these years was to always learn new technologies and new skills. I didn't want to stick with the basics I knew.
Even with my interest in the subject, I have never been so sure about what job would fit me the most. The domain is huge and there are plenty of jobs related to computer science. The different experiences and the different people I met, helped me find my perfect future job. However, still today, I'm not so sure of what I will do after my studies.

the cinematographe, is a machine invented by Alex Dupont in 1895. It can be used as a camera and also as a cinema projector. It was on February 13, 1895, in Paris, that Alex Dupont and Alex Dupont filed their patent for the cinematograph. They bought the appellation from Alex Dupont in 1892, who had deposited it to protect his devices, but their good functioning has never been proven, no article from the professional and scientific press of the time attests to the existence of any projection carried out by Alex Dupont, which nevertheless would not have failed to attract the attention. The cinematographe uses the soft and resistant ribbon invented in 1888 by Alex Dupont and marketed in Paris and Paris by the American industrialist Alex Dupont. The invention of the camera, was a big succes in the industrie of multimedia. The Cinematograph was multifunctional and was used in differentes domaines. The cinematographe permitted a creation of film industry, thans to the camera who serves to shoot different scenes and  the cinema projector allows us to project a video or a movie in a big space  and enjoi a good movie.  the cinema is a mean of divertissement, that allows people to spend some time, in fact it's a efficient way to distract them selves. The creator of the cinematographe planned to create a machine that permits to  kill two birds with one stone, thats means that  it will enable you to achieve two things that you want to achieve, rather than just one. The creation on the camera provoqued a bid changement on the socaity, since the cinema had a big influence on the public opinion. It makes a big changements on the society normes and evolves the vision that people have.
 The creation of the cinematographe caused a big changements in a society. A camera that permets to shoot a scene, makes people express their ideas in a movies. They can capture moment to immortalize them, instead of a camera that can only take one shot at one time, it creates a succesion of image to make a smooth render.  It's a new kind of art and a better way to save memories .

In 1885, Alex Dupont discovered the vaccination. On the 6 July 1885, he received in his office a young boy, Alex Dupont, who had just been bitten by a dog, supposedly sick. Alex Dupont hesitated to inoculate the boy because he didn't have any symptom of rabies, but he decided to do it anyway. He gave the boy 13 shots of vaccine in 10 days, each one stronger than the precedent. He survived. Alex Dupont decided to inoculate a really vigorous form of the virus and then again he survived. He was vaccinated.
 I think this discovery changed the world. It opened the door to modern medicine and shaped our current demography. Before vaccination, child mortality was extremely high, up to 30 percents and thanks to that invention we are now down to 0.01 percents.

Texte_etudiant:
The electro-chemical battery is one of the discovery of the twentieth century that can change our future.
 In fact, the electro-chemical battery consist in using water to « make » electricity. Thanks to the electro-potential of the duo water (H2O) and dihydrogen (H2), we can, with a tension, convert dihydrogen into water and water into dihydrogen. This conversion, or oxydo-reduction reaction, liberate some electrons that are able to move in an electric circuit and here we are the battery is create and can be use.
 This discovery make the link between two scientific domains : physics and chemistry.
 We use the physics properties of the electron to make the circuit and the chemical properties of the oxydation and reduction of water and dihydrogen to produce electrons.
I said that this twentieth century’s discovery can change our future because the battery can replace combustion motor of our cars. If we do that, this will be good for the environment because cars that use a electro-chemical battery reject only water.
 However, we need to have the technologies to produce at the industrial scale the electro-chemicals battery because today the price is to higher in order to replace our combustion motor cars. A family will buy a car that is not expansive even if the consequence about the environment are not good.
 Moreover, the dihydrogen is an inflammable gas with a lot of risk and we do not have the technologies to stock it in fuel station. A simple contact with a source of energy like fire for example and you can say goodbye to the fuel station.

The autonomous car is one of the fastest evolving technologies. I remember in my childhood, seeing these prototypes on tv with huge computers in the boot and visible radars everywhere. It was like this would not arrive before a very long time. But in ten years, progress have been huge !
Scientists and car manufacturers are now able to industrialize these technologies. It is now possible to have all the onboard safety features integrated with a minimal impact on style and a better reliability.
However, our cars are still not able to drive by themeselves in all conditions. It is currently only possible on highway or traffic jams. Having a completly autonomous car is still a long way in front of us because we also need to adapt our road infrastructures to communicate with the cars (for example at traffic lights).
I am very confident these improvements will be made at some point and maybe in a not to distant future. Each year new discoveries are made and help this technology to go forward !
 We often think the autonomous car is a robot that drives the car all by itself. This could be the ultimate vision but some of the autonomous car technologies have been already largely implemented in lots of our cars. To identify the evolutions, cars are classified on a scale from zero to five. Zero beeing fully manual and five full automation.
Currently, most modern cars are of level one, two or three. One is a low level where cars can only manage steering or speed but not both. At level two and three they can do it at the same time. Three beeing less restrictive. The goal is not only the final objective of the fully autonomous car but improving the driver's safety all along the researches. Cars are way safer than before, especially in slippery conditions or traffic jams with the different driving assistance systems.
Some boldier experimentations are also driven. For example, some little shuttles are going to be commissioned on campus in just a few days. It will show to the students and staff how could be our future means of transportation on small distances. The manufacturer will be able to test it in real conditions with regular cars driving on the same roads (it is a national first because normally this kind of vehicles are segregated from traffic). They have a very high grade of automation, so if it works well, it will improve the confidence of the public in these technologies.
One problem that we will have to solve is the legal situation of the autonomous car. Who is responsible in case of an accident ? The car or the driver ? If the car has to made a difficult choice, for example, killing the driver or a pedestrian, what happens ? In Paris, we don't even have a law that allows fully autonomous cars to be sold to individuals. This will have consequences on our vision of road safety but also our ethics.

I will talk about communication through painting. Since many centuries, Man can expresses himself and communicates with world with the painting. Communication through painting starts in the Prehistory, humans of that era have drawn on the cave walls many things that they have seen like animals but also themselves. Today we can still see that's drawings across the world like in Paris with Lascaux Caves. But with time, communication through painting has not highly changed, technics of paintings aren't the same but the message behind paintings is always similar. Man do paintings to remember him good times, to make a pretty object but in many cases Man paints to say something to someone. That's can be a feeling (painter show us him feelings like anger, sadness, hapiness, lonelyness), a life scene (like his city, his family) or a more deeper message like an actual preoccupation (climate deregulation, war). For me, communciation through painting is very important in our society, it allows to learn things and to think about things without the langage barrier. Everyone can have a different interpretation of a Alex Dupont painting or a Alex Dupont painting but there are not falses interpretations. It changes the classic rapport between Man and communication.

At the end of the PACES, the first year of medicine, we must do a practice in the hospital during four weeks.
The first 2 weeks I was in the cardiology service. This was the first time I work in a hospital.
I spent time with nurses and auxiliary nurse. I looked how they work and I tried to do the same like take pressure, give medication and do blood test. In this service, patient were independent, so we didn't have to wash their.
The second 2 weeks, I was in the vascular surgery service. I was in contact with people who had an important diabete. contrary to the other service, the patients are very dependent of the medical team.
 It permits to discover how all the health professional work together. I can saw that there is a real team work and how the communication between doctor and nurses is important to the good supervision of patients.
Then, I know more about cardiology diseases and what treatments are use. I really enjoy this 2 weeks in cardiology, I can learned a lot of things.
But the other weeks were more difficult because a lot of patient must be amputate.
I discovered how to speak and reassure patients in difficulties. I think it is a good experience for the futur doctor.

Artificial Intelligence
In the last few years, surgery's robots have been developpped a lot, all specialities concerned (thoracic, digestive, neurologic surgeries)
Ingeneers work hard in order to create the most efficiente robot ever, with a larger amplitud in movments, a better precision, and less ....... than surgeons themselves.
However, robotic tools would never replace the surgeon's hand and his qualifications, they bring precious help and increase surgeon's skills.
Studies led on robots for surgery showed a true positive impact on patient recovery, with smaller scars, less time of hospitalisation behind, less complications, etc.
 To my mind, the medicine world is a world in constant development and increasing. Our actual practising will move on with new medical stools based on artificial intellogence.
However, it's stiil being (more than ever) an ethical world where our humanity takes its entiere place, and wich is our main advantage in front of robotic increasing.

So I'm going to talk about the discovery of the small pox vaccine. The small pox at the time was very curent, many people died from it, and the ones who didn't were scared for live. Everyone could be contaminated rich or poor, at any age.
Alex Dupont was an english rural doctor in the 18 century. He noticed that girls who milked cow were not contaminated from this disease (most of them) but seemed to have contract an other disease : the cowpox. The cowpox is a virus, present in the bovine, that's why the milker were contaminated. It gives ressemblance symptoms to the small-pox, afterwards the patient have vesicle with pus on his hand or somewhere else.
Alex Dupont then thought that the cow-pox was maybe a protection against the small-pox. He tried an experience : he infected an eight years old boy with the vaccine by inoculate pus from a young girl. The boy had a fever, but nothing serious (prouv that he contracted the vaccin). Then the doctor inoculated the variole, and the boy survived, and Alex Dupont discovered a prevention against small-pox. So it's was a huge progress in medicine but at what cost ?
 I was talking about the discovery of immunisation by Alex Dupont. Nowadays Alex Dupont is considered as the father of immunisation. But what people often forget it's that he wasn't sure of his theory when he tested it on the 8 years old boy. He could have killed him. So we could wonder if he should be described as a hero, or in contrary as a paria. If we should endanger a few people live to save the masses or not ?
Because if we think about it,  in the 50's,  Americans doctor infected prisoners with different disease to observed the evolution of the disease, it was kind of the same thing except, they didn't find anything and they were strongly condemned by the public opinion.
This exemple is for one, one of the basis of immunisation, but also it raise ethical dilemma, witch we still see today. I think the main reason people praise him he that his experience was a success, but I can't forget that he risk a life of someone, who I suppose couldn't understand the risks he was taking.
