During the first part of my class, I studied the informatic 's history. So, I will explain in particulary the history of the web. I think it's interessant to speak about that beacuse today most of us use it, this invention is not very far from us generation. This invention started with the searcher Alex Dupont, he tried to put in place a better organisation in the aim to work better with his collegues in his university.
In fact, he finds the idea of create a new system which have a fonctionnement near of the human's brain. Then another searcher creates a system to link the informaticsdocuments, this system  works idea by idea, there is an association between the idea.
In 1991, the first website of history was published, his name is : Word Wide Web. This website was built in the aim to put in commun all the documents exchanged during the searches in the university.  This evolution is like revolutionnary, the technology of the web start to be knows and many other searchers develop it.
In fact, in 1995 we can count 19 000 website, this same year Microsoft started his system of Internet Explorer. Five years later, in 2000,10 milion of website are counted, this evolution take a turn very important.
Today the websites are counted in billion! So, we can see that this evolution is a type of revolution in the informatic history, but in 1995 the searchers considerated the website like site to announce the information.
The usages of them has changed, like the searchers don't know what this invention will give, they think that there is another medium to give some information. Today the usages have very changed, the website are more use in the aspect personnal, most of people use website to explain what they do like in the blog or they used it to find a recipie.
In 1995 the personal aspect doesn't very exist, moreover the old websites were not like today. There were no pictures, and people could not put too much things because the website has not a big place of stockage.
 This invention has permite to develop the usages of the informatic. Today we can find many usages, and it's accessible at everybody whereas before the usages were more for the State or for the governement. In fact this invention is a  progress benefic to everyone and it permite too to have a better organisation, and more near to the human's brain.

 He finds a cell who be able to produce air and maintien the worm alive. For him it's was a revolution. He thoughts about this discover "how he can use it?" . He wants use it to help humans. Because we have to know than the sand worm blood is 99.9% compatible with the human blood. He managed to extract this cell and multipliate it.
He created a product to healping human's organ during transplantation, like heart, liver, lung... Thanks this product, a liver, for example, can live "alone", extract of human body, a lot more than without the product. Thanks to it we can also work with different country. If someone in Paris needs a liver and we have one available in Paris, with the product we have time to come and to give them.

CART-T cells
Until now, it was necessary to poison the malignant cells to destroy them, all without killing the patient by attacking unfortunately his healthy cells. Thos task was facilated by the fact that malignant cells, multiplying faster than others, absorbed more chemotherapy than healthy cells. Then the researchers developed immune cells that could track and diretcly attack cancer cels, CAR-T Cells. Initially developed in acute leukemia in children, there are also CAR-T cells specific to different types of blood cancers in adults (myeloma, lymphoma...).
More specifically, this therapy involves genetically modifying in some immune cells called T lymphocytes in the laboratory, in order to provide them with a receptor (the CAR) to hunt cancer cells and destroy them. An advanced treatment therefore, more accurate than any other existing therapy.
 In my opinion, I think that this new discovery will make it possible to treat patients much better and to no longer damage healthy cells. Chemotherapy is becoming more and more of an obsolete method and the new treatments are much more precise and much less dangerous for patients: fewer side effects and better efficacy.
Furthemore, it shows that medicine and pharmacy ar evolving by listening o patient's expectations and doing everything to improve their lives during their treatments is extremely expensive and many patients do not have the means to obtain it so it shows that we are not all equal in the face of the disease.

I can speak about aquaponic system. It is a system which used animal population ( for exemple fishes) and plants. Furthermore:  you have to feed fishes, fishes produces waste like nitrogen, ammonium, phosphorus... These waste will serve for growing plants. Plants are using waste of fishes and they are in a substrate with bacteria. Bacteria permit ton convers ammonium which come from fishes waste into nitrate. Plants use preferencially nitrate and not ammonium. Ammonium is toxic for fishes so it is essentially that it is convers into an other hands before to return to the fish population. So plants are growing with waste fishes and substrate and after the water return to fish population.
 I think it could be the urbain solution for the future. Cities are too plenty , there to much people and less space because of the builting of houses; building, shops... It is complicated in cities to keep "free area" to cultivate plants to eat. The aquaponic system permit for plants to grow without roots in soil. It grow asssentially thinks to fish and water. So we will not need to keep free area we will can create vertical farms with aquaponis sytem. I think it is the solution  for future in cities

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
Since I am a medical student I would like to debate on the great invention of "first aid".I am not sure it is appropriate to talk about it as an invention, maybe it is more a wonderful initiative.
Everything started in 1870, during the violent Franco-Prussian war. Alex Dupont, a military surgeon, outraged by the increasing number of suffering and abandoned  victims, decided to open an informal hospital in a church in order to take their pain in charge.
He managed to get the citizens involved (those who were not as war so that it included mainly women and elderly persons).
His goal was not only to cure the wounds of the soldiers, but also to help them contacting their families, sending prayers to their close relation before passing by.
His initiative was based on a strong yearning for humanism and social progress.
This is how the Red Cross was born. It is still an active organisation nowadays. The activities it proposes are constantly improving. From a will to help the soldiers at war, it is now opening to the sailers in dangerous situations. Te Red Cross also provides goods and support for war victims, citizens in distress during battles.
The Red Cross is now more than a medical organisation. It is a human association which joined by anyone dreaming of helping his society to be more united.
 Now that you know more about the birth of first aid, it is time tu discuss the consequences of this great initiative.
First of all, the Red Cross is a real source of inspiration for anyone who to put some humanity in his life. It gives a real opportunity to discovering the harshness of life on some part of glob, and understanding how lucky we are ti live in Europe.
Then, it gives to soldiers some hope while their are at war, knowing that if something happen to them, their will be someone to try rescuing them or at least if things turn bad, that their family will be taken in charge.
First aid is now present in our everyday life. Today it is obvious that taking care of others is everyone's moral mission. In the street you can find automatic defibrillator to rescue a victim of a heart attack.
Anyone can follow some courses to learn the basis of first aid, like the cardiopulmonary resuscitation.
It is also possible to buy some first aid kits in case of daily accidents.
To conclude first aid is on one hand the traduction of a more human society vision, and on the other, it became a real advantage to fight against the risks life can put in our path.

During many years, doctors and pharmacists treated a lot off diseases with antibiotics.

Many people doesn't respect conditions of prescription and duration. Sometimes they stop to take pills before the last of the prescription.
That's why, today we assist at an increase of resistances and some little infections can't be treated. It's a real danger for populations because  scientifics doesn't find new antibiotics. The bacteria's resistance is a new capacity of the bacterial to fight the molecule to continue is development in the body. The drug have not effect on it.
 In consequence of bacteria's resistances development, we need to help the recherche to find new treatments.
We also need to educate patients, they have to respect them treatment, posology and duration.
Doctors doesn't abuse of antibiotics prescriptions to any infections.
The role of pharmacists, biologists and researchers is very important in therapeutics' development and for the good-health of our society.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
Some months ago, a new experience has been exposed to the scientific world.
A scientist had realised an experience to genetically modify the genome of babies, to insert them a genome who is resistant at the HIV's virus.
For that, he had selectionned ten women, and ten mens. But these last are contaminate by the virus. So, the scientist asked to these reals couples to make  a baby, and after that, he had modified the genome of the foetus.
Nine months later, twins borned of the experimentation. So now, the Ethic scientific comitee have to judge if the experience can be acceptable or not. So today, we don't know if babies are immunitated against the HIV, and maybe we never know.
 My opinion about this experience is that first, no one knows that fathers of they babies are contaminate by the HIV, but the scientist never tell that. For ethics reasons, I'm afraid about that.
Secondly, if the experience is a success, it significate that we can modify any genomes, and in some years we will can be baby design (choose the sexe, the hair colour or eye's colour of the baby).
Furthermore, the scientist had realized his experience with a simple method of genetic (CRISPR-Cas9), and it's scaring to see that many peoples can replicate the experience (with ethics concepts this time) as easier like that.
But, in the orther side, I'm proud of the scientific progress, and to see as we can found new ideas to revolutionize the world. But today, we have to take this progress to the benefit of Earth and the climate change.

The cocaïne was the first effective local anesthetic, but doctors thought it was safe for patients and a lot of people became addict to it.
The ether appeared in the 19th century in Paris, when a lot of people thought that surgery can't exist without pain. After that some men found the chloroform and the curare to inhibit the muscle contraction. That plant was finding in Amazonia and used such as an anesthetic in the 20th century.
Now hospitals use some mixed of different chimical elements which proved their effectiveness in this domain, and there are a lot of doctors specialized in anesthesia. They studied every anesthetic to be sure that is safe in any circonstances for every patients.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
Alex Dupont was a french physician, chemist and researcher who had discovered and made vaccines against a lot of diseases. In fact, with other scientists, he had discovered how to save lives with his vaccine against anthrax, for example.
 This is a very dangerous disease and it has a high risk of death if contracted in certain way.
 Indeed, if Bacillus anthracite is contracted on the skin, there is a low risk of death by this form of contracting the disease. Symptoms are scratching, circles on the skin that become darker with a few time; this is why it is called "charcoal disease". Then, the skin is going to be more and more hurting and it is actually because of decomposing by bacteria which uses skin cells as a source of carbon, nitrogen and oxygen; skin is great a source of nutrients.
 So this bacteria can be transmitted by touching and contact skin by skin for example, however, it can be healed if it is earlier of the disease.
 The second way of contracting anthrax is by eating the spores of the bacteria.
 Spores are the best form of some bacteria to resist when there are no more nutrients to survive in their environment. We have to say that it is the same bacteria, Bacillus anthracis, but it just a different form of this. In this case, spores can be ate on the grass by animals such as cows and sheeps for example but humans can also be victims of this form of anthrax. In fact, it can be found in glass boxes when we want food to be conserved for a long time, by using pasteurizing conservation by a home made preparation. Spores can survive to high temperatures, environment without water and too much salts etc.
 As a result, even if we cook food with spores which are invisible without a microscope, they can survive and then you will get sick and it a very dangerous way of contracting anthrax, We have already seen lot of animals, dying in only one day because of spores in the ground. However, it is not as much dangerous as the third way.
 The last way of contracting anthrax is by breathing the bacteria of spores of Bacillus anthracis.
 In fact, by this way, bacteria can pass easily all of areas of the intern body thanks to the high level of humidity. Symptoms are difficulties of breathing then bacteria infect all of the organs and, in only a few hours, the death of the people or animal. There are a few chances to survive of anthrax by this contraction of the disease.
 To conclude, Alex Dupont was a great scientist who had found a way to be not infected by this kind of bacteria, dangerous for life and it is so a great discover.
 As for me, vaccines in general are a great way to save lives and it should be used in all the countries, in all populations in the world because it permits to save lives before people get sick.

In the 16th century, Europeans followed their desire to conquest the world and settled in Paris.  The first successful settlement was made by the British. As Europeans settlers encountered what they called "The New World", they also discovered that this territory was occupied by a population : Native Americans. Called "Indians" when Alex Dupont discovered Paris thinking he has arrived in Paris, this population existed on this continent for decades. It was a shock between the Native Americans and the Europeans who believed they could simply decide to own this territory to own it.
 The discovery of Paris by the Europeans has had a lot of consequences. The main one is the tragic destiny of the Natives Americans who fought against the settlers to protect their territory. Unfortunately, disease and lack of modern weapons cost lots of death on their side. Settlers successfully took control of this territory which later formed Paris. Native Americans remained under control of the Europeans settlers and their heir, being often parked in reserves which still exist today. Settlers tried to erase this civilisation as they didn't embrace any diversity. Native Americans suffered a lot from the arrival of the Europeans, who happily consider it as one of the greatest discovery ever.

When I was a kid, I always admired people who make other people happy by creating silly things. My childhood was spend reading Uncle Scrooge (Alex Dupont in French) in elementary school and one of my favorite character was Alex Dupont (Alex Dupont in French). He was a crazy scientist able to create machineries for helping Alex Dupont and his friends.
When I grew up, I knew I'll never be able to be a duck, or creating crazy things, but I thought that being an engineer would be the closest to what I aim to be in the futur.
In high school, I found myself a passion in physic and chemistry, and when I had to choose a path for my studies after having my degree, I found that being a engineer studying materials and their properties would be very interesting, so I applied to the ESIR engineering school, and here I am.
Currently, I don't have a specific type of person in mind that I aspire to be, but I know that the world we're living in is changing thanks to new technologies. Due to all the issues we're facing like climate change, wars, world hunger and the lack of mustard in Paris, doing something is necessary to help our futur children, and studying materials can be useful in this brand new challenge our generation is facing.
Studying materials seems to be a bit useless, like, why would we be studying concrete? But finding out how the matter behave and why they behave like that is very important for using their properties. For example, semiconductors are crystals that can behave like an electric conductor or like an isolant, depending of their surrounding. Piezoelectric ones can release an electric signal when a pressure is applied, so they are used in shock sensors or in electric scales.
I don't think I'll be able to create a time travel machine, or a new type of AI robots that will conquiert the world and destroy all humankind, but I'll be happy if in the futur my work would be useful to change the world a little bit.

A 3D bioprinter can be used to repare skin damage for patients with large burn. It scan the wound and create a piece of skin for transplant. It has been produced by reaserches from Wake Forest Institute for Regenerative Medecine in Paris, Paris. We don't know if the skin created would be accepted by the humain body given that it's not human cells.
 The advantages of this printer is that it's movable and with the special ink composed of cells and hydrogel substrats it can recreate skin. The device scan the wound and know exactly where to put the cells. The technologie need to be tested on human being. It can avoid painfull graft.
For patients with large skin damages, it would be faster to heal and painless because we don't have to remove skin from the patient and make it growth before transplant it.

Recently, the research against cancer has found new molecules that could have an effect on cancer cells. In fact, it is a kind of vaccines which is able to stimulate the immune system of patients affected by a cancer. Studies have been done in laboratories on animals and are beginning on hundreds of women and men. These molecules aren't on the market yet but scientists hope that they will be in less than 10 years. The aim of this new vaccine is to inject deux molecules : a CpG oligonucleotide and the receptor OX40. Thanks to that injection, T cells of the patient can be activated and destruct the cancer cells.
 Even if this vaccine is not available yet, we can hope that he we permit to save many lives. It is important to know that cancer is the disease which kills the most in many countries of the world. The main reason for this is that no treatment has been developped. A woman have recently been cured from a breast cancer thanks to this technique so this is very auspicious.
Moreover, I think that it is important to remember that the research against tha cancer can be financed by donations. If everybody mobilize and participates to help the research against cancer, we will find a solution quicker to this sad disease.

Liver cancer is a desease that hit more and more people, due to our way of life. But recently, a team of italian researchers treated a patient with a new methode. Scientists remove the liver, irradiated it, and then replace it inside the body. Several month after the surgery, the patient, who had a bad pronostic, is well.
It was the first time in the world that a cancer was treated in that way, removing organ from the body, irradiated by radiotherapy and remplace. This technic permited to doctors to administrate strong radiations to the differents tumors without touching the organs around.
This 48 years old patient was judged to be in a desesperate situation. Cancer like that are generaly very hard to remove with the actual techniques (chimio and radiotherapy).
This discovery is a huge progress in the medical domain. It's the result of 15 years of research. This new methode will soon concern 6 more patient in that siutation.
 It's a great discovery for the medical world. It gives hope to the different poeple who are sick. Actually, this technique is just for the liver, but with the continuous progress, I think we could be albe to treat other cancer soon.

On the point of view of the electric type, the batteries that car possess are limited to a few hundred kilometers of autonomy. Then it is necessary to recharge the battery with the help of electric terminal installed at home for example.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences et proprietes de la matiere
Texte_etudiant:
Today, I talk about an scientific experiment, when in class we have make our Aspirin®. At the university we have practical work several times a week and this week we have synthesize the aspirin thanks to the acetic anhydride and the salicylic acid.
For this experiment we have use the process developed in 1975. It is rather easy and consists of the esterification of the hydroxyl function of salicylic acid with acetic anhydride, in an acid medium.
To start we have be levied the start product, we have insert in a ballon and we have heat the mixture. Then we have filter the mixture to recupered the Aspirin. But now we don't have the final product, to get it we cleaned the product obtained with ethanol and water before filtering it again.
Then we weigh and we test the point of fusion of our apsirin to control the product formed. We have formed a good product because we obtain a 69% yield.
 This experience has been rewarding for me because drug manufacturing is an area of particular interest to me.

I'm gonna talk about one of my experience as medical worker.
At the end of my second year of medicine, I worked for the first time in an EPHAD  (sort of center for elder person) as an auxiliary. I discovered the envirnment where medical staff (like nurse)  used to work.
I saw how careful and kind could the medical staff be; as much as they could be rash, brutal and disrepectful with some residents. I don't judge them for their behaviour because sometimes people living over there were not easy to manage. Most of the people working at this EPAHD were "human", they were really concerned by the mental end physical health of the residents.
It is very stressful to work right there because we have to work efficiently and to be fast at the same time. We have a dozens tasks to do, and it changes every day (even in the same morning or afternoon sometimes).  Indeed, we have to take care of all the 60 residents at the same time and to do what is asked by the direction. I know it's hard to be always smiling and kind when we are under pressure. However, it doesn't justify all the bad actions some employee made.
 So, after my one month working in an EPHAD and my experience at hospital, I really understood how hard it was to be a nurse, an auxiliary and a helping-nurse (AS in french ?).
There are not enough staff, whether for nurses, auxiliary or helping-nurse. They can't be asked to do millions things correctly, to be kind with everybody, to take time to take care of all patients and to do all of this quickly. It's simply IMPOSSIBLE.
Some doctors are forgetting that when they ask "little things" to nurse, it's already too much for them.
I think that I will never forget how important it is to be careful and respectful with our collegues. If medical staff is not well treated (intern students as well), how can we expect them to be good/to treat correctly their patients ?
To be able to take care/to treat in best conditions our patients, we have to be treated with kindness and respect as well.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
Chromatine Immunoprecipitation (ChIP) :
  Chromatine immunoprecipitation is a technique using in a lot of laboratories. The objectif of this experiment is to identifie proteins that are linked to DNA or RNA at a precis moment in a cell and the sequence of DNA or RNA. To begin with, we have to realise a cross-linking between proteins and DNA, using formaldehyde for example. Cells are lysed and chromatin isolated. Then, chromatin is fragmented using a detergent or ultrasons and fragments are in contact with a particular antibody against a protein. Complex formed with proteins, DNA and antibodies precipite and can be isolated. Thisi way, we have only the protein we are interested in, linked to DNA. To determine the sequence of DNA, we have to reverse the cross-linking using a detergent and wash the extract. Then we use the technique of Polymerisation Chain Reaction (PCR) to amplifie the fragment of DNA that has been isolated before. Finally, we need to sequence fragments to determine the precise sequence of DNA that is recognise by the protein. This technique also allows to identifie proteins that form a complex on DNA. In this case, we have to realise at least two immunoprecipitations using differents antibodies to detect all proteins involved in the complex. Then, to identifie proteins, we make a Western Blot. Proteins move across polyacrylamide gel, according to their lengs.
Chromatine immunoprecitation is a major technique used to understand how works regulation of genes expression in our cells. It allows us to identifie proteins involved in regulation and sequences they recognize. This way, we can understand some pathologies that are cause by a particular gene and think of a possible treatment.

In chemistry, there are so much experitment to understand the world and how it works but I choose a simple experitment to make copper in evidence.
When we have a liquid in chemistry  and that we want to proove the presence of copper in this solution, we can put in a nail of iron,  and if we have copper in it we will observe a sediment of copper on the nail. Why have we a sediment on the nail ? Because the potentiel electric of the couple Cu<sup>2+ </sup>/ Cu is higher than the potentiel electric of the couple Fe<sup>2+</sup> /Fe. In chemistry the potentiel electric allows us to preview an reaction before really doing it. In chemistry this couple of iron and copper are couple redox so a oxidant react with a reducer in exchange of electron. In the solution Cu<sup>2+ </sup> give an electron to Fe and this reaction given copper and Fe<sup>2+</sup> in an exchange of electron.
 This experitment wich allows to see if there are copper in a solution or not can be useful in the chemistry industry to see if there are copper on a machine or in the water or any solution which can be contaminated by any form of copper. Copper which can be dangerous in many experitment or for human and animals life. This experitment is convenient, and can be realise with not much materials in disposition, it is not hard to make this result so  much doing this experitment than another one for the same result.

I will discribe an experimentation which took place in the 20th century. This experimentation is the Alex Dupont experiment.
This test had for objective to test the reactivity and reactions of men when they have to obey an authority figure.
This authority figure was in fact doctors, they told to the men instructions.
During the Alex Dupont experiment, a large population of men from different social origins between 20 and 50 years had to ask questions to another man. The men had to administer electric shocks. The another man was a comedian but the man asking questions doesn't know that. The comedian was sitting on a chair with electrods.
When this comedian did a mistake answering the questions, the man had to administer electro shocks. Those shocks were more and more powerful as the time and the questions passed.
The electro shocks were in fact to learn, if the answer is wrong, then pain can be helpful to the person. He can memorize more easily.
But as the time passed, the man asking the questions doubted of the efficacity because the man receiving the electro shocks can't handle this pain, he was dying . So he reffered to the authority, and continued to inflige the pain to the other man.
The results of the Alex Dupont experiment had shown that mes could inflige mortal electro shocks to another man if it's the instructions of the authority. Actually around 68% of the men did the mortal electro shocks.
I find this experimentation really interesting because it can explain many acts of violence, we can take the example of Alex Dupont who programmed the train to Paris. Like the men of the experimentation, he stopped thinking and just followed orders.
So this can explain why many people did acts which can hurt people and i think it's interesting to learn about the relation with the authority.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences et proprietes de la matiere
Texte_etudiant:
Electrical vehicles are our best shot at changing our ways of moving around. To do so, efficient and cheap batteries will be needed. The most prominent technologie right now is the Li-Ion one. It it based on the use of lithium ions, put in an organic and acid solution. It is already used in all of our techs, such as phones or computers, and of course, in electrical cars. But this technologie has multiple problems. First of all, its components are getting quite rare as lithium is not findable everywhere. Then, it is quite hard to recycle such batteries nowadays. We know how to do it, but it is still quite expensive and there are not enough facilities able to do it for the moment. Also, extracting lithium from the Earth is quite expensive and pollutes a lot, since it uses big machines that consume a lot of fuel. Finally, because of theses problems and a few others, these Li-Ions batteries are getting more and more expensive (although the increase in cost in downscaled by the mass effect of the growing batterie industry).
However, there are a few technologies that could replace Li-Ion, and solve these problems. One of the most promising one right now is the Na-Ion batterie technologie. It would work in the same way as the previous one I talked about, but use sodium, which is much cheaper and easier to extracts as it is present on Earth in bigger amounts than lithium. This technologie is still a work in progress, but is being researched by quite a lot of people around the world, and a lot of them are in Paris !
There are a few other technologies that could replace the ones se use for our cars. For example, we could still use fuel based vehicles, but that fuel could be e-fuel, made from bio-waste. Hydrogen cars are also a good alternative, but as of right now, the production of the reservoirs for hydrogen pollutes too much for this technology to be considered a viable solution.
In the end, what needs to be remembered is that we need to develop new technologies and ways of transportation if we do not want to destroy our planet. Therefore, lots of different solutions are being studied. The general thought in this field is that some technologies will suit better some means of transports than others. For example, e-fuel and hydrogen might be a better fit for trucks and buses, where electrical motors will work better for our everyday cars.

Hello, I'm going to write my feelings about one of my favorite series of video games, the Hotline Miami saga.
Hotline Miami is a serie of two indie games, Hotline Miami and Hotline Miami 2 : Wrong Number. The two are 2D video games with view from above and a very retro graphic style. Hotline Miami is mostly famous for his explicit violence, the hard difficulty of the levels ("die and retry" game), the amazing musics (synthwave style), the cryptic events following the main story, the "on drugs" and 80's vibes feelings during the adventure.
The world of Hotline Miami is an uchronia (an alternate history), in which the Paris and the Paris have fought each other in a war during the 80's. The Paris capitulated after the destruction of Paris by an atomic bomb. The game set place in Paris, where the russian mafia activity is growing since the end of the Paris/USSR war. The game feature many playable characters, mostly in the second game.
In the first game, the player is left with a quick tutorial and no story elements at all, you start the game without even knowing the name or background of the character you are playing. The player soon discover that his character live alone in an appartment in Paris, and that someone leaves cryptic phone's message to him, like a professional call telling him to go at some places to do some work. Our characther follow these instructions and leave his appartment to take his vehicule and drive to the adress of the phone message. However, when the character arrives at the place, the player has to choose an animal mask to wear and discovers a place full of ennemies.The core of the game is to clear all the building by eliminating all the ennemies inside, then going back to your car. Firstly, the player is encourage to kill, with the score and combos system, and the catchy music. However, after succeeding to kill every ennemy, the music stop suddenly, replaced by a weighty sound, and the player has to travel all the way back to his vehicule, seeing all the dead bodies left on the way. The more you progress in the game, the more the story will be brought to the forefront in place of the gameplay, and the player would not only play the game but try to understand what happens.
I liked the game for the unique storytelling, and the meaning that we get after succeeding to understand all the links between the events of the two games.
Despite the first look, Hotline Miami is a game against the violence, and left a strong feeling of accomplishment for both succeed all levels and finally understand the whole story and the message associted.

Today I'm going to talk about a laser surgery to correct myopia.
For many years, glasses and contact lenses were the only options if you had myopia. But now you can have a laser surgery and you won't be myopic anymore. You have to be at least eighteen, and your vision must be stable since at least two years. The operation is 15-minutes long for each eye, and only needs a local anaesthesia. With the help of a laser, the surgeon will cut a part of the cornea and then modify the curvature of the eyeball to improve your vision. After the operation, the vision can be a little blurry, that's why it is important to rest and follow the post-operation care closely. After only a few weeks, people who underwent the operation claims that their vision has clearly improved and that they don't need glasses anymore.
 I think that this laser surgery can improve people's lives.
Glasses are fine, but they can be a little bit bothering if it's rainy outside for example, and it is worth saying that some people don't like the aesthetic of glasses. Contact lenses can be a good alternative, but at the end of the day, the eyes can be really dry because of them. Moreover, some people will never be able to wear contact lenses in their life. That's why the laser surgery is important, because it gives people an other opportunity to correct their myopia, and this surgery improves your vision for life. It is not only a correction of an optic problem, it is a long-term solution. In addition to that, the surgery is short and mostly well-tolerated.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
Plants seem silents, and humans have always considered them as live-beings unable to communicate. But other the past few years, scientists discovered the had a very complex way to share informations. In fact, plants can share informations with each other, but by relaesing chemicals in their environment. For example, if one of them is being eaten by some leaf-eating insect, it will send a chemical message in the atmosphere indicating what type of insect is feeding on it so its neighboors can prepare to defend themselves by creating toxic or repulsive molecules for the predator. This communication prooved to be intra and interspecific, meaning even plants from different species can understand the message. This hability is a very interesting advantage for organisms that cannot run away from any danger.
This discovery might gelp scientists to find a biological way to fight against insects which feed on plants used by humans, and to defend native species against invasive arthropods species.
 To my opinion, knowing that plants can communicate and interact with each other could be really usefull for human-beings. By knowing better the ecology of vegetals is interesting , and not only for the scientific discovery, but because of the opportunities it brings to enhance our production capacities in agriculture and to find more ecological ways to protect the environment by using the molecules to prevent the spread of diseases by warning the plants of the incoming danger, for example. And the variety of molecules the plants can create could have other interesting properties that could be usefull in other research fields such as medication. But I think every discovery as to be considered with caution.

I will talk about antibiotics. They were discovered in 1928 with the penicilium. They are the best solution, even today, against bacteria infection. It was a good discovery because antibiotics cure people from infection which sometimes killed patients.
Today we developted a lot of antibiotics with a large spectrum of activity. But they can have some toxicity on the body like for example kidney toxicity.
 They helped a lot but today we use to much antibiotics in Paris. The problem is that bacterias can develop some adaptation and resistance angainst antibiotics. We used to much antibiotics and unfortunately today they are less efficace than before and bacterias are strongers. In Paris sometimes even if you have a viral infection doctors can give you some antibiotic, but it is not efficace. In Paris for example, they prescribe less antibiotics than in Paris but they are more efficace because bacterias did not develop the same resistance of the treatement as in Paris.
To conclude I think that antibiotics are a wonderfull discovery for the medecine but today in Paris we use it to much and we have to try to reasone and reduce the consommation of antibiotics.

When I entered high school, I wanted to become a pastry chef. My parents convinced me to have my "baccalauréat" first, and then go to a pastry school.
During my three year of high school, most of my friend wanted to go on computer science related studies, and little by little, I wanted to know more about this field. In the last year of high school, when we had to choose in which school we wanted to continue our studies, I wanted to try a computer science school. All I knew about was INSA and polytech. But my father told me : "I often work with ESIR's students, there are very good at their jobs, even if the school is not as known as the INSA". That is the reason why I put the ESIR in my list. However, I had never written code, so it was a bet. Maybe after the first year, I would have been traumatized by computer science, and wanted to try something else.
Moreover, I still enjoy cooking, but when I have chosen ESIR instead of a pastry school, I told myself : "I can try to become a pastry chef with a computer science diploma, but not a computer science engineer with a diploma from a pastry school".
I have kept two ideas as spare wheels, to become either a teacher in high school (probably a math teacher), or a pastry chef. But they are very difficult jobs, so I really hope that I will get my diploma in computer science.
In conclusion, my bet was successful. I really love what I am doing right now, and even if I am sometimes frustrated when we are doing more mathematics than computer science, I think it was the best decision I could make.

Modern medical bacteriology has been evolving a lot lately. Even if the most striking invention in the field is the discovery of antibiotics, the bacteria analysis still didn't change since the 70's. However, in the last decade, we could developp new genome-based techniques. In order to simplify the diagnosis and the analysis of bacterial resistance and pathogenesis mechanisms, researchers and pharmaceutical companies from all over the world have spent their time, money and a lot of dedication to these new techniques. Following an example (ISG15 & Chlamydia trachomatis), this short article will present you the guidelines to follow in order to create a technique of this kind.
At first, you must ensure that the pathology that you want to study is related to a single and specific pathogen (bacteria, ...). Then, an harassing work of molecular mechanisms elucidation needs to be done in order to understand : how, when and why the pathology appears, as well as how can we detect it and how can we treat/cure it. If we already have medicines which may target this microbe, then we may have to use it. Else we have to create a new molecule to fight against the pathogen using the different molecular mechanisms we previously discovered.
The example I took is an human, innate imunnity-related protein called ISG15 during genital infections due to Chlamydia trachomatis. This protein was thought to have little impact on this bacteria but it has been recently established that it could be an indicator of vaginal chlamydiosis. Actually, this intracellular protein is found in the infected cells at an early stage of infection and in the blood at a later stage. The plasmatic levels of ISG15 could help the diagnosis. The upregulation of this protein may be related to a better recovery of the infection in mice -even if it can't be the only way to cure it.
 In conclusion, my personal opinion on the discovery of the importance of ISG15 in Chlamydia-related infections stands in 2 points. Once again, it shows that we can still developp and create anti-infective agents. It is also a quite beautiful proof that modern bacteriology needs to go further and further in the detail when trying to discover a new drug.

Recently, the French government has allowed some pharmacists in some regions to vaccinate patients for the flu. This experiment will last two years. The government took this decision to reduce doctors' load of work who complained. It also aims to get more patients to take the vaccine as the number of person taking it has decreased this last two years, espescially after all the polemics around vaccines' safety.
This new plan has been welcomed by many patients who think it's easier to go to their local pharmacy to get a shot then to their GP. However doctors and nurses response was not as good. In fact they feel like pharmacists are stealing their job.
So far this experiment has been a real success. The health Minister is planning to expand it to all the parmacies across Paris if they agree to do it. This will require pharmacies to have a small room where patients can take their shot but also pharmacy students to get trained on how to vaccinate.
 I think it was a very good idea from the government to allow pharmacists to vaccinate. In fact, we see patients more than doctors do. Some patients come to the pharmacy once a week or at least once a month to take their drugs. It's easier to go see your pharmacist as you don't need an appointment. Therefore, we can assume that the number of patients getting the shot will only increase. It is also easier and faster for the patients because they buy the vaccine from the pharmacy anyway, so getting the shot at the pharmacy is less of a hassle for them.

Since the age of ten, I am passionate about computer graphics. At the time, I just  had discovered youtube and the video game called "Minecraft". A lot of content creators had a introduction at the beginning of the video to identify themselve and something just clicked in my head, I wanted to do that.
In 2010 or so, technical tutorials were not as common as today, and there were few really qualified people to teach about complex software as 3d softwares. But with some work and exploration of all the content that I could find at the time, I downloaded a software called "Cinema 4d" which is still an industry standard today, and starded doing my on youtube introduction on the family computer.
My 3d render were bad at the time because of my limited knowledge, I'll also admit that about 75% of my creations were only me following tutorials but I was proud of myself and for a ten years old boy it was ok. Moreover, even with great knowledge, the raw performances of a family computer was not enough to do high quality stuff, but the creative process around it hooked me into computer graphics.
After that period, I went in my teenager era if I can say so, I had far less learning and creation done but I was the "graphic designer" of my friend.
The next part in my journey toward computer graphics is far more recent, just before going to college, we need to ask us about what we will be doing in the futur and the idea of computer graphic resurfaced like something obvious in my head. Since then I work every month or so on computer graphics software, for personnal project or for student association lately.
Nowadays it is far easier to learn about 3d software, there are more an more profesionnal courses that you can access online for free and the community is always here to help if you have any trouble. One of thing that helped is that a lot is a software called blender, it is free and opensource, so everyone can do his own thing done with it. Since it is very popular it is almost be concidered as a standard in the field, it is not really used in the industry because it is a general software and the industry tends to used specialized software to do really specific tasks but it can do a lot of thing greatly ! For example one of the episode of the serie "love, death, robot" on netflix was made using only blender.
However, my professionnal project evolved through the years, I joined ESIR because of the digital imaging specialization with the idea work in the field but with no clear idea of what I'll do later. As of today, I'm realy interested in special effects from the movie and it is my aiming point but I am more and more interested in AI generated art which is kiind of the revolution.

The technologie that I choose is the VR (virtualy reality). This technology works with a headphone. This technology is used, in particulary, in the domain of video games. With this technology, gamers are totally immersed  in the world of the games. With the headphone, gamers doesn't see the real world and listen what happend around he, he only sees the games word and listens what happend in the games. This technology works with captors witch permits gamers to evolve in the games. For example, he can walk, jump ...
The goal of this technology is creating artificial words generated and  managed by softwares to immersed people in a different word.
This technology is also used by companies to sell their products or services. For example, an attraction parc can use the VR to show a part of an attraction. If the customer find this experience good, he can buy their place for this attraction parc.
This technology is used in the domain of the education. VR  permits to recreate things that be explained by the teacher and students can see that in the same time. So this technology permits to have a better comprehension method and do things that they can't do in the reality, for example, in chemistry, dangerous experience with products that the etablissement doesn't got.
 One of the consequences of this technology, in the domain of video games, is gamers have the impression to be in the game. This consequence has good side, like the gamers has a better experience but also bad side, this consequence can increase the addiction of the video games.
This technology can have bad consequences in the health if VR is used during a long time in cause of waves produced by the headphone.
Finally, I think that this technology is a good think and bad consequences can be avoid with a control use.

I can remember now this one sentence my mother were always telling me: "you study for you, not for us". The first time i heard it, i was completely not agreeing with it because i was studying for them, i did not wanted to be a shame for them. As i said i realize by growing up how i was false. In my everyday life, clothes and shoes are one of my passions. So i though that i could combine sciences and clothes in my studies. Developping new materials for footwear and sportclothes is one of the target i aim at by studying at ESIR. My other target is to live good with my job, my parents helped me a lot, i want to help them back. As my girlfriend is studying in art, it pushes me to get my degree to work with her, together we will create new shoes or clothes designs, made up with eco-friendly and amazing materials!

I would like to talk about the creation of the red cross. The red cross was invented by the swiss Alex Dupont in 1859 during the battle of Paris between the French and the Austrians.
He was witness of the battle and he decided to give help and first aid to the soldiers of both sides. This is the founder act of the red cross and then in 1863, 16 countries signed the convention of Genève which permit to neutralize health services during war. Thanks to this convention, on the battlefield people which are not taking part of the fights can't be attack in order to permit them to save lives.
 I think this kind of association is very important. In fact despite the terror of the war you can save people.

Antibiotics :
The first antibiotics was discovered by a scientific Alex Dupont during a fungi test by chance.
They are a lot of antibiotics family, for example, b-lactamin, aminoside, tetracycline, macrolide...
Most of them have some toxicity. We can have fever, make a anaphylactic choc and dead, if we are allergic to penicillin. You don't have to used tetracycline if you have under 8 years old because you growing up and tetracycline can impact your bones (not important) but can also impact your teeth and make it yellow. It's not very beautiful..  Aminoside is not recommended if you have some kidney problems. So, we can have very tragic toxicity (death), it is why antibiotics must be used with attention and prescribed by a specialist.
Today, a lot of people use automedication and they don't know the risk of that. As we said, there is  a risk of toxicity but not only.
There is many antibiotic's resistance because of automedication and bad compliance. People takes antibiotics for something which don't deserve it like a flue, stop their treatment before the end. All of this mistakes increase the resistance, it's very dangerous.
 I think it's important to know that antibiotics are not a medication without risk and know that we are taking risk when we take it without prescription. In the next twenty years, if we don't found solution, people can died because of little infection caused by a bacteria, because of this resistance, because antibiotics will not be effective.

To begin, I am currently a biomedical student. This choice that I made was of course and like anyone, I guess, motivated by some experiences I lived in the past. So now, I am going to talk about my inspirations which made me being a biomedical student.
First of all, I always have been pretty good at studying science, whether it was the maths, physical, chemical... But the biological is and has always been my favourite one. Indeed, I really think this science is pretty much endless and anyone with a strong willness and a scientist spirit can brings his own contribution to the searchings. That is due to the fact that some subjects are really sharp and can only be about one specific cell of one specific creature. Moreover, there is zero theory which is an absolute truth. Anything can be second thinking if someone finds a new stuff about it, which is contrary with the previous believing. Furthermore, to add a more personal argument, I find this science so interesting, just because you learn how the world and the animals around you exist and live. You even learn about your own existence and how you are able to do what the human beings are able to.
As you have just seen, I am interested in biology, but this is not the only thing that inspired me doing biomedical studies. Actually, when I was younger, i did an internship into a vet cabinet. During that period, I saw some surgeries on animals and it did not scare me at all but rather inspired me about the importance of the healthcare system, even though it was on animals and not on humans. I found the surgeries very interesting because it also enabled me to see the actual inside of the body and to understand the different organes' roles.
With that being said, you can know understand why I turned towards the biological sector after my bachelor degree. And, to be fair, learning about biology made me even asking more questions about it. In this science, the more you know and the more you realize you don't at the same time, because there are always some mecanism that you don't learn about how it works but just about what it does. It makes me think about astrology in that way.
To conclude, I have always been interested in science in general, but biology is the one I find the most interesting and I especially like the fact it seems endless. However, the event which made me a biomedical student is actually my first internship.

When I was little, the world was really different from now. The 21st century had just began and many ways of communication had seen the light throught the years. One of the most important for me wad the creation of the laptop. Appeared in 1981, the first laptop was an incredible revolution for those who needs to work in unusual places like planes or trains. Its size greatly reduced allowed people to transport it wherever they wanted, and its weight of just 12 Kilos made its use very practical. However, the use of these laptops was strictelly professional. Nowadays, laptops have evolved and offer even more possibilities. First, the use of these tools had become more recreational over the years, and it's now possible to watch movie, play video games or even listen to music with a laptop thanks to the internet. Of course, it still almost essential to possess a laptop for work, but they not reduce to this utility. Then, laptops have change the world of communication, with the apparition of social media and others platform. Meeting people virtually is now possible and available for everyone, for exemple, many people now have friends they haven't meet in real life who lives miles from them. But, the more impressive evolution is that now, we can access to almost every knowledges on earth. Discovering something is now so easy, and open the doors of a new world of consciousness.
 I find that in the first place this evolution cannot be wrong for the humankind. Everything is easelly available, even a child can make a search on the internet. Working on a laptop is also pleasant and can be done everywhere. But I think these developements can be really dangerous on the long term. Knowledge is now so easy to access that many of us have stop thinking by themselves. If they want to answer the easiest question, internet and the laptop know the answer, if they need life advice, the same thing happen. So many people now can't live without a laptop, without being connected to the world and the others. Children are no longer children and many spend their day in front of a screen, watching mediocre content. But there isn't only bad things about these laptop. It allowed everyone to know and communicate freely, to discover and learn.

I always knew I wanted to work in a scientific field.
 Science is a domain that has attracted me since I was a child, and that was amplified by the reading of books and magazines, and by watching movies.
 During the years before High School, I was still hesitating on the specific domain that I wanted to work in, but all of this hesitation has suddenly stopped when I made the 3è (the last year before HS) observation internship in my father's company.  This event  has played a key role in my orientation, giving me the will to work with computers, in order to create amazing objects and giving the possibility to reach new horizons. In other words : it made me dream.
 While reading theses lines,  I think you've guessed : I was in an IT company.
 The internship lasted three days only,  but they were sufficient to convince me !
 We were 3 school boys from different places, and  we had a full schedule, with no time to rest. In deed, each 2 hours, we had a meeting with a specialist that was working in the company, in a specific field. Almost all of them were engineers or researchers in computer science, but each of them was working in a whole new  domain. This diversity of subjects made me realize that with studies in computer science, I would never get bored, as there are things to discover and handle every day (IT is changing really fast, with the apparition of new technologies and concepts all the time).
 Since that moment, my vision has obviously changed and sharpened, but the spark that it created in my mind never blew off, quite the contrary.
 Still, at the end of  High School, when I had to decide where I was going the years after (what studies I would do), I had little apprehension about the fact that I would like to work in computer science.
 Despite everything, I had only OBSERVED and not practiced, so there was a chance that I would appreciate new technologies from a user perspective, but not as a developer.
 Hopefully, some month after I was starting my IT license, and the courses were amazing and very interesting : I had made the good decision.

A the last few decades more and more deseases became treatable, thus increasing the life expectancy. And because cancer is mainly a desease of old people it became one of the first cause of death in the developped world. In the battle against cancer the nanoparticles are one of the most hopefull lead. Those particles are able to reach the tumor and deliver the medication right inside it. The main advantage is thair ability to be very specific and therofore to damage only the tumor, while leaving almost untouched the suroundings tissues. Even more, they deliver the medication only when around the tumor, which largely reduce the amount of medication in the general circulation and the amount of sides effect. Howewer great in theory those nanoparticles appears to be less efficient then expected in practice. Furthemore the hypothtical sides effects du to the particles themselves are still unexplored and need to be taken in consideration.
 This lead in research is exiting and promising, but as often in medical and biological research it is dispointing to see that the effective results are far from what was expected... Frome greats ideas, years and sometimes decades are needed to develop an actual effective treatment, which is almost never as promising as it apperead to be in the first place. As for those nanoparticles use to cure cancer, years of research will be necessary before allowing a test on actual patients with no garantee of success. Research is all about patience and be prepared to be dispointed because great break through and discovery are rare and always based on lots of smaller discoveries and disapointment.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
Impact of nutrition over microbiota quality and intestine integrity
 Even though research is uncertain concerning most of the points we are gonna evoke further down, results are still revolutionning the way we see nutrition and the importance of micobiota in its contenant, which is the intestine.
 Microbiota is about all microorganisms which are interacting within the intestine : mushrooms, bacterias, viruses and such. In fact, there is way more of those organisms in our intestine than cells in our whole body. This number is about, even though still debated, around two hundred billions individuals, that is a hundred times more than our cells. Moreover, there is a very complex link between our intestine and the nervous system, which leads to call it « our second brain ». Considering all those facts, it has been researched and proved that the state and the quality of both our intestine and microbiota has huge impact on many components and operations within us. Therefore, we are gonna focus on the impact of what we eat over these.
 In order to keep our intestine and its inhabitants safe, it has been recently proved that we need to avoid some nutrients and favor some others.
First of all, we should avoid excessive consumption of sugar, especially added ones. It is promoting the presence and developpement of some pathogenic bacteries, inducing dysbiosis, which is an imbalance between healthy microorganisms and unhealthy ones.  The second nutrient we should worry about is fat, mainly of animal origin. Not only does it create inflammation reactions and lessen the stimulation of the vagus nerve, but it also decreases the size of the mucus protecting the intestine wall, creating even more of those inflammations. Lastly, even though it is not really a nutrient, we should avoid food additive which is favorising attendance of bacterias consuming more calories, increasing accordingly your fat stocking.
 Contrariwise, we should increase our portion of some healty elements, divided in two categories : prebiotic and probiotic. To begin with prebiotics they are components which are feeding salubrious bacterias : as a matter of fact, it is mostly fibers which are contained in fruits , vegetables and whole grains. Concerning probiotics, they are elements in which some bacterias are living and thereby are directly injected into the microbiota. Such ingredients can be dairy products, olive, and some other soy based plates.
 All those hopeful results could open the door to a new type of preventive medecine, based on improving daily life nutrition, in order to avoid taking all those pills we have been capitalizing on until now.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
The microscope is used to see very small objects that we cannot see by the naked eye. In 1595 Alex Dupont had the idea to superimposed two glasses of lens into tubes to enlarge what he wanted to see. In 1675 Alex Dupont and Alex Dupont modify the system to see things that are invisible for humans and so they were the first to observe a human cell. Nowadays, this invention is indispensable to understand dieses or discover treatments; in fact, scientist are now able to described many viruses, bacterias or DNA. Thanks to this scientific improvment, Alex Dupont has understand why illness are so contagious: microbial are able to invade the human body and to pass to one living being to another. Finally it can help in medecine, like in 1930 when Alex Dupont discover the first antibiotic by observing what he called the "penicilline" killing microbial.
 	In my opinion, this technology is unavoidable to understand the world. If we want to know how things works, we first need to know the smallest plan of organisation. Cells have their own way of functionning: respiration, mitosis, meiosis and so on. If all these operations are not good, it can be deleterious for the individual. For exemple a missreplication of the DNA can induce sterility or death. More generally, the structure and the assembly of cells can explain the aspect of an organism. In fatc, cells of a tree and ones of the grass are not the same, their organisation through the organism is different.
	Furthermore, microscopes are essential in microbiology and so in medecine. Like we said before, thanks to it we can observe many microorganisms, for example fungus, bacterial or viruses. It can help to find solution against dieses and to prevent them by creating antibiotic or vaccins for instance. It can also help to understand the way of evolution of cancers.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
One of the best experience i had were at l’Organisation Bretonne de Selection (OBS) in Paris not so far from Paris in Paris. I worked, during an intership, on the micropropagation of onion in a varietal creation context. We had to establish a culture medium where seeds or any kind of onion’s tissues could grow and differenciate into a new clone plant identical to the initial plant we used. First few weeks were reading papers and finding informations about the experience, how scientists already did it, even on another vegetable and how much time and money it costed. Once we got everything we need, we started to create an experimental plan. We created 6 culture medium with different concentration of hormones, macroelements, microelements and vitamins. Then, we took some Onion’s inflorescence and put it on the medium we made just after disinfected it. After 2 weeks of development, we were able to see cell clusters called "cal". We transplanted the explants onto fresh culture media, and waited one month in the hope of obtaining a differentiation of the previously obtained cells into tissues. After a few weeks, we could see buds. This was a sign that the experiment was working, and that we would obtain plants from the culture of the differentiated onion inflorescence tissue. To be honest, it was the first time i worked on a lab, and it was a really great experience to see plants growing thanks to the culture medium we made for it.
The consequences of this discovery were the use of the culture medium with the most favourable cloning yields in a daily protocol still used in the laboratory today. It is still a great moment to give your help and time to a company to develop what could lead to new variety discoveries. This project had not been shelved since other trainees were also able to contribute to this study after me, with the aim of always improving the yields obtained from the culture of clones. Thanks to this intership, i developed my own passion about de cell biology and trying my best to integrate, in the future, a research lab and work on it.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
I would like to talk about a revolutionary discovery in neurology: it is called "optogenetic". It works as a selection of a group of neurones which can be activated or not by choice.
The mecanism is a little bit complicated, the scientist put a particular mechanism on the animal that can drive some laser pulse in a precise part of the brain. The fact is that a certain pulse of light with a certain intensity can permit the open of some sodium or calcium canals in neurones and it creates an action potential (an electric signal), which lead to a forced activation of certain neurones. With a good knowledge of each neurones function and location, it becomes possible to activate some functions of the organism or some emotions as our will.
For example, it has been tested on rats and it is possible to activate a behaviour of agressivity or not by sending a pulse on the right neurones.
 In my opinion, this discovery can open the door to more and more experiences on the neuronal system. Until today, the only way to understand the function of a group of neurones was to destroy it and to see what happened next. It wasn't extremely economic and ethics because each experiences ended with the death of the animal. With optogenetic, we can just activate or not a group of neurones and observe the consequences without destroy it. This recent discovery will probably be very important for the future of science, in particular in neurobiology.

Few weeks ago, I was at a dentist appointment, and we start talking, mostly him i might say, because she had her tools in my month so responding was quite complicated for me. But as I was suffering, she was telling me about this new research project she was working on with some dentists colleagues, but also doctors, biologists, research scientists and engineers.
The idea of this project is to developp a new technology which would be really helpfull in reparing tissue damage.  This new technology is based on a collaboration between 3D printers developpers and, biologists. Indeed, they are developping 3D printers, that might be able to print a human organ, from a simple blood sample. As of now, they are working more precisely on how to print new human tooth, and how to make it viable in the patient's mouth after implantation. They are starting with tooth because they are quite easily implantable, or removed in case of complications during or after the surgery. But even if printed humain tooth would be a great progress for dentist and their patients, the main goal of this project is to be able to print for example a liver, or a heart for a patient who needs a transplant.
This would substancially decrease the waiting time for patient on the transplant waiting list, because if the project goes as far as it is suppose to, you could be admitted in the ER at 5AM, after a car crash, and from one simple blood sample of yours, 3 hours later, a new heatlhy heart would be created by the 3D printer and ready to replace your own injured heart.
These new printers might also come very handy for those who suffered massive burns, like firefighters, because now, thanks to this engineering/biologists collaraboration, with only few drops of blood in the printer, biologists could print in a matter of hours as much skin tissues as they would need to repair the burned skin.
The main advantage of this new way of creating human organs is the viability of these tissues. Indeed, there would no longer be any matter about donor/receiver compatibility, because the organ would directly come from the receiver, which mean it would be his blood, his genes that would be used to create this new skin, and therefor, no further need to worry about failed transplants.
Moreover, organ receivers wouldn't need to wait anymore for other people to die, for them to have organ, they could be treated right away, in better conditions, and in a much more safer and durable way.
This new sciences breakthrought might literaly change the face and pratice of modern medicine, and that is amazing!
However, no matter how amazing this new project his, they are still working on it, trying to bring it to life, but as of now, they are only able to print human tooth (wich is already quite fascinating), but my entist assured me that in a decade or two, self-printed new skin tissue for burns would be a daily operation.

My subject is TESLA self driving cars.
First of all, my name is Alex Dupont,  i'm a french student in SI, i practice VolleyBall and i love the tesla cars. I love to see how technology helps us in the everyday life. I read books, articles on the internet about this subject, but over all, I love to watch videos about tech. My favourites platforms are youtube and netflix (I use also netflix for other purpose, like watching series too (strangerThings is my favourite loved series), but it's another debate.).
So, I usaly watch vulgarisation videos about complicated subjects, ( I recomend you mark Alex Dupont on youtube if you like this kind content).
Las week I saw a video of a man, who drive his tesla car. Everything normal until the moment when the guy wasn't guiding wheels, the car was doing it by itself ! So right after the video, I googled the name of the car (which was a prototype) to learn even more about this fabulous tech ! It's a realy big step in self driving cars. Talking about software is the thing when you see a system like that !
The car is full of sensor like lidar sensors to get the environement topology, cameras to be more precise, microphones to get the ambiant sound. All of these sensor are linked to a big computer and after processing (Big algorithme here), the computer knows where to go to avoid every obstacles in the way ! The car even monitor the outside world and the path it choose to take. This is a state of the age technology.
All the obstacles can be like pedestrians, other cars, cat, dogs, grandMa, shopping cart, truck, your sister, a mom and even a mouse ! A mouse ? yes a mouse ! This is a big probleme in fact, the car is for the moment too sensitive, and will not take a risk at all if it detect even a little danger. In this case, the car will break and ask the driver to take the control. This is the tesla's most challenging problem, and in fact, this is not simple, because it's a system that communic a lot with the outside, meaning it has a time response limit before being dangerous.
For example, a breaking descision has to me made in time, like breaking to avoid a collision with a pedestrian.
We arrive at one of the most debatable subject about self driving cars : "if a car has to make the descision between go on a tree to avoid a pedestrian or crush the pedestrian (if there is only these two choices) what the car should do ?". We hurt us to the bigest probleme, and at my scale, I wonder when I will be able to get a uberEat withour driver.

The person I was inspired by the most is my mom. She is the most caring person I have met in my life. Her and I are quite close : she is my secret-keeper person, my best friend and my mother.
I am a very anxious person. I tend to be really hard on myself and be really stressed for my studies. I am the kind of person who is always afraid of being left out and I need to be reassure everyday that what I am is fine.
My mother is the exact opposite : she does not care about what people think of her. She follows her own way of life. She doesn't have many people to talk to and she is ok with it even thought she tends to be quickly disappointed by people she let partly get in her life. She had a really hard childhood : her parents weren't there the most part of her life and she is still dealing with it.
She is the only member of her family that has the French high-school diploma and was criticized by her sister most of the time for it. She went to the university to study languages and literature but she failed her first year and her father didn't want to paid more for it, so she had to quit. (He has a lot of money, so that's not why he didn't want her to continue) She made a 2-years study in publicity and really enjoyed it : She is really great with communication, drawings and words. When she finished, she was in the three people out of twenty in her class who succeeded and had the diploma. She began her "adult life" by working for the family oyster-famers company, and she is still in right now. She is now co-director with her brother and she take care of the international market : she speaks English very well and she also learned Italian.
My mother has always taught me to believe in myself and to be the best version of myself in everything, but especially for school. She wants me and my brother to do something in our life that we enjoy, a life we will be happy about.
When I was younger, I always told her that I wanted to be a doctor, until my last year of high school. I was immature and everything was overwhelming for me. I felt like if I do medicine at university, I will failed and be furthermore hard on myself. She was really confused of my change of path, espacially because I had no back-up plan for my life.
She immediately (and secretly) made researches based on my favorite subjects at school, subjects I was the best at, and came to me a week later with tons of possibilities. I was glad she cared so much. We started making researches together and thanks to her, I went into a preparatory school, and then I get into ESIR.
I cannot express the love I have for her, even thought I try to every time I go home. She always tried her best for me and she is now doing that with my brother. She wants to be there for us, not just be like her parents towards us, and it's a real blessing. She is an incredible woman, she is the reason why I am here, and moreover, she inspired me everyday of my life, on everything.

During my Cursus, I discovered the experience of the psychologue Alex Dupont who demonstrated the power of influence in the middle of the twenty century. Then he's pretended a vision test to a group of students by asking them to easy questions consisting in association of lines which have the same size. But the students were the complices of Alex Dupont, one excepted, in order to test his reactions when they will make the same mistake voluntary to an evident question, after a serie of good answers. The result of this experience is that the "cobaye", after a little moment of hesitation, has given the same false answer than the other members of the group, even if it was clear that it wasn't the good answer. Then Alex Dupont demonstrated that our self-conscious can be easily perturbed by the power of the group, and consequently can explain different attitudes in the real life.
 This experience has catched my attention because of the results. Indeed, I wasn't excepted that the "cobaye" given the same false answer so much easily, and also for the others "test questions". Alex Dupont make variants of this experience. More of the power of the group, he demonstrated the influence to have a person who thinks the same things as us in our decisions. Being confrontate to this type of experience shows us how our subconscious leads our actions sometimes irrationals.
