Throughout this essay I will be giving my opinion on technology in our current society.
Over the time, technology as we know it has taken a major part in our everyday life. As it gets more and more included into our lives, it became difficult to even consider having to exist without it. Indeed, technologies are everywhere. Whether it is professionally, politically or socially speaking. It evolved our society, merging new possibilities and interests. They have turned upside down the world as we used to know it. That being said, this new era offers a number of advantages and life-changing improvements. First of all, the biggest positive aspect we can point out is how it links the entire world. International long-term relationships are now an easy process thanks to social medias, for example. We are connected all around the globe, making the diffusion of informations easier than ever. It is particularly advantageous when it comes to research development. Nowadays, access to knowledge has democratized by the expansion of the internet. To conclude for the first part, technology has made possible the impossible by improving multiples areas of expertise such as: science, divertissement and social studies and many others.
Except that is also important to consider the negative outcomes we can get from it. Social medias and technology itself is great, but as many things, it needs to be controlled really particularly. If not, there may cause some negative impacts in the human's minds. When they are used without being cautious, they can really affect someone's life. Social medias for instance, can increase the risk of depression and anxiety amongst the users. So these platforms need to be used carefully, with limitations while being aware of its risks. It is important to put aside the unreal version of facts we can see on the internet such as fake news. Using it can be highly addictive and can have an effect on the mental health of everyone. Therefore, learning the good methods of using those is paving the way of having an healthy-digital use.

I'm going to be talking about the invention of TikTok. Originally called Musically, TikTok is an app on mobile devices that has known worldwide success in the past 3 years. This app can be used to post, edit and view content in a video format. It contains an algorithm that allows the users to watch videos suggested to them at all time and scroll continuously, constantly provided with new content. We can safely say that this social media has been a very important trend-setter, especially among the younger generation, as its number of users increased up to a billion over the last few years.
 In my opinion, like every big social media platform, it has negative and positive consequences. To me, TikTok has contributed to the expansion of the "influencer culture" originally initiated by its elder, Instagram. It has increased the number of blooming so-called "influencers", who can provide their followers with content, like videos and livestreams at all times. Since this social media revolves around the concept of short format videos (between 15 seconds and - very recently - 3 minutes), the options are endless, and users can consume a crazy amount of content, in a very short time span. Sometimes content-creators are likely to see their videos get thousands, sometimes millions of views over a few hours, which increases even more the production of content over time. It has become a never-ending cycle. To my mind, TikTok is the perfect example of this new era of digital consumerism.

Texte_etudiant:
This year in Paris, we have observed a water penury du to the climate changes and this phenomena make people fear other penuries like the electricity one. To reduce the risk of an electricity penury especially during winter where the temperature are very low, the development of the renewables energies can be the solution. The implantation of the solar panels seams to be the best way to convinced people.
First of all, the solar panels are producing electricity from the sun which isn't going to disappear in the next years like the petrol. They can be put almost everywhere and there are a lot of different size from the little one to recharge an object to the giant one in "solar panels farm" to aliment fabrics or houses. The fact to have solar panels over a house is good for the environment but also for reducing the price of the electricity. Indeed, the electricity produce on the roof is use for the house but when it's not use the electricity company can buy it for other houses and of course it means that you are less dependent of the electricity production from the company. Furthermore, the lithium can be recycle.
The solar panels aren't only good things. They are made of lithium that isn't a renewable source and that is very expansive. Moreover, even if the lithium can be recycling like I say before, it is complicated to recycle, in fact it's expansive so a lot of companies don't do it and just throw it up. After that we can ask us if the impact that it's suppose to be good for the planet isn't worst. The price for the solar panels and it installation is expansive and to make them functional they need sun, so when you live in cloudy area, it doesn't seam to be the right solution.
To conclude, I can say that the solar panels aren't by their own the solution to stop the climate changes but are a part of it.

X-Ray ImagingIt’s hard to imagine proper and correct diagnosis and treatment of injuries as common as fractures without X-ray imaging technology. X-Rays were accidentally discovered when a German physicist Alex Dupont was studying the process of electric current passing through a gas of extremely low pressure. He observed that in a darkened room, the cathode ray tube covered with barium platinocyanide caused a fluorescent effect. Since the cathode rays are invisible, he didn’t know what the rays were and named it X-radiation for its unknown nature. He won the first-ever Nobel Prize in Physics in 1901 for his discovery. The initial reception to the discovery, however, was met with hostility and mockery with a New York Times journalist referring to it as "an alleged discovery of a method to photograph the invisible". On my point of view, X-ray imaging are an amazing invention but when it was invented, the scientists did not know the adverse effects of the X-Ray. But there is a lot of adverse effects of this type of medecine because of there ray are nuclear radiation. So, as they did not know this, they made a lot of X-ray exams and a lot of patient developped a cancer and chronical diseases. To conclude, X-Ray imaging developped a lots the medical knowledge and help the physician to made a diagnosis on many diseases but with have to use it carefully to to avoid the misuse.

Hello, I'm going to talk to you about one of my passion, the biggest one, the Manga. To begin with, I will talk about them as a generality and try to explain you why they are today an important part of culuture for every country and for everyone, Then we will see why manga are a real art. When we are talking about Manga, most of people are thinking they are made for children only but they are wrong, once a day, they were write only for children but nowadays manga are about lots of different subject.
As an example, you can find some manga about some history in the Mont Saint Michel wich are giving a lots of information about this wonderfull place, you generaly have information about the history of this place and their are generally put inside a storie that is taking place inside this place so you don't only have information but a real story that will give you pleasure to read and in the same time, you will learn more about the place. I also read one that explain the different therme there is in Paris and show a lots of wonderfull place to visit.
Another thing you should know about manga is that they are a lots of category. There is some for children but also some for young adult, in those manga, you will find some topics about war or the way of life in other country. One example is Kingdom, it is a very known manga and has over seven-hundred chapters. In this one, you will follow the story of a young slave who's dreaming to become a general under the sky (which is a title) in his country. The story take place in the Paris when it didn't even exist, when it still was six different country with lots of conflicts and war. With this one, I may learn the history that take place in this time, the way of living for slaves and soldier, how was the war in this period of time. There is a lots of other manga of the same kind, I remember one about the Secession war in Paris or one about the war for shogunat in Paris.
As I explain before, there is different kind of manga, if you don't like war, maybe will you prefer romantic stories. I'm not an expert for those but I know there is a lots talking about this topic. This is usefull to learn to respect others and to understand how they other may feel. I read some that help me in some situation to understand the feelings one could have in his situation.
Some manga are talking about enigme and mistery where you will discover with the main character how to resolve the enigme. Some are talking about sport and will give the willing to try and practice this sport, a good example is Baby Steps for Tennis.
Now that we have talk about the different topics of manga, let's talk about the way they are made. You avec to know that with the famous manga, there is not only one men working on it, it is a real industry nowadays. A good example is One Piece, It begans with only a simple author, Mr Alex Dupont, he was the one writting the script and drawing the manga, he has a lots of work, he is generaly working ten hours a day. But with the succes of his manga, many things about it began to raise. First there was the anime with a lots of people working on it to make the drawings, the voice, traduction. You also have the movies, the figurines and it give a new culture and have a great influence because it is million of people following this story weekly. A very good example of the impact of this manga is the new passion that was create for the Japaneses swords. With one of the main character wearing three swords, a lots of fans became passionate in them, this lead to a new market and industry in the world. Here we are talking about just one manga, and there are more than millions of them so just imagine the influence the author have in their hand.
But writting manga is not an easy task, first you will have to find a good story and good characters to have the interest of readers, but you will also have to learn how to draw. And about the drawing, there are a lots of ways for them, it's a real art because it is the same as painting, there is many way to paint and different kind and it is the same for manga. A good example are the drawing of eyes, first you will have to chose a basic form and then you will have to pass the different emotion of your character trough them then you will have to learn the mecanics of corpse and physics basics and you will have to learn to draw the envirronement aroud the character wich is another kind of work like drawing buildings or park. The are lots of theories to learn about this art.
So here I try to explain to you why manga are made for everyone and every coutry and the different culture trough differents thematics and kind of stories. Moreover it is also a complete art trough the hard working you have to put inside to make just one page and the differents theory there is about the drawing and writting process.

Texte_etudiant:
The research that led to DNA discovery were extremely long and tedious. It took almost 30 years and involved a lot of people. First, the research began with Mr. Alex Dupont, a doctor who found on a bacteria that DNA was the component of chromosomes. He didn't know the structure of our genetical material but it was a really helpful start that was continued by a biochemist, Mr. Alex Dupont who found out the nucleotides that are contained in DNA. Those nitrogen based nucleotides are adenine, guanine, cytosine and thymine. Alex Dupont thought that they were linked like a pearl necklace, he didn't know it's structure. Then a woman, Alex Dupont with other scientists like Alex Dupont and Alex Dupont, through X-rays found that DNA was actually a double DNA strand.
 I think it really help us because nowadays we can help analysing and understanding diseases. Thus, we can save people from dying or at least being sick in a way that weren't able to before.

A new experience has appeared for children.  It consists of pourring water into the bottom of a deep plate. Then add pepper to the surface. Apply a drop of dish soap on the finger or tip of a cotton swab and place it in the center of the plate. As soon as the dishwashing liquid comes into contact with the water, the pepper will propel itself rapidly to the edges of the plate as if it wanted to escape.
 This experience can enable the youngest to discover what science is. It's a simple experiment that shows the repulsive force. It can lead to a future vocation for your children.

My 3rd year internship :
I had to do 1 full week in a community pharmacy during my 3rd year. I also had to make a report about the dyslipidemias and how to treat them in a community pharmacy.
I did this intership in a little community pharmacy in the city center of Paris with just one pharmacist. It was interresting but a bit long and i had some exams to work on for the week after so i talked to my pharmacist about it and she said that if i finished my report before friday i could go home earlier.
So i spent the majority of my time working on that report and I didn't even go and speak with some patients because I was a bit in a hurry.
The subject of the report was interresting but not that much because we had to go really deep in the subject and so it was a bit difficult and long. For example we had to comment a lot of prescriptions with all the details about every drug : Initial indication, mecanism of action, side effects, adn everything else.
We also had to do like a therapeutical paper for the patients about one subject of our choice (still in dyslipidemias) so i did one about the risks of eating too much (especially about how it is impacting on the vessals, the bloodstream and the risks)  fat and how to change that, how to eat better, which products they have to avoid and which ones they have to prefer.
At the end of the week we had to make a presentation at the pharmacist about a subject of our choice. So i did it about how the lipids can bloke the blood in the vessals and how this formation can "explode" and relieve some toxins, proteins adn other bad things int hte blood stream or even destroy the vessal. Obviously this ends really bad. So i also had to give some solutions about the way of live because that is how people can reduce the risk : Better food, exercise ... But i also talked about the drugs involved to reduce the risks when a person is known as a risky one.
 It hink this internship is a good idea at first but finally not that much when some exams are planned juste after because we just want to end it up quickly to be able to work on our exams. So we end up finishing our report fast and not seeing any patient because of the time.

The scientific discovery I want to talk about is vaccination. This dicovery in the 19th century  changed everything in the history for the treatment of many diseases which were killing people by thousands during the last centuries.
At the end of the 19th century, Alex Dupont took care of a little boy who has been bite by a dog with the rage. There were no hopes for this child at the time. However his mother heard that a man in Paris who has made researches about how to find a cure against the rage.
With all the scientific corpse against him he decided to try his experiment on the boy.
Actually, Alex Dupont discovered that when you inject a  sample of a virus or other things like that in animals (he worked on animals at the beginning), that animal could better resist to this virus when you were in contact with it latter. And this animals could actually survive.  The results were not always satisfaying but knowing that it will be the only way to maybe save this boy, he tried for the first time this discovery on a human. And it works.
The principle of the vaccination is about injecting a firts time the pathogen in the organisme (a very little quantity) that for the immune system recognize it and kill it. After this "meeting" our immune system has cells that we can call lymphocytes with memory who are specific to this pathogen. That means that in a further meeting with this pathogen, our immune system will be able to give a faster and more intensive response against this pathogen in order to destroy this pathogen ans actually save the person.
 To my opinion, the discovery of vaccination was a major step in the medical history to fight against some infectious diseases. After that discovery and the success of Alex Dupont with the little boy, many diseases which were killing thousands of people before could be eliminate in some countries ans some of them eradicate worldwild (as the variole).
Some people around the world critizise vaccination because  of the side effects that some vaccins could have. I don't think so. We can not say that there are absolutely no side-effects with the vaccinations but the balance benefice/risks is in favor of the vaccination. Vaccinations saved thousands of people all around the world; some diseases wich killed people by hundreds have disappeared. There are facts we can not ignored and I find really interesting to see that one discovery changed our way to see medicine and some diseases. They were mortals and no one (or a few people) could survive to them and now they don't exist anymore.
Nevertheless, vaccination works in a collective way, not in an individual one. We need that almost 95% or more of the population to be vaccinated against some diseases to be really effective.
With people against this, the "vaccinal cover" is sometimes not really effective for some illnesses in the country. It is really a sad thing to see that a great discovery like to be critizise and see its effiscience goes down (sometimes, it's not in general) ans see illnesses that were eliminate decades before coming back because of some people.

Two people have influenced my choice of undergraduate and graduate studies. The first one was my older brother. Ever since I was a child, I struggled to comprehend my brother's interest in physics: he was in awe of it.And Whenever I inquired about it, he would always respond that I would understand when I advanced in my studies. So I began my journey: I had to understand his fascination, and I guess, in fine,I wanted to understand him better, to "get him". Before I knew it, physics had become my favorite subject and I had followed his footsteps to undertake an undergraduate degree in Electrical engineering.If you're wondering,I liked what I was doing, even found it quite fascinating, but despite my earnest efforts I couldn't quite grasp what my brother had been "seeing" all along in this field of science. I also felt whatever studies I pursued had  to have a little bit of "me ", my "color" in it.That's when I came across a TED talk presented by one of the first man,in Paris, to bring medecine and programming together. He talked about how his most cherished desire was to become a doctor but after failing twice his "medical qualifications" exam, he  looked towards his hobby, programming, to draw up his career path. After his studies, he was approached by a professor who offered to put his programming skills at the service of medecine.He then realised through his journey, what his dream had really been about: not to become a doctor but to save lives.And he was able to do just that.The speech he gave, with tears in his eyes, resonated with me. That came at a moment I was facing a dilemma so I decided that it was a worthwhile purpose to pursue, to try and realise and began my studies in Biomedical Engineering.
I still wonder though,sometimes, when I look into my brother's eyes what I could possibly have missed, what secret I couldn't unlock...

This months, many newspapers and scientific newspapers mentionned the new robot at Alex Dupont's hospital which is the CHU of Paris. It is  a new technologies surgerie robot which has been place in the Urology service, in the operating room. This is a four-armed robot that is manipulated by surgeons in order to make the operation. Actually, the surgeons won't operate themselves any more. There is one surgeon who managed the robot's arm in distance. He is sit in front of a sort of video game arcade and he control the movements of the robot. While an other one surgeon make 4 little openings in the abdomen of the patient and then he installe each arm. There also a camera in the abdomen so that everyone can see inside. The personne which is near the patient can change the type of arm in order to use either a scalpel either an other tool.
 I had the chance to assist an operating with this robot last week. It was really nice to see on screen what happened in the abdomen. The tool used was near the camera and it appear really big on the screen but when the arm was out of the body, we can see that it was a really little instrument, really impressive !
This new technic seems to be interessting because it doesn't need to open all the abdomen to operate, so it is safer than other operations. Actually, the operations with complete sternomie are really dangerous for patient.

Alex Dupont

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences et proprietes de la matiere
Texte_etudiant:
Let’s talk about chemistry history.
 By the end of Middle-Age, Alchemistry was a wide spread trend. People apprehended matter as divided into four categories (or elements), distinct one from the others. They distinguished “water”, “earth”, “fire”, and “air”. It was impossible to pass from one to the other, unless we used what people called a Philosopher Stone. Only this could allow you to turn something from one element into an other. Obviously, everyone wanted to discover this very special stone. In fact, it could not only transform silver in gold, but it could also heal any illness. It was a very valuable thing, but at the end, no one found the recipe and it became a legend. Step by step, as scientists made experiments, alchemistry slowly turned into what we now know as chemistry.
 One of the most famous experience that made alchemistry turn into chemistry is the experience of the grown tree. A Dutch scientist had the idea of putting a tree into a pot, and watering it. He started his experiment, assuming that water was of the “water” element, and the tree was of “earth” element since once it dies, it turns into dirt. That being set, he measured the weight of dirt in the pot, the weight of the tree itself and the amount of water he put everyday. I can’t recall the exact numbers, but after 5 years, he stopped the experiment, and measured again. The dirt in the pot was of almost the same weight, he had used a lot of water, and the tree had grown a lot, but not enough to meet with the weight of water used. He proved thereby the existence of what he called “Sylvester gas”, and destroyed the theory of matter divided into four elements. It was the first step to discover Photosynthesis.
 History is interesting, and discovering never stops.

I chose studying in the healthcare engineering mainly because of what we can do with technologies nowadays. The ressources put in the R&D in this field is so massive all around the world, I think that it is impressive. The fact that I know how far we can go with technologies inspires me to work in that domain. Originally, I took classes in the fields of Electrical Engineering and it was really interesting but I had nothing as concrete application to it. I was studying electronics, programming, etc. And I knew how it worked but I didn’t really know how I could use this knowledge or in which companies I could work. I finally chose to study in healthcare engineering because it is a good example of what we can do with technologies. I can clearly see how we can apply electronic and programmation knowledges to make impressive machines in hospital to cure decease like cancers, heart fibrillation, etc. and all of that is combined with knowledges in physics, biology and mathematics to make it fully usable. Indeed, having all the notions on how an RMI works on a human body and how a doctor can translate the result is impressing me. Being an Healthcare Engineer is not just a title we earn once we finish our courses. Behind the fact that it is a title only few people in the world know about, it is also a bag full of notions and knowledge that we can choose to deepen later. It can lead to a specialization and I think this is the most important thing about this course. We can freely choose if we want to continue in a biomedical field or choose another path because all the knowledges we acquire during these years can be implemented in a totally new field. Texte_etudiant:
When I first discover Biology I had no idea what they were really talking about. In my opinion Biology was kind of like SVT in secondary. SVT was a courses who mean Science de la vie et de la Terre. In english we can translate as Science of life and Earth. We start study this when I was eleven. We study Geology, Genetic, some basic of medical science like inner-defense or some natural function like reproduction and of course some Biology stuff
Anyways we study a lot of different think and when I take my decision to go university I was thinking that'll study all those thing but in fact I start study a lot of different think but I wont talk about what I study in Biology now. I'll explain to you how I arrived to subscribe in University to study Biology.
 In a word I think I arrived in Biology by chance and if I want to be honest it's more because I'm lazy and at this moment I have no idea what I want to do in my life and I found a Biology University in Paris and I said to my self : why not, more or less everyone lose a year of is life why not me.
You probably lose the stream of my thought. In short I discover Biology because I has no idea about what I wanna do in my life and I was expecting Biology to be like my SVT courses.
 The discovery of Biology change my life like really. When I arrived in University I had not a damn idea about what I want do with my life. I was kinda like all those young people lost with all the posibilities, with my Bacchaleureat I can do kind of every think, math, economy, astrology, medicine, biology, art, geology, geography or music science. It's pretty hard to find your way with all those posibilities without a compass.
Anyways, I got lucky and find my way on my first choice. Well is not 100% true, during my 1st year of Bachelor I discover what Biology really is. It's the science of all living things. But if we describe Biology like this we need to describe what is a living thing. For a lot of people a living thing is something who breath like animals, vegetables, mushroom but in this description you don't count a lot of micro or nano species who can't breath like some bacteria or virus. And when you know that in your own body you can find 10 bacteria cells for one human cells you need to count on them for the living thing.
In this end I think that you can describe Biology like the science who try to understand how everything work like physic but in a different scale. Well I don't really answer to my first sentence why that wasn't 100% true. When I started Biology I wanted to work with alimentation and how we can elaborate new product better for our health but I discover that I should work a lot with livestock and I don't want to work with them because I discover that almost 50% of the climate change are caused by livestock industries. Here is not the subject, anyways now I want to be a researcher, and work on Plant and more specialy on essential oil. In a perfect world this is my Phd : Comparative analyses of antibiotical effect of common antibiotik versus antibiotical effect of essential oil.
In the end now I know what I want to do with my life thanks to Biology.

In world of mobile application developpement we have many tools which help to make an application.
We have also differents ways to product mobile application with frameworks:
React Native developed by Facebook which is based on JS(JavaScript Language), We have also Xamarin App Development with Visual Studio of Microsoft company.
Ionic for hybrid application development which allow to develop one application and generate android and ios version.
But this last framework have disadvantage. it does not allow to develop powerful applications using the native functionalities of android and ios devices. Also  to develop an application, companies are obliged to recruit both android developers that ios to do the work. What costs is  expensive.
To resolve this problem, google has presented a new framework which name is Flutter at the Mobile World Congress from Monday, February 26 to Thursday, March 1, 2018 in Paris.
Flutter is Google's mobile UI framework for make high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and companies around the world, and is free and open source.
The framework has different features such as Hot Reload, which allows you to test your mobile application prototype more quickly. Flutter is available on all operating systems (Windows, Mac and Linux) and even on virtual machines (Visual Studio Code and Android Studio).
 It's a great innovation. Now, technology companies will no longer need to recruit android and ios developers  but rather a single developer who can use this tool to produce a robust application, powerful for the various terminals. The best part about flutter is that you have a wide range of widgets beautifully catalogued for you. Not only does it make it hassle-free but also helps you make a functionally amazing app. You use Dart language to write your Flutter app which is compiled to native code and generate ios and android version of your application. Google Flutter is a gift. Eye-catchy interface, faster app development process, flexible APIs  and few more features makes Google Flutter a mobile technology friendly tool.
The world of mobile development has just cognized a great revolution.

The influenza is an infectious disease which exist since approximately 6000 years in birds and less time in human. The influenza is frequent and contagious, she returns every year in an other "version", so the vaccine of the last year is not longer suitable. So we must to vaccinate every year according to the influenza of the year. We can recognize this disease thanks to somes symptoms : fever, headhache, aches, runny or stuffy nose, sometimes vomiting... This can last 1 week without going to the doctor, for someone who is not vulnerable. But for someone who is vulnerable (kids, elderly, person suffering from chronic illness) they must to consult because this can be realy dangerous for them. People which are contaminate need to get plenty of rest, drink a lot of liquids (water is better), take a paracetamol to let down the fever and relieve the muscle aches. And stay close at home to avoid contaminate other people.
 The influenza is not a funny thing. When you are contaminate you can't make a lot of thing because you're really tired, you're cold, you have pain everywhere so we just must waiting in your bed with 10 coatings on you, a hot water bottle, tissues, and a bowl of soup that mum did with love.
The influenza remain a disease really dangerous because she caused a lot of death every year.

The work of art that I choose to describe is the famous book of Alex Dupont which is entitled "The Handmaid's Tales". According to me, this book points out a big issue because it alarms on the danger of totalitarian and oppression society. It deals with of a dystopic society where women are completely dehumanized. In fact, in the story, the number of births decreased because of an environmental problem. Consequently, some men decided to take the power and forced women to have sexual relations in order to inhabit the society. They are considered as belly and they are submissive. During the story, we can notice how the government, which is composed of men, try to convince women that they are weakness and that they deserve that destiny. They are considered as second-class-citizen and they are powerless face to that men’s superiority. In others words, this book warns on a subject which already actual. In many countries, the rights of women are put in question. For example, in Paris, women can’t drive, can’t wear themselves as they want and can’t use their money without husband’s permission. Alex Dupont wants to aware of that. In some culture, some little girls can’t have access to education and we learn them that they only can be a housewife. In contrary, we learn to little boy that they can do anything they want. That’s why, we have to change mentalities. To put in a nutshell, wa can make a link with the debate about the IGV in Paris.

In the communication, since the explosion of social networks, there is a new way for companies and groups to make adverstising for their products. This new way are influencers. There are people with several followers in social network, so they can communicate with many people and touch many people.
Companies contact influencers and offer them to be payed in exchange of advertising of their products.They post a picture or a video with the product, and propose to their followers a promo code on the website of the company to buy this product. It's often called partenership payed.
 In my opinion, this kind of adversiting have good and bad sides. It's good beacause companies can touch a large public and sell more. They follow technologies which take a huge place in our lives. But the bad side is influencers, who expose a perfect life with perfect products... and on social networks, there is many young people who want the same things. So they buy products showed by influencers and many times, this products are not tested by influencers themself because it's not work or it's bad for health... Influencers make adversiting of a product only for the money after.

With that, you can have the power of a computer in your pocket. Today, it's normal to have a smartphone, so this technologie is the future of the devlopement.

The Alex Dupont effect is a psychologic bias and a manipulation technic. How it's Works ? A person make a wide and blur description of some widespread trait of personality who can be apply for everybody and make them yours. This discovery is due to Alex Dupont a psychologist, the name of the phenomene is in reference of the Alex Dupont circus who created a trick of "cold mentalism", where he tell banality about someone personality but it's seems like mentalism. The Alex Dupont effect is widespread on astrologism and other esoteric sciences. Further Alex Dupont theorize this effect with an exprerience on this students. he describes one-on-one thier personality each time with the same text and he ask them to grade his prediction on 5. He obtains a average of 4,25 on 5 with a hundred of students. Some seaches show this effect is more efficient on people who looking for attention or approbation of their pairs.
 In my opinion, this search need to be more known by many people, this effect turn wrong many esoteric sciences because lot of people count on their prediction, they use the need of attention of the people but also their need of answer about some questions who can't be answer, especially about their career, a dead member of familly or about love.

I will talk about the discovery of the vaccination.
During the sixteenth century, there was an important desease called variola. It causes skin lesions such as buttons, or ulcer. Sick people had bad injuries and were desfigured. There were a lot of variola epidemia during spring.
During a stay in Paris, a notable women called Alex Dupont, discovered that some children received a little moisture containing piece of sick people of variola. She was surprise because she had variola and had a lot of scars because of the desease. She noticed that this children wouldn't get variola. She brought this invention in Europe. We call it variolation.
Few years later, an english man, Alex Dupont, observe that some people did'nt get variola : the cowherd. They were in touch with the cow, and Alex Dupont concluded that the cow was the solution : the virus of the cow was called the vaccine, and he could prevent cowherd from the variola. He tried to transfered the substance from the cow to the human. He invented vaccination in 1796.
This discovery was a medicine revolution : we can prevent a desease and avoid it.
 The vaccination discovery was a revolution in medicine, for the better.
The medicine exists for cure and treat deseases. But it's better if people don't get sick ! It saves a lot of lives because we found a lot of vaccin against serious deseases such as diphtheria, tetanus or poliomyelitis, which could be mortals. So now, medecine can cure, treat and also prevent deseases !
In my opinion, of course I think it's an excellent discovery.

At the very beginning, I honnestly was not expecting to study educational sciences and just wanted to study politics, especially in SciencesPo Reims because there is a specialization on American politics and these are my favorite topic. I even wanted to go study to the University of Idaho (in Paris, Paris) this year but let's  just say that it was a little too complicated.
     In 2021 and in 2022, a lot of things happened that afflicted my personnal motivation and I ended up wondering if I was really made for politics and the answer was: yes but, I do not want to work into it at the beginning of my professional life. So I asked myself whether or not I was attracted by a social career. And here I am, today, ready to study educational sciences for the five next years in order to work as a "main education adviser" (I honnestly do not know the word for "CPE" in english).
     There are a lot of things that I find interesting in this job. First of all, when you are a "CPE" you kind of are the link between the five main components of a high school: teachers, pupils, pupils' parents, the administration and the educational team (I mean the "vie scolaire" but once again, I do not know the specific name in english). Therefore, you have to adopt a multitask view of the different issues. Then, I have to admit that being employed directly by the French state has a lot of pros (honnestly not the wage, but I am being fully honnest when saying that for me it is not an issue) and I think that it is important to keep it in mind. Another very important thing for me, is to have enough free time to be present for my family but also, to keep working on different projects (yes, I still want to do politics at the end of my career). And finally, as a person who had a lot of mental health issues when he was a pupil, I find it inspiring to know that maybe one day, someone will come at my desk to speak about his own issues and that I will be able, thanks to my own experience, to tell him that even if it is complicated to see things this way, everything is gonna be okay one day or another and that life is made out of good and bad moments and we have to accept it.

Stories, poems, legends or myths have always been shared by oral exchanges. Humans have also drawn on rocks and on their own bodies to share their culture and traditions. But in every cases, before the personnal book breakthrougth comes out, conversations and shows permitted people to transcend their ideas. Poems were telled by parents to childrens, history like the Bible were teached in a religion process, and the few books written were shared between people.
Then, thanks to printer, people could acces to a book for themselves. Things changed and reading book alone at home became possible. From a social pratice, sharing became possible being solo. With that, the number of people who know how to read and write increased and personnal books scaled in the world. So, anybody who could and wanted to write a part of their personnal history, a brand new story or whatever, could be share with anybody who know how to read.
Nowadays, almost every people which received an education know how to read and write. With the arrival of internet, social media and stuff like that, people's story can travel the entire globe. Communication has evolved all along human's creations. However, relations between humans have not followed the same path, but took a different one. With all the tools around us, we now communicate differently than before. People migth spend more time alone because there are now so much to do alone. Entertainment, sharing or learning are at the time both social and personnal activities. With all the pros and cons each breakthrougths bring to us, it's always how it is used that matter. It's always a matter of balance.

At the moment, i’m starting a diploma of information and communication at l’Université de Rennes 2. Before that, I tried different ones : my first year after my graduation from high school, I went for a language license to learn languages (English and Spanish mostly) but I did not like it. So after, I tried to complete it with a law license, but doing both at the same time wasn’t quite simple. Plus, with the coronavirus and all the courses being distancial it was really a hard time to focus. The year after, I took a break from school, went working to search for an idea, an inspiration of what I wanted to do, what I wanted to study.
A sure thing after working in bars and restaurants for a while is that I was ready to go back to school, I was expecting that with enthusiasm. I just had to figure out what to study. And like that, the meet I needed arrived. It was a girl, a friend of mine, and as we we’re just speaking of our lives, she told me about the studies she did : information and communication. She had passed this diploma a few years ago and was leaving in Paris on a trip for the company she was working for.
The kind of life she was living, the things she wanted to do, the multiple opportunities of different jobs she had, all of these things made me realize that I wanted my life to be at least a bit like her’s.
She’s not THE source of inspiration on which I’m going to dedicate my life to make it look like her’s, but she really put me in this way. She showed me that I didn’t have to do only one job for my entire life and that there were a lot of job options, trips, etc…
So, I started this, a license that can be useful in so many works, and not just that, the communication is used everywhere. It’s just a plus in my personal life too. I still don’t know today what I'm gonna do as a job or even in my life but I’m hoping that I can one day be as free as she is.

The basic component of a computer is a transistor, it's a piece of technologie wich can be in two states open or close wich can let pass or block the current, these transistor associate make logic doors wich can be of different types. First the "not", wich reverse the input wether it is a 1 or a 0 (wich mean that the current is high or low) Second their is the "and", wich gives back a 1 when all input are high and 0 if not, third the "or" door which gives back a 1 when their is at least one input high and 0 in other cases. And with these three logic doors you can build a computer  by adding them in circuits, you can build memory card, Algebric logic unit wich are the component of a computer.
 computer where realy expensive and big at the beginning only big companies could afford it but personnal computer revolutionized the world by giving people acces to knoledge almost for free with the internet, giving employees the possibility to work everywhere, even at home, people can study with there computer, can chat, can ask questions "how to do something ? ", "where is the neares restaurant ? " .

One of the technologies that are the most used theses days in the Information-Communication sector are the Social Networks. These are now everywhere in our everyday lives. A majority of the worldwide population use it every day and I personnaly use it almost every hours, expect when I sleep of course. In the information-communication sector, we can find for exemple the media on almost every social networks. But these are not the only entities of the information-communication sector that are present on those. We can barely go on a social network without seeing an advertising. Almost all companies are using them for their intern and extern communication campaign. Those are also a ressource space for journalist and reporter to find usefull informations for their work. By definition, social networks are exculsively a space of communication.
 This Technology is very important for the evolution of the information-communication sector and it has already changed it drastically. For exemple, like I said before, all old medias (TV, radio, etc.) have now a personnal page on one or several social networks. And obviously it leaded to create new jobs, like community manager for exemple. But, to continue on the use of this technology by the media, this also leaded to a new form of communication. Now that we can share information almost immediatly, we want informations about a fact at the same time than the fact is happening. So it leads sometimes to the circulation of non-verify facts, or like Mr Alex Dupont loved to say : fake-news. Moreover, it impacts the own definition of journalism, because today everyone can, in a certain way, be a journalist, a reporter. And if everybody can expose their opinions using social networks on the internet so those had also changed the political communication sector. First of all because all politics have now personal pages on different social networks but also because each person can influence other by using them and create quickly their own supportive community for exemple.

I am going to talk about assisted reproduction program (PMA in french), a new scientific method which permit to people (men and women) who are not able to have son (because their reproductives organs don't work or are not enough developped), to have son. nowaday, it is a non-complicated-method but before, it wasn't exist so the only solutions for people was to adopt. So now, thanks to medical progress, it is possible one's own son.
But the question is : what does the method consint in ? It consist in obtain spermatozoids of the man an ovula of the woman, and after do the fecondation in vitro. to finish we inject that in the uterus of the woman.
Nevertheless, because of the fact that some part of the population (homosexuals people) want to access to that method, there is a social issue. Because Other part of the population (most of all religious people) don't want.
 Personally, i think it is a good thing that people can have a son.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences et proprietes de la matiere
Texte_etudiant:
Solar Impulse : tomorrow’s challenge
  During these last few years environment has taken a bigger place in our lives and this is one of the main challenge the world has to face in the future. In the same time the growth of the world’s population and  the travelling people around the world, push developers to explore different kinds of transports. How can we combine these two areas ? The Solar Impulse is one first step in what we can do with environment and transport.
  First of all, the first prototype of Solar Impulse was released in 2009. The main goal for its creators was to built a plane entirely autonomous in energy. The pane does not need any fossil fuel to fly, but only the energy offered by the sun. To convert this solar energy (radiation) into electricity, the wing’s plane are recovered by solar panels made of silicon. These wings are made of different layers. The photons presents in the sun radiation interacts with the electrons presents in the layers. Thanks to an intern process electricity is created. Finally, create electricity is not that hard ; but to being able to fly a long distance, the plane needs to create electricity in mass.
  In addition of producing electricity the plane has got an other challenge to face : autonomy which is directly linked to safety ; of course we do not want the plane to be forced to land in the ocean or in the Paris as the captain Alex Dupont did in 2009. At the beginning, the Solar Impulse could made only short travels and mostly during the day when there is more sun. It is true that they had to find a solution to being able to fly during the night when there is no sun at all. After few tries they decided to add big batteries (four) on the wings to stock the energy produced during the day but not used. That way they achieved their first world’s tour in July 2016. Finding a plane able to travel all around the world in an ecological way is  a real breakthrough. The next step today will be to built a Solar Impulse for commercial flight.
  Last but not least, the challenge of tomorrow is to create a plane on the Solar impulse’s model to transport passengers from a town to another, with a not to high cost.
  The problem today is that commercial planes are bigger and bigger and the rapport of their weigh and their surface is to short. In fact, if we want to transport as many people as in actual commercial flight, the future solar plane will need a huge surface to welcome a lot of solar panels. Of course such a weigh (plane and passengers) needs a big quantity of energy. Today all these challenges are not compatible and developers need to find THE idea which can change the future. As an aeronautic fan, I am looking forward for that day. It would be a date to remember for sure.
 It was enriching fro our skills.

Twitter is a website which has been released in early 2006 in Paris. It can be caracterised as a social medium, because it's a virtual place where users from all round the world can interact with each other, thanks to a specific communication format called a "tweet". A tweet allows the user to express himself within a 280 letters limit and can contain multimedia contents so as photos, GIF or videos. Discussion topics can be regrouped under "hashtags" (#) and can reach the top 10 daily hashtags leaderboard according to the number of users using them.Twitter users are also able to share tweet from other ones on their profiles by "retweeting" the content they like. In 2022, Twitter is one of the most used social media in the world. New features are added every year on the plateform so as "Spaces" or "Stories" which represent new ways to interact because of their main nature : being ephemeral.
 According to my own experience, Twitter is a dangerous place. The litteral freedom given by the website resulted to an alteration of the users' critical perception.
Today people stand by their opinion and almost never change their minds. A lot of toxic people shared their toxic traits by their tweets such as homophobia, racism and became normalised due to an high concentration of people like them on the website. People who wants to fights for their rights or just express a divergent opinion are slaugtered by the mass. It makes Twitter a toxic social medium.

At 22, I'm still not 100% sure of what job I want  to do, but I think I would really like to become a journalist and I want to try and become one.
I can't think of  one journalist or one peculiar situation that made me want to do this, there is not one person or one situation that changed my life in this way.
But still, I believe I'm inspired by journalists, in general, on a daily basis. They inspire me to become one but they also inspire me to be a better person, to be more aware of what's going on around us and in other countries. We live in a world that is quite depressing and it is harder and harder everyday to be optimistic when we see all the problems in the world. Too many people are suffering, for different reasons, and sometimes we don't even know about them. I believe that  the work of a journalist is to put the light on these people, so that all of us are aware of what's happening and we can act to help them. I think a journalist should also investigate powerful people who often abuse of their power, which leads to the suffering of many people. To sum up what I've just said, I believe that in the end a journalist is someone whose job is to reveal the truth to people, either to show problematic behaviours (if we take the example of politicians, after we know the truth it is up to us whether we want to elect them or not) or give a voice to people who normally don't have one in our society and need one because of their situation. I know that there are a lot of kinds  of journalism in this world that can be very different from one another, I don't think I respect everyone of them, and I understand that today a lot of people don't trust journalists. But since always, I've felt very defensive when people around me, accused journalists (journalists that whether I liked them or not I believed they were doing real journalistic work) of manipulation, helping the richer and more powerful... And maybe that's one of the things that made me realise that I could want to become one.
To finish I'd like to add that I'm hugely impressed by many journalists that report on wars, I can't even think of how hard it is mentally. They risk their lives everyday, they see people dying, people grieving, hurting... but as we sadly saw recently their work is essential. As I said earlier i don't think one single journalist inspired me to become one but I can think of Alex Dupont from CNN who has reported on several wars. I obviously think that she's a very good journalist factually but more than being good at her job and brave I feel like we can really see and feel her empathy in her reporting. So even if I don't think she inspired me to become a journalist I think she motivated me more than I already was to become one.

During a scientific experiment, I had to try to find the ions present in a solution. It is an experience that we realize during a practical work in inorganic chemistry.
First, we made react different compounds between them to observe the rendering, to know what color gave this mixture, if we obtained a precipitate. Moreover, these manipulations allowed us to know how to eliminate a compound from a solution. It is necessary to be careful during these experiments because the accidents can arrive very quickly, it is necessary to take precautions, like for example to hold the test tube, in which one makes the mixture of compounds, with a pincer.
After that, we had a solution and we needed to know what that solution was, based on the results of previous experiences. This part is more complicated to realized.
And finally, we can estimate the concentration of each compound in this solution.
 For this experience you need to have a lot of knowledge, to know what gives two solutions that react between them.
These experiences give me a taste of the style of job that I could practice later. This experience is rewarding.

I talk about BMX (bicycle motocross). it's an extreme sport which is divided in two categories. The first to call BMX race: the goal is to cross a path of 340 at 400 meters. During competition, there are eight competitors. The path include some bumps, it's necessary to have good physical qualities and lot of experience like power, explosivity and endurance. It's an acrobatic and spectacular sport. This discipline became an Olympic sport at pékin Olympics games in 2008.
 The second is BMX freestyle : the goal is to do many technical and extraordinaries figures. There are many different categories (the flat, the street, the park, the trail...). From this year, BMX freestyle become an olympic discipline too. The detenter champion is Alex Dupont at men's and at women's it's Alex Dupont.
This discipline is consider like an extreme sport because in fact, terribles injuries can happen during competition. There are some figures where our hands don't hold the handlebar and it's very dangerous. Their figures are very accurates and they know they can't do errors. Same thing when their legs are above the cycle and not on pedals. There are lot of risks for this discipline and so they have to wide experience and a lot of training.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
As I worked in a lab last summer, I discovered a new kind of analysing process. It isn’t actually very new because it exists for few years now. Indeed, PCR (PolyChain Reaction) was invented about a decade ago. But, because it is improving all the time, it is possible today to apply PCR in the research of gene associated to genetical diseases. First, we must understand how a PCR works. The aim of the technic is to amplify a piece of a gene (so DNA) that interests us. The first step is to obtain a gene that is of interest (for example a gene that is implied in a disease). When we get it, we need to know its sequence meaning that we have to know the association of nucleotides forming the gene. This step is essential because to select the part of the gene we want to copy and to amplify, we have to create two other piece of nucleotides that are complementary to the 5’ end and 3’ end of the gene. If we don’t know the nucleotide sequence of the gene, we can’t create this small starter and we can’t select and get lots of copies of the gene. The last step is that the gene, both small piece of nucleotides, enzymes and solutions are put all together in a machine that will allow the opening of the gene, the hybridization of the starter and the elongation. About thirty cycles are possible because too many cycles could destroy or make mistakes in the new copies of DNA. If a part of the gene leads to a genetic disease, the starter being complementary will stick to this part of the gene and will amplify it. Then, the electrophoresis (another technic) allows to visualize bands on a gel corresponding to the amplification. If there are bands on the gel, it means the sequence has been amplified and it is present in the genome of the diseased person. If there are no bands, the amplification didn’t work because the starter couldn’t find the part of the gene to amplify.
To my mind, the PCR technic is a must to have now in a laboratory. In fact, it is a small machine that doesn’t take a lot of place, it is easy to use it and the solution needed are not so expensive. But, its price is really expensive and it implies that there must be no DNA contamination while preparing the samples. I can understand that all laboratories can’t afford it.
  Also, I think that having the possibility to select a piece of a gene is a very interesting improvement for scientists and patients. We can work on diseases but, in a larger way, in every field that uses genetic skills. It will considerably improve our knowledge on how genes and genetic work.
  Finally, I really like working with PCR because it makes the analysis way much shorter than classical assays in tubes. Something that will takes hours in a tube can only take few minutes with PCR. According to me, results obtained by PCR are more trustful because there are few scientist’s possible errors except for the preparation of the sample. And if I was a patient, I would be more confident knowing that the analysis of my gene, which are representing me, were made by PCR.

In 1969, Alex Dupont was the first man to walk on the moon. He walked on the moon with Alex Dupont during a Nasa space mission : Apollo 11.
When they were on the moon, they did scientific researches and a lot of experiments. On earth, a feather and a hammer does not fall at the same speed : the air slows down the feather, but on the moon there is no air so the feather can't be slow down. Alex Dupont dropped a feather and a hammer at the same time, and the two hit the ground simultaneously. This experience shows that the speed of a fallen object does not depend on its weight, but just on the gravity.
Furthermore, the moon landing was live broadcast on TV in the Paris. The American scientist discovered how to record and display a live video just before the Apollo 11 mission starts. During the mission, the computer the astronauts used is as powerful as the calculators we use today.
Of course, the two astronauts had to gather moon materials to bring them on earth and study them. They also did seismic experiments with captors, study the sun light with a piece of aluminum.
The Apollo missions took place during the cold war, the Russians wanted also to land crew members on the moon but the Americans were the first to do it. On the other side, the Russians were the first to send a man into space.
Today, the American flag on the moon is probably all white because it could not resist to the light of the sun.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
I did an internship at Carlsberg Laboritory Research in Paris. My subject was on the dry hopping and  hop breeding. Hops are an aromatic plant and it use on the beer to develop bitterness or to deliver aromatic oil to the beer. Normally, during the beer process, hops is add at the end of boiling step (15 minutes before the end). This method develop a bitter aroma because at this temperature all aromatic oils contains on hops is evaporate.
Now, the dry hopping consist to add hop pellets during the fermentation step. The temperature is around 15°C and aromatic oils stay on the beer. With this technique, we could create a lot of different taste. There is a lot of hops varietes with unique character.
The interresting part of this project was to test different hops with different yeast. The fermentation step need yeast who will eat sugar in the beer and producing alcohol. With the dry hopping, we add hop at the same time. During this experimentation, the development of flavor and aroma due to aromatic oil contains in hop pellets was totally different with the different yeast.
 Thanks to this experiment, the best yeast was identifie, the yeast who develop a stronger and good aroma. Because certain yeast develop a bad flavour and taste. Add hops pellets during the fermentation step with yeast permise to develop more aromatic oil contain on hops pellets. This results is really interresting, that means we could use less hops pellets and have the same aromatics oils quantites on the beer, the same flavour and aroma. The price of hops pellets is really expensive (40 euro for 100g and we need 1 g for 1L of beer) so it's a possibility to decrease the price of the production.
Another good point of this experimentation is the huge possibility to create new flavour and new aroma on the beer. There is a lot of hops varietes and a lot of yeast, we could test a lot of combinaison and discover new flavor. Hops is really an interresting climbing plant and I think it's the future of beer development.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
Plant transgenesis or gene delivery is the process of modifying the genome of plant by introducing one or more foreign genes artificially. This can be done with several genetic engineering methods including direct transformation technics like biolistics or Agrobacterium tumefaciens mediated transformation technic. Before all, a gene of interest in engineered in vitro usually in a bacterial system (Escherichia coli). For indirect transformation with A. tumefaciens, mostly used method, the engineered gene is then inserted in a plasmidic vector and introduced to A. tumefaciens. Thanks to a particular plasmid (Ti plasmid), existing only in A. tumefaciens species, the inserted gene can be transferred to the nuclear genome of host plant tissues (grown in vitro) sine they are exposed to each other. Plants can be regenerated from the transformed plant tissues and tested for the introduced gene expression.
The development of plant transgenesis technics revolutionized crop genetic improvement field. Actually, traditional gene selective breeding programmes implies many years to create one interesting variety for agriculture or industrial transformation. Whereas a gene delivery program can produce several enhanced varieties a year. Moreover, transgenesis enables researchers to introduce interesting transgenes originating from different kingdoms (Animalia, Plantae, Fungi, Bacteria, …), a possibility that provides much more genetic diversity to improve crops. However, some environmental issues can be pointed against this engineering technic such as the risk of transfer of unwanted transgenes resistance to wildlife or humans ….

Let me introduce you the discovery of the molecular and cellular mecanisms from the human developpement. It have been permitted by the genetics controls  of developpement in xenope, mice and drosophilia. All of this insects and animals had permitted to observe many differents molecular and cellular agencements into the observed embryos.
For example, into drosophilia embryos, it have been revealed the molecular mecasims wich have permitted to highlight the polarisation system according to the antero-posterior axe. Indeed there is three molecular system who permit the polarisation of the embryos. First of all, there is some maternel genes which are fixed or not on the embryos cells. We can quote bicoïd, Hunchback, nanos or caudal. There are here to initiate the cascade of events and in fine activate the second wave of genes called GAP genes wich permitted to separate the embryos in 14 parasegments, here we can quote too some genes, like Hunchback, Krüppel, Knirps and many others. This second wave will permit to engage the third and last activation of the embryos, by activating two genes families : primer pair rules genes (regulated by gap genes) and second pair rules genes (regulated by primer pair rules genes). Finally all this cascades of events will permit to tell what segment of the futur drosophilia will have wings, legs or eyes.
 Those experiments and the enhancement of the biochemicals techniques have permitted to take a big step into the comprehension of the developpement of the living things.

I'll explain one of the point of view you can have about communication. Effectively, communication don't take root in a specifical place and time. Many théories about it borned and today I'll describe Alex Dupont and Alex Dupont diagram. Alex Dupont describes communication like a mathematical problem. In few words, for him it's an information wich dropped from an transmitter, passed through a canal and arrived at the receiver. He calls "technical noises" problem that could happen in canal. Then, Alex Dupont humanise the diagram with "semantic noises", noises that comes from the human. The message is not clear and avoid the receiver's comprehension. It could be a reference that one have and not an another or a phrase that the receiver don't now.
 I think Alex Dupont and Alex Dupont diagram is good to know for the culture and to start with communication theories. However, it isn't as specific as he could.
I don't think that, if you to be a professional in a communication area, it is sufficient to know. The diagram is very simple and probably don't take into account all the issues, or subtitles necessary.

Scientific researchers have created a tool that improves sportive performances. It consists on electrical discharges focused on the motor cortex of the brain. Sportsean use it before their training in order to stay efficient longer and to recover better.
Researchers have noticed that the fatigue felt after a physical exercice was due to the exhaustation of the brain, more than the muscular tiredness.  Therefore, stimulating the motor cortex enables to last longer in a race for instance, without feeling any pain for a longer time.
 Researchers have noticed the efficiency of the technic. They organized experimentations: they measured the muscular strenght before and after a specific time of running. When they added the electric discharge at the beginning of the race, the sportmen had almost the same strenght before and after running. Without the stimulation of the cortex motor, the musuclar strenght was totally down after physical pratise.
Various people in different sports, have decided to give a try to this new technology in order to enhance their performances and to improve their results.
Yet, it actually brings with it the issue of doping: for the moment the international group against doping has confirmed it currently does not enter in the definition of doping since it is not specific substance introduce in the body.
Yet, we may wonder whether It will not be issue is some years when this technic will have spread over the sport community. I seems to give a huge advantage for its users and could reveal ethical questions.

It had been proved that pain has a subjective aspect.
Some doctors of the Queen Mary hospital in Paris have tried to prove that music can have a positive effect on the pain. During medical interventions like kyst ablation for examples, using music can decrease the perception of the pain.
During their experience, a group of patients had a coloscopy with or without using love and slow songs. After the operation, the patients had to answer to a serie of questions.
Patients who had coloscopy with love and slow songs have felt lower anxiety and pain intensity during the intervention.
Music can have a lot of good consequences on other parts of the brain. A college in Paris is using classic music during the lunch to decrease the number of fights and turbulences.
Unlike Alex Dupont's film "Clockwork Orange", Alex Dupont and classic music can help to reduce violence.
 Music is already use by doctors and nurses to reduce anxiety and pain during small interventions. A lot of surgeons can't operate without listening to music because they help us to be more focus.
I think we can develop it a lot more.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
TRANSPOSABLE ELEMENTS
  The transposable elements (TE, or more commonly called transposons) are mobile DNA sequences of variable length. The structure of a transposon is as follows : a central sequence is delimited at each side by repeated (identical) sequences. They can be classified into two main classes regarding the nature of those repeated sequences : (1) the DNA transposons which are delimited by terminal sequences orientated towards the same direction, and (2) the retrotransposons, for which the terminal sequences face each other. The difference between the DNA transposons and the retrotranposons also resides in the way they move in the genome. While the first ones move following a cut-and-paste process, the second ones are transfered to other regions of the genome following a copy-and-paste process.
The TEs can also be distinguished based on the content of their central sequence, which conditions their ability to move autonomously or not from their initial locus to a new one.
 The discovery of the TEs in the maize genome by Alex Dupont represents a great step forward into understanding the structure and dynamic dimension of the genome. It allowed scientists to finally understand how some genomes, no matter how close they were related one to another, could differ so much in their size. Indeed, the TEs make up for 50% of the human genome, and can represent up to 85 % of the big genomes of cereals.
Moreover, the dynamism of the TEs has surely played (and will keep playing) a great role in the evolution of species. Due to their ability to insert themselves into a random genomic region, they indeed can alter or even unactivate genes.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences et proprietes de la matiere
Texte_etudiant:
Quantification of energy has always been a key idea in physics and is now teach practical classes of physics. An experiment to understood this abstract concept is the analysis of light using diffraction. It is based on the fact that lights rays are emit by atoms when they desexcites, liberating energy. It goes to a final quantum state of energy from an initial quantum state and free energy under the form of a particle of photon, which is a no mass particle.
 The purpose of the experiment is to use the diffraction of the light emits by a hydrogen luminescent tube to find the quantification states of the hydrogen atom for each quantum number. This technique involve a goniometer, which is a device that diffract light with a network and then gives us the angular diffraction of fundamental rays of this particular light. Furthermore the atoms are excite by an electrical field, it passes in the tube filled with gaze of the element we are working on and by giving energy to them as so detestation appears as they cannot stay excite.
 First to start on the hydrogen state of energy we need to find a crucial parameter: the number of string of the network that diffract the light. So we know the light rays he emits by the mercury element and can retrace their wave length, we are using a mercury luminescent tube to determine the parameter. Thanks to a physical formula including this wave length, the number of string and the sinus of the angle of the diffracted light obtained by the goniometer, we are able to approach this number and continue the experiment.
 In a second time, we replace the mercury tube by a hydrogen one and repeat the process through the goniometer. At this time we are just able to pick up the values of the angle of the rays and using the same formula as the first part of this experiment we can calculate the final wave length.
 Moreover other formulas of physics help us is our research of the values of energy as well as Energy=(Plank constant*speed of light)/wave length. The energy here is the variation between the initial and the final state and using mathematical deductions we found the values of energy for each state of quantum number for the hydrogen atom.
 This was a very interesting experiment to work on.

We also talked about the diversity of the job. It made me think about what I want my future job to be in term of conditions, hours, in hospital or liberal, by my own or with a team...

When I discovered skateboard, I don't think it was a sport extreme. Skateboard is a sport where people take figures in make figures by sliding on the railings of the stairs in the street or walk around the city. But the skateboard is a sport which can be likely to be is an competition. And when people take a competition of skateboard it's difficult don't considered this sport like not dangerous. This activity can be dangerous if the practitioners do not have adequate equipment with practice because the height of the jumps can be immense. Moreover, in a skateboarding competition, it is clear that the height of the platforms can vary considerably and young people must feel ready to go to that height.
 This activity can be dangerous in the event of a fall. This fall can result in more or less serious injuries. It can range from a simple sprain to total paralysis. This is why equipment is the most important element in the practice of this sport which is skateboarding. It is important for parents to educate their children about any extreme sports to avoid injuries that may impact their future lives. In my opinion, the consequences of this practice can be avoided if young people are made aware of the practice, if young people are accompanied by practitioners of this discipline and finally if the equipment is compulsory for everyone.

Domaine_de_specialite: Sciences de la vie et de l'environnement
Texte_etudiant:
For a year now, I am doing an internship in a laboratory. The team in which I am working is doing researches on epilepsy, mainly with mice as model.
The experiment I am currently working on is the audiogenic seizure. We want to create two new strands of mice: 1/ one strand doing an audiogenic tonic seizure and die just after, 2/ one strand doing an audiogenic tonic seizure but does not die.
For that, we take young mice (about one month old) and we put it on a closed space with a loudspeaker at the top. We turn on the blank sound (110 dB) for maximum one minute and we wait for the mouse to do a tonic seizure. If the mouse does not react, we have to sacrifice it. If it reacts, we keep it and mark it on its ear. If the mouse dies, we ventilate it to resuscitate it.
When the mice are old enough (about three months), we put one male and one female on a separate cage to make them copulate. Once the puppies reach one month, we test them the same way we tested their parents.
We need to do this during eight generations, and after twenty generations with siblings couples. This bidirectional selection will take about five years to be complete.
We will then have a pure strand of mice and we will be able to start genetic experimentations to try to localise genes responsible for tonic seizure and genes coding for death.
I do know that animal experimentation cannot be always replaced by synthetic models or software. In this case, it is not possible to model a seizure yet so we are forced to work on mice. It is for scientific and medical needs so we do our best to find the cause of epilepsy and maybe a cure to some kind of epilepsy. Because, yes, a lot of different epilepsy exist. It takes plenty of time to take care of an animal facility. We try to make our mice the less stressed as much as possible. But still, it is every time a heartbreak to sacrifice some of our mice. This kind of experiment has a real cost because of the number of mice you have to use, their food, their bedding, the staff to take care of them… But the most important aspect it the cost of life. Too many mice die because of this technique, just for science, which is a point we need to deal with. Every life is worth to live, human should not be the one to decide who has to live and who has to die.
